English: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the Son of David, the Son of Abraham
Bahnar: Yêsu Krist kon sâu pơtao Đawit, mă 'bok kơdră lu sư Abraham. Na tơ ala âu jô̆ tôm lu anăn 'bok kơdră Yêsu Krist sơ̆

English: Abraham begot Isaac, Isaac begot Jacob, and Jacob begot Judah and his brothers.
Bahnar: Abraham pơjing Isăk, Isăk pơjing Jakôp, Jakôp pơjing Juđa hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư.

English: Judah begot Perez and Zerah by Tamar, Perez begot Hezron, and Hezron begot Ram.
Bahnar: Juđa pơjing Pêres hăm Sêra, mĕ bre sư Tamar, Pêres sư pơjing Hêsrôn, Hêsrôn pơjing Ram

English: Ram begot Amminadab, Amminadab begot Nahshon, and Nahshon begot Salmon.
Bahnar: Ram pơjing Amminađap, Amminađap pơjing Nasôn, Nasôn pơjing Salmôn.

English: Salmon begot Boaz by Rahab, Boaz begot Obed by Ruth, Obed begot Jesse
Bahnar: Salmôn hăm akăn sư Rahap pơjing đei kon drŏ-nglo, anăn sư Bôas. Bôas hăm akăn sư Rut kư̆m pơjing đei kon drŏ-nglo anăn sư Ôbêt, Ôbêt pơjing Jesê.

English: and Jesse begot David the king. David the king begot Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.
Bahnar: Jesê âu boih pơjing pơtao Đawit. Akăn Đawit đơ̆ng akăn Uri sơ̆ bre sư Đawit pơjing Sôlômôn.

English: Solomon begot Rehoboam, Rehoboam begot Abijah, and Abijah begot Asa.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn pơjing Rôbôam, Rôbôam pơjing Abijah, Abijah pơjing Asa

English: Asa begot Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat begot Joram, and Joram begot Uzziah.
Bahnar: Asa pơjing Jêhôsaphat, Jêhôsaphat pơjing Jôhôram, Jôhôram pơjing Ussia

English: Uzziah begot Jotham, Jotham begot Ahaz, and Ahaz begot Hezekiah.
Bahnar: Ussia pơjing Jôtham, Jôtham pơjing Ahas, Ahas pơjing Hesekia

English: Hezekiah begot Manasseh, Manasseh begot Amon, and Amon begot Josiah.
Bahnar: Hesekia pơjing Manase, Manase pơjing Amôn, Amôn pơjing Jôsia

English: Josiah begot Jeconiah and his brothers about the time they were carried away to Babylon.
Bahnar: Jôsia pơjing Jekonia hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư. Đơ̆ng noh boih lu bơngai Babilôn rôp anhăk lu bơngai Isơrael tơ dêh lu sư.

English: And after they were brought to Babylon, Jeconiah begot Shealtiel, and Shealtiel begot Zerubbabel.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei tơ dêh Babilôn na Jekonia pơjing Sealtien, Sealtien pơjing Serupbabel

English: Zerubbabel begot Abiud, Abiud begot Eliakim, and Eliakim begot Azor.
Bahnar: Serupbabel pơjing Abiut, Abiut pơjing Êliakim, Êliakim pơjing Asôr

English: Azor begot Zadok, Zadok begot Achim, and Achim begot Eliud.
Bahnar: Asôr pơjing Satôk, Satôk pơjing Achim, Achim pơjing Êliut

English: Eliud begot Eleazar, Eleazar begot Matthan, and Matthan begot Jacob.
Bahnar: Êliut pơjing Êlêasar, Êlêasar pơjing Mathan, Mathan pơjing Jakôp

English: And Jacob begot Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus who is called Christ.
Bahnar: Jakôp pơjing Yôsep, Yôsep klo Mari. Mari pơjing Yêsu, mă đe anăn Krist. Yêsu Krist âu boih bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă pơm pơtao bơ̆n.

English: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, from David until the captivity in Babylon are fourteen generations, and from the captivity in Babylon until the Christ are fourteen generations.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Abraham truh tơ Đawit đei mơjĭt-puăn jơhnơr, đơ̆ng Đawit truh tơ đe rôp anhăk lu bơngai Isơrael tơ dêh Babilôn đei mơjĭt-puăn jơhnơr, đơ̆ng đe rôp bơngai Isơrael truh tơ đe đei tơpŭ kơ nge Yêsu Krist đei mơjĭt-puăn jơhnơr mơ̆n.

English: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was as follows: After His mother Mary was betrothed to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Đe tơpŭ kơ Yêsu sơ̆ thoi âu: Mari sơkơ̆t hăm Yôsep. Adrol kơ bre sư tơoei băl Mari băt akâu sư anăp boih, yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư thoi noh.

English: Then Joseph her husband, being a just man, and not wanting to make her a public example, was minded to put her away secretly.
Bahnar: Klo sư Yôsep bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, sư ưh kơ pơjăm Mari ngôi kư̆ kă hăm đe wă kơ sư mơlâu kơ đe ôh. Sư tơchĕng wă achăng Mari ră, mă-lei sư ưh kơ đei roi kơ đe ôh.

English: But while he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take to you Mary your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Kơplah sư oei tơchĕng tơdrong 'noh, na măng noh sư apo 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei jur khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Ơ Yôsep, kon sâu Đawit, ih 'nĕ kơ hli iŏk Mari pơm akăn ih, mă sư oei anăp dang ei noh đơ̆ng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ sư.

English: And she will bring forth a Son, and you shall call His name JESUS, for He will save His people from their sins.”
Bahnar: Sư gô tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, ih anăn Sư Yêsu, yua kơ Sư wă dŏng pơklaih bơngai bu mă lui kơ Sư đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.”

English: So all this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong 'noh 'blep trŏ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ minh 'nu bơngai khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu

English: “Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and bear a Son, and they shall call His name Immanuel,” which is translated, “God with us.”
Bahnar: “Đei minh 'nu adruh gô anăp wă tơpŭ kon drŏ-nglo, Đe anăn kon Sư noh Êmanuel,” Êmanuel wă khan: 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai hăm bơ̆n.

English: Then Joseph, being aroused from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord commanded him and took to him his wife
Bahnar: Yôsep iung đơ̆ng tep, sư pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong thoi linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ sư păng sư oei hloi kơ Mari pơm akăn sư.

English: and did not know her till she had brought forth her firstborn Son. And he called His name JESUS.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư ưh kơ đei ngôi hơdai hăm Mari truh tơ năr Mari tơpŭ kơ kon nge 'noh. Na Yôsep anăn kon nge 'noh Yêsu.

English: Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the East came to Jerusalem
Bahnar: Mari tơpŭ kơ Yêsu tơ Pơlei Betlehem lăm dêh Juđê, kơplah ei sơ̆ Hêrôt pơm pơtao tơ dêh Juđê. Đơ̆ng rŏng tơpŭ kơ Yêsu ei đei lu 'bok pơjâu hơgei hnhoi sơnglŏng, lu sư hnhoi đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem na lu sư jet đe tơ noh khan

English: saying, “Where is He who has been born King of the Jews? For we have seen His star in the East and have come to worship Him.”
Bahnar: “Tơ yơ anih mă đe 'nao tơpŭ kơ pơtao Juđê? Nhôn 'bôh sơnglŏng Sư đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch, na nhôn hnhoi sơnglŏng noh truh tơ âu wă năm kơkuh kơ Sư.”

English: When Herod the king heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao Hêrôt kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh sư sơleng kơ đon păng jơhngơ̆m sư hli. Đĭ-đăng bơngai lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem kư̆m hli lei-lăi mơ̆n.

English: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he inquired of them where the Christ was to be born.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hêrôt krao akŭm lu 'bok soi tih păng lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê na jet lu sư thoi âu: 'Bok Krist mă wă pơm pơtao bơ̆n, sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan đe wă tơpŭ kơ Sư tơ yơ?

English: So they said to him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for thus it is written by the prophet
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Tơ Pơlei Betlehem lăm dêh Juđê bơ̆n, yua kơ 'bok khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ chih roi thoi âu

English: ‘But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, Are not the least among the rulers of Judah; For out of you shall come a Ruler Who will shepherd My people Israel.’ ”
Bahnar: ‘Ơ Pơlei Betlehem lăm dêh Juđê! Pơlei iĕm ưh kơ sĭ iĕ hloh kơ pơlei đe ôh, Yua kơ đơ̆ng pơlei iĕm gô đei minh 'nu 'Bok tih tơpă, Sư wă pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael.’ ”

English: Then Herod, when he had secretly called the wise men, determined from them what time the star appeared.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na pơtao Hêrôt krao lu 'bok pơjâu hơgei hnhoi sơnglŏng akŭm kơdrô̆ lu sư, na Hêrôt jet pơnhên gah sơnglŏng noh hei lĕch layơ.

English: And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and search carefully for the young Child, and when you have found Him, bring back word to me, that I may come and worship Him also.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Hêrôt wơh lu sư năm tơ Pơlei Betlehem. Sư pơkă kơ lu đe noh thoi âu: “Iĕm năm chă kon nge 'noh tơ̆p 'bôh hŏ, mưh 'bôh boih iĕm brŏk roi kơ inh, wă kơ inh năm kơkuh kơ Sư mơ̆n.”

English: When they heard the king, they departed; and behold, the star which they had seen in the East went before them, till it came and stood over where the young Child was.
Bahnar: Đang pơtao Hêrôt khan kơ lu sư thoi noh boih, na lu sư năm. Kơplah lu sư oei nơnăm rok trong lu sư 'bôh hloi sơnglŏng ei pơchrang hơdrol hơdrol kơ lu sư. Lu sư 'nă hal dêh. Lu sư hnhoi sơnglŏng ei truh tơ Pơlei Betlehem. Lăp truh tơ kơpal bơbŭng hnam Yêsu, sơnglŏng ei dơ̆ng.

English: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.
Bahnar: Đang pơtao Hêrôt khan kơ lu sư thoi noh boih, na lu sư năm. Kơplah lu sư oei nơnăm rok trong lu sư 'bôh hloi sơnglŏng ei pơchrang hơdrol hơdrol kơ lu sư. Lu sư 'nă hal dêh. Lu sư hnhoi sơnglŏng ei truh tơ Pơlei Betlehem. Lăp truh tơ kơpal bơbŭng hnam Yêsu, sơnglŏng ei dơ̆ng.

English: And when they had come into the house, they saw the young Child with Mary His mother, and fell down and worshiped Him. And when they had opened their treasures, they presented gifts to Him: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
Bahnar: Lu sư mơ̆t lăm hnam na 'bôh hloi kon nge 'noh hăm mĕ Sư Mari. Lu sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh kơ Yêsu păng iŏk 'bar anăn pơgang 'bâu phu hăm maih đơ̆ng lăm kơdŭng lu sư pơyơ̆r kơ Yêsu.

English: Then, being divinely warned in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed for their own country another way.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok pơjâu hnhoi sơnglŏng ei tep kơmăng apo 'bôh 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ lu sư khă kuă ăn wih tơ pơtao Hêrôt. Na lu sư iung wih trong nai, wih tơ pơlei lu sư kơdih.

English: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Arise, take the young Child and His mother, flee to Egypt, and stay there until I bring you word; for Herod will seek the young Child to destroy Him.”
Bahnar: Hlôi đe noh wih boih, Yôsep tep kơmăng apo 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Jah iung, pŭ nge Yêsu hăm anhăk ba mĕ Sư jăk oei tơ dêh Êyiptơ. Iĕm oei hloi tơ noh tơ̆p inh athei iĕm wih tơ âu na iĕm wih, yua kơ dang ei Hêrôt wă chă nge Yêsu wă pơlôch.”

English: When he arose, he took the young Child and His mother by night and departed for Egypt
Bahnar: Yôsep iung đơ̆ng tep thar hơmet tơmam hloi anhăk ba nge Yêsu hăm mĕ Sư măng noh hloi na jăk oei tơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: and was there until the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, “Out of Egypt I called My Son.”
Bahnar: Lu sư oei tơ dêh Êyiptơ truh tơ pơtao Hêrôt lôch. Lu sư pơm thoi noh 'blep thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu: “Inh krao Kon Inh brŏk đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.”

English: Then Herod, when he saw that he was deceived by the wise men, was exceedingly angry; and he sent forth and put to death all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all its districts, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had determined from the wise men.
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao Hêrôt băt kơ lu 'bok pơjâu hnhoi sơnglŏng ưh pă wih tơ sư, sư ơh dêh. Na sư athei lu linh sư năm pơlôch đĭ lu kon drŏ-nglo 'nao tơpŭ truh tơ 'bar sơnăm lăm tơring Betlehem. Sư pơlôch lu kon nge 'nao tơpŭ truh tơ 'bar sơnăm noh sư băt đơ̆ng lu bơngai hnhoi sơnglŏng roi kơ sư ki.

English: Then was fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na 'blep thoi Jêrêmi chih khan sơ̆ thoi âu

English: “A voice was heard in Ramah, Lamentation, weeping, and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children, Refusing to be comforted, Because they are no more.”
Bahnar: “Đe kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ôr pơret tơ Pơlei Ramma, 'bơ̆r đe nhơ̆m hmoi ơh tơpă. Yă Rachel hmoi ơh kơ kon sư lôch, sư nhơ̆m hmoi khŏm khŏm đe ưh pă gơh pơlung sư thoi yơ, yua kơ kon sư lôch đĭ.”

English: Now when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pơtao Hêrôt lôch, Yôsep apo 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei jur khan kơ sư tơ dêh Êyiptơ

English: saying, “Arise, take the young Child and His mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who sought the young Child’s life are dead.”
Bahnar: “Iung bĕ, chông ba Yêsu hăm mĕ Sư wih dơ̆ng tơ dêh Isơrael, lu bơngai wă pơlôch Sư sơ̆ lôch đĭ boih.”

English: Then he arose, took the young Child and His mother, and came into the land of Israel.
Bahnar: Na Yôsep chông ba Yêsu hăm mĕ Sư brŏk tơ dêh Isơrael.

English: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea instead of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. And being warned by God in a dream, he turned aside into the region of Galilee.
Bahnar: Lăp Yôsep kơtơ̆ng đe khan Kêlôih kon pơtao Hêrôt wă iung pơm pơtao păl 'bă sư oei tơ dêh Juđê dơ̆ng, na Yôsep hli kơ oei tơ dêh noh. Sư đei apo 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng khan kơ sư kuă ăn oei tơ noh, athei năm oei tơ dêh Galilê.

English: In those days John the Baptist came preaching in the wilderness of Judea
Bahnar: Kơplah ei sơ̆ đei Yôhan bơngai mă pơm kơ đe 'batem, sư năm bơtho đe tơ char glă lăm dêh Juđê.

English: and saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand!”
Bahnar: Sư bơtho đe thoi âu: “Iĕm athei tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r iĕm boih.”

English: For this is he who was spoken of by the prophet Isaiah, saying: “The voice of one crying in the wilderness: ‘Prepare the way of the LORD; Make His paths straight.’ ”
Bahnar: Êsai bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư chih khan lê̆ hơdrol gah Yôhan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai bơtho tơ char glă chơngue ning-mônh khan: ‘Bĕ bơ̆n hơmet trong kơ Kră Yang, păng pơm trong Sư mă tơpăt. Wă khan lu bơ̆n tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.’ ”

English: Now John himself was clothed in camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist; and his food was locusts and wild honey.
Bahnar: Yôhan hrŭk ao tanh păng sŏk aseh lăk-đa păng tơ̆n gơ'năm akar tơ bơnei sư. Tơmam sa sư lep păng đak sut bri đĕch.

English: Then Jerusalem, all Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him
Bahnar: Lu đe năm tơ sư kơplah ei sơ̆ đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem, đơ̆ng dêh Juđê, đơ̆ng tơring krong Jôrđăn.

English: and were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.
Bahnar: Lu sư roi tơdrong yoch lu sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na Yôhan pơm kơ lu sư 'batem tơ krong Jôrđăn.

English: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, “Brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
Bahnar: Yôhan 'bôh lu bơngai Juđê mă khan sư lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong Pharisi păng lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong Sađusê, lu sư năm tơ sư wă iŏk 'batem, na Yôhan khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm âu dang lĕ kơ 'bih. Iĕm băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak iĕm ning-mônh, na iĕm mah năm tơ âu wă iŏk 'batem đĕch khan gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong phak noh hă?

English: Therefore bear fruits worthy of repentance
Bahnar: Iĕm athei tŭk lê̆ đĭ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆, na pơm mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt wă kơ đe băt kơ iĕm tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch tơpă boih.

English: and do not think to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I say to you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơhơi khan kuă kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, pơm khan sơđơ̆ng kơ Abraham 'bok bơ̆n tơbôl hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpăt, 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơm kơ tơmo âu jing kon sâu Abraham lei-lăi thoi iĕm mơ̆n. 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang kon bơngai, Sư pơlong lăng thoi âu

English: And even now the ax is laid to the root of the trees. Therefore every tree which does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
Bahnar: Sung Sư, Sư 'măn hiă rim kơ tơnơm 'long boih. Dah 'long ayơ ưh kơ đei plei 'lơ̆ng lei 'Bok Kei-Dei gô kăl tŭk 'long noh klơ̆m tơ ŭnh.

English: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance, but He who is coming after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
Bahnar: Inh pơm kơ iĕm 'batem păng đak, wă kơ đe băt kơ iĕm tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch boih. Mă-lei đei minh 'nu 'Bok wă truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh, Sư 'Bok tih tơpă. Dah Sư athei inh chĕp ăn pôm chơkhŏ Sư đĕch, inh kư̆m ưh kơ hơnhŏ 'mơ̆i, ưh kơ pơ̆n ngơk lăng Sư ôh. Sư ei gô pơm kơ iĕm 'batem thoi âu: Sư gô ăn kơ iĕm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơm kơ iĕm tŭk lê̆ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ kư̆m thoi ŭnh soh lê̆ hla đuih đăm.

English: His winnowing fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly clean out His threshing floor, and gather His wheat into the barn; but He will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
Bahnar: 'Bok ei sek tơlang kon bơngai thoi lĕ kơ Sư chĕp minh hlak kơđum wă um tŭk đĭ dôm lu 'ba bo. Na Sư iŏk lu 'ba liĕng wă tah lê̆ lăm kŭ 'ba Sư. Na dôm lu 'ba bo noh Sư wă soh tŭk đĭ tơ ŭnh mă ưh kơ layơ păt.”

English: Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan to be baptized by him.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh sơ̆, Yêsu đơ̆ng dêh Galilê năm tơ krong Jôrđăn, Sư apinh Yôhan pơm kơ Sư 'batem.

English: And John tried to prevent Him, saying, “I need to be baptized by You, and are You coming to me?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yôhan pơjăng kuă kơ pơm kơ Sư 'batem ră, na sư khan kơ Yêsu thoi âu: “Ih trŏ pơm kơ inh 'batem, na Ih khan athei inh pơm kơ Ih liơ trŏ?”

English: But Jesus answered and said to him, “Permit it to be so now, for thus it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he allowed Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Bĕ ih jah pơm kơ Inh, ba pơm kiơ̆ thoi noh, wă kơ ba pơm trŏ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei wă.” Thoi noh na Yôhan chu kơ nơ̆r Sư.

English: When He had been baptized, Jesus came up immediately from the water; and behold, the heavens were opened to Him, and He saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and alighting upon Him.
Bahnar: Hlôi Sư iŏk 'batem boih, lăp Sư iung đơ̆ng đak, na Sư 'bôh hloi plĕnh tơpơih păng 'bôh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng thoi sem kơtơp jur oei tơ Sư.

English: And suddenly a voice came from heaven, saying, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
Bahnar: Păng kư̆m đei nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng plĕnh khan: “Âu boih Kon Inh mă 'mêm kơeng tơpă, Inh lăp đon kơ Sư tôm tơdrong.”

English: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng anhăk ba Yêsu tơ char glă kơdrô̆ Sư, wă kơ yŏng pơgơ̆r yang kơnê̆ anăn sư Satan pơlong lăng Sư.

English: And when He had fasted forty days and forty nights, afterward He was hungry.
Bahnar: Yêsu ưh kơ đei sŏng sa puăn-jĭt năr puăn-jĭt măng, na Sư pơngot.

English: Now when the tempter came to Him, he said, “If You are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”
Bahnar: Na yang Satan năm tơ Sư păng khan: “Dah Ih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, Ih kuă kơ kiơ sơkat kơ tơmo âu jing 'bĕng?”

English: But He answered and said, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds from the mouth of God.’ ”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ưh ôh, yua kơ sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đei chih khan lê̆ sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Kon bơngai ưh kơ đei arih đơ̆ng tơmam sa đĕch ôh, kon bơngai arih yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn.’ ”

English: Then the devil took Him up into the holy city, set Him on the pinnacle of the temple
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh yang Satan anhăk ba Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem mă đe anăn pơlei 'Bok Kei-Dei, na yang Satan anhăk ba Yêsu tŏk tơ kơpal bơbŭng hnam akŭm tơm.

English: and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down. For it is written: ‘He shall give His angels charge over you,’ and, ‘In their hands they shall bear you up, Lest you dash your foot against a stone.’ ”
Bahnar: Yang Satan khan kơ Yêsu: “Dah Ih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, lei Ih kuă kơ kiơ kơtah đơ̆ng kơpal âu tơ teh sŭng, yua kơ đe đei chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ khan: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn linh jang 'lơ̆ng Sư wei-lăng Ih, Lu sư gô drơng iŏk Ih lăm tơpang ti lu sư, Wă kơ Ih huay kơ huŏng hơtat kơ tơmo tơ ala.’ ”

English: Jesus said to him, “It is written again, ‘You shall not tempt the LORD your God.’ ”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Ưh ôh, yua kơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đe đei chih khan thoi âu: ‘Iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơlong Kră Yang bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh.’ ”

English: Again, the devil took Him up on an exceedingly high mountain, and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.
Bahnar: Yang Satan anhăk dơ̆ng Yêsu tŏk tơ kông kơjung tơpă, sư tơ'bôh kơ Yêsu đĭ-đăng jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak kon pơlei pơla rŏ sor.

English: And he said to Him, “All these things I will give You if You will fall down and worship me.”
Bahnar: Na yang Satan khan kơ Sư: “Dah Ih chu drap tơ teh kơkuh kơ inh, lei inh gô pơjao ăn kơ Ih đĭ-đăng kơ teh đak âu hloi.”

English: Then Jesus said to him, “Away with you, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the LORD your God, and Him only you shall serve.’ ”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ơ Satan, kơdâu kơ e bĕ. Đe chih tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Bơ̆n athei kơkuh kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch. 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ wă kơ bơ̆n kơkuh kơ yang nai ôh.’ ”

English: Then the devil left Him, and behold, angels came and ministered to Him.
Bahnar: Satan kơdâu weh hloi đơ̆ng Sư, na blư bla kơ linh jang 'lơ̆ng năm tơgŭm Sư.

English: Now when Jesus heard that John had been put in prison, He departed to Galilee.
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng ang đe tah Yôhan lăm hnam phak boih, na Sư năm tơ dêh Galilê.

English: And leaving Nazareth, He came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali
Bahnar: Yêsu ưh pă oei tơ pơlei Sư Nasaret boih, na Sư năm oei tơ Pơlei Kapernum. Pơlei ei kiơ̆ jih đak dơsĭ Galilê lăm tơring Sabalôn păng tơring Naptali.

English: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying
Bahnar: Sư năm tơ noh 'blep trŏ thoi Êsai chih khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu

English: “The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, By the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles
Bahnar: “Tơring Sabalôn păng tơring Naptali, Mă oei jê̆ đak dơsĭ, pah to krong Jôrđăn lăm dêh Galilê tơmoi mă ưh kơ lui.

English: The people who sat in darkness have seen a great light, And upon those who sat in the region and shadow of death Light has dawned.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă oei lăm măng mu 'noh, Kơnh lu sư gô 'bôh tơdrong hơdah tih tơpă. Tơdrong hơdah 'noh wă pơchrang hơdah kơ lu bơngai mă oei lăm măng mu dang lĕ kơ lôch.”

English: From that time Jesus began to preach and to say, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr noh boih Yêsu pơtơm jang tơdrong Sư, Sư bơtho đe thoi âu: “Iĕm athei tơbral kơdih tôm tơdrong yoch, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r iĕm boih.”

English: And Jesus, walking by the Sea of Galilee, saw two brothers, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu năm kiơ̆ ter jih đak dơsĭ Galilê, Sư 'bôh 'bar 'nu 'nhŏng oh, anăn bre sư Simôn păng đe kư̆m anăn sư Pêtrôs, oh sư Andrê; bre sư oei traih jal chă ka lăm đak dơsĭ yua kơ bre sư bơngai juăt kơ chă ka ling-lang.

English: Then He said to them, “Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ bre sư: “Bĕ bơ̆n kiơ̆ Inh na Inh pơchĕp ăn kơ biĕm tơdrong jang traih bơngai.”

English: They immediately left their nets and followed Him.
Bahnar: Bre sư 'blă achăng lê̆ jal bre sư na kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu.

English: Going on from there, He saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them
Bahnar: Lu sư yak ataih 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng noh na tơ'bơ̆p dơ̆ng 'bar 'nu 'nhŏng oh nai. Anăn bre sư Yakơ hăm oh sư Yôhan kon Sêbêđê; bre sư oei kơpal thŏng-nan hăm 'bă sư oei hrăk ming jal, na Yêsu krao bre sư.

English: and immediately they left the boat and their father, and followed Him.
Bahnar: Na bre sư 'blă achăng tŭk jal hăm 'bă sư kơpal thŏng-nan na kiơ̆ Yêsu.

English: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all kinds of sickness and all kinds of disease among the people.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Galilê bơtho đe tơ lăm hnam akŭm đe Juđê gah tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n păng Sư pơklaih rah dôm tơdrong jĭ jăn kon pơlei pơla pơmat-tat.

English: Then His fame went throughout all Syria; and they brought to Him all sick people who were afflicted with various diseases and torments, and those who were demon-possessed, epileptics, and paralytics; and He healed them.
Bahnar: Jơ̆p kơ dêh Siri kơtơ̆ng ang Sư, na đe năm ba tơ Sư dôm lu bơngai jĭ jăn, bơngai hơwing, bơngai wơnh, bơngai jơ̆ng ti jo, Sư pơklaih ăn ngăl.

English: Great multitudes followed Him—from Galilee, and from Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan.
Bahnar: Na lơ bơngai tơpă kiơ̆ Sư, đơ̆ng dêh Galilê, mơ'nah đơ̆ng tơring Đêkapôlis, mơ'nah đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh Juđê, mơ'nah đơ̆ng pah to krong Jôrđăn.

English: And seeing the multitudes, He went up on a mountain, and when He was seated His disciples came to Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh lơ bơngai wă năm tơ Sư, na Sư tŏk tơ kông; truh kơpal kông boih na Sư tơoei wă bơtho đe, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ Sư tơ ei.

English: Then He opened His mouth and taught them, saying
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho lu bơngai ei thoi âu.

English: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, For theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Bahnar: “Pŭn dêh lu bơngai mă băt kăl kơdih kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư lui kơjăp, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: Blessed are those who mourn, For they shall be comforted.
Bahnar: “Pŭn dêh lu bơngai mă ơh sơ'ngon, 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơlung lu sư.

English: Blessed are the meek, For they shall inherit the earth.
Bahnar: “Pŭn dêh lu bơngai mă ưh kơ wă pơang akâu sư kơdih, lu sư gô đei iŏk tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.

English: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, For they shall be filled.
Bahnar: “Pŭn dêh lu bơngai 'maih pơm 'lơ̆ng thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei wă, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ sư jing 'lơ̆ng thoi noh.

English: Blessed are the merciful, For they shall obtain mercy.
Bahnar: “Pŭn dêh lu bơngai mă băt mơnat kơ đe, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m mơnat kơ lu sư mơ̆n.

English: Blessed are the pure in heart, For they shall see God.
Bahnar: “Pŭn dêh lu bơngai jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, lu sư gô 'bôh 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Blessed are the peacemakers, For they shall be called sons of God.
Bahnar: “Pŭn dêh lu bơngai gơh pơm sơlam kơ đe wă kơ lu sư tơhiôk băl, đe gô jô̆ sư kon 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake, For theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Bahnar: “Pŭn dêh lu bơngai mă đe pơmat sư yua kơ sư pơm 'lơ̆ng thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei wă, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơgơ̆r sư ling-lang.

English: “Blessed are you when they revile and persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely for My sake.
Bahnar: “Hiôk bĕ lu iĕm, mă đe pơjăm pơjuă iĕm, pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm, dah bâu roi 'bơm iĕm tôm tơdrong yua kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh.

English: Rejoice and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven, for so they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
Bahnar: 'Noh kư̆m thoi đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei kră sơ̆ thoi noh mơ̆n. Na dang ei iĕm chhôk ngă 'nă hal bĕ, yua kơ tơ Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng kơnh 'Bok Kei-Dei wă apah iĕm tơpă.

English: “You are the salt of the earth; but if the salt loses its flavor, how shall it be seasoned? It is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by men.
Bahnar: “Iĕm thoi lĕ kơ 'boh bơ̆n tah kơ tơmam sa 'băt 'lơ̆ng, wă kơ lu bơngai ala teh âu 'lơ̆ng 'biơ̆. Mă-lei dah 'boh jing sap, bơ̆n ưh kơ đei kiơ wă pơm kơ 'boh 'băt dơ̆ng. Thoi noh 'boh jing ưh pă yua boih, bơ̆n tuh hŭt lê̆ tơ teh, đe gô juă bơhlơ̆r đĕch.

English: “You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden.
Bahnar: “Lu iĕm thoi lĕ kơ hơdah jơ̆p kơ kon bơngai lăm teh đak, thoi minh pôm pơlei oei kơpal kông ưh kơ đei layơ hlơp.

English: Nor do they light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on a lampstand, and it gives light to all who are in the house.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng wă kơ hơdah, bơ̆n ưh kơ iŏk reo klơ̆p lê̆ ôh. Bơ̆n iŏk ŭnh kơđeng noh tơ'băk tơ jrăng na hơdah jơ̆p kơ bơngai lăm hnam.

English: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơchrang hơdah kơ đe tơdrong hơdah lu iĕm thoi noh mơ̆n, na đe băt kơ tơdrong iĕm pơm 'lơ̆ng, na đe bơnê hăm ư-ang kơ 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti.

English: “Do not think that I came to destroy the Law or the Prophets. I did not come to destroy but to fulfill.
Bahnar: “Iĕm 'nĕ tơchĕng 'bôh Inh truh tơ âu khan Inh wă pơrăm đĭ dôm tơdrong juăt Môis dah tơdrong lu 'bok pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆. Ưh ôh, Inh truh tơ âu kang wă jang mă tôm mă 'blep tôm tơdrong lu sư bơtho khan sơ̆.

English: For assuredly, I say to you, till heaven and earth pass away, one jot or one tittle will by no means pass from the law till all is fulfilled.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, tơdrong juăt Môis oei oei ling-lang mă truh năr tôch ning-mônh ưh kơ đei hiong minh apăk dah minh nơ̆r ôh.

English: Whoever therefore breaks one of the least of these commandments, and teaches men so, shall be called least in the kingdom of heaven; but whoever does and teaches them, he shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dah bu tŭk minh apăk dah minh nơ̆r tơdrong juăt iĕ ioch păng sư bơtho đe wă kơ đe tŭk mơ̆n, bơngai 'noh 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư bơngai iĕ hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lăm lu bơngai lui. Mă-lei dah bu kiơ̆ trŏ kơ tơdrong juăt păng sư bơtho đe wă kơ đe pơm kiơ̆ mă trŏ mơ̆n, bơngai 'noh gơh pơm tih lăm lu bơngai lui.

English: For I say to you, that unless your righteousness exceeds the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, you will by no means enter the kingdom of heaven.
Bahnar: Lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu bơngai Juđê mă lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong Pharisi, lu sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt tơpă ôh. Na Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, dah iĕm ưh kơ adrin kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt hloh kơ lu đe noh, lei iĕm ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh.

English: “You have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not murder, and whoever murders will be in danger of the judgment.’
Bahnar: “Iĕm kơtơ̆ng boih đe bơtho tơdrong juăt kră sơ̆ khan: ‘Iĕm 'nĕ pơlôch đe,’ ‘dah bơngai bu pơlôch đe bơngai 'noh đe rôp sek tơlang sư.’

English: But I say to you that whoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment. And whoever says to his brother, ‘Raca!’ shall be in danger of the council. But whoever says, ‘You fool!’ shall be in danger of hell fire.
Bahnar: Na Inh bơtho iĕm dang ei thoi âu: Bơngai bu hil areh kơ 'nhŏng oh sư, bơngai 'noh trŏ kơ đe kư̆m rôp sek tơlang sư mơ̆n; bơngai bu pơjăm pơjuă 'nhŏng oh sư, bơngai 'noh trŏ kơ đe rôp sư tŏk sek tơlang tơ lu 'bok tih; bơngai bu pơjăm pơjuă 'nhŏng oh sư kơtul kơhlôh kơwao, lu bơngai thoi noh trŏ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak sư lăm dơnâu ŭnh ning-mônh.

English: Therefore if you bring your gift to the altar, and there remember that your brother has something against you
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dah iĕm đei tơmam kiơ kiơ wă pơyơ̆r tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei, na iĕm 'blŏk kơ 'nhŏng oh iĕm đei tơdrong ơh kơ iĕm

English: leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.
Bahnar: iĕm 'măn lê̆ tơmam lăm noh, lĕch kơdâu năm pơlung sư 'mơ̆i, na mơ̆t pơyơ̆r tơmam iĕm noh.

English: Agree with your adversary quickly, while you are on the way with him, lest your adversary deliver you to the judge, the judge hand you over to the officer, and you be thrown into prison.
Bahnar: “Dah đe năm apinh tơmam đêl iĕm hre kơ đe, na iĕm jah pơđang tơdrong hre noh hloi, 'nĕ kơ gô sư anhăk iĕm tơ 'bok sek tơlang, hli kơ đe gô rôp tah iĕm tơ hnam phak.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, you will by no means get out of there till you have paid the last penny.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đe oei phak iĕm khŏm khŏm 'mơ̆i, tơ̆p iĕm chu duh tôm 'mơ̆i, na đe tơlĕch tơlăi iĕm.

English: “You have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’
Bahnar: “Iĕm kơtơ̆ng boih tơdrong juăt đe bơtho khan: ‘Iĕm 'nĕ plah klo kăn đe.’

English: But I say to you that whoever looks at a woman to lust for her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
Bahnar: Na Inh bơtho iĕm dang ei thoi âu: Bơngai bu 'bôh drŏ-kăn, rŏ kơ ngôi hăm sư, bơngai 'noh yoch boih, bơngai 'noh dang lĕ pơm kư̆ kă hăm drŏ-kăn boih.

English: If your right eye causes you to sin, pluck it out and cast it from you; for it is more profitable for you that one of your members perish, than for your whole body to be cast into hell.
Bahnar: Dah minh pah măt iĕm gah 'ma pơm kơ iĕm yoch, kuek tŭk minh pah măt iĕm noh, na oei pă minh pah măt, 'noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ iĕm oei tôm 'bar pah măt, mă-lei wă huŏng pơđĭ hăm akâu tơ lăm dơnâu ŭnh 'Bok Kei-Dei phak.

English: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and cast it from you; for it is more profitable for you that one of your members perish, than for your whole body to be cast into hell.
Bahnar: Dah minh pah ti iĕm gah 'ma pơm kơ iĕm yoch, chơ̆ng lê̆ minh pah ti iĕm noh, na oei pă minh pah ti, 'noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ iĕm oei tôm 'bar pah ti mă-lei wă huŏng pơđĭ hăm akâu tơ lăm dơnâu ŭnh 'Bok Kei-Dei phak.

English: “Furthermore it has been said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.’
Bahnar: “Đe đei bơtho sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Bơngai bu wă achăng akăn sư, sư athei pơm hla bơar mă trŏ 'mơ̆i na gơh achăng.’

English: But I say to you that whoever divorces his wife for any reason except sexual immorality causes her to commit adultery; and whoever marries a woman who is divorced commits adultery.
Bahnar: Na Inh bơtho iĕm dang ei thoi âu: Akăn sư ưh kơ đei pơm yoch kơ sư, mă-lei klo sư achăng tŭk, na akăn sư jing iŏk klo plơ̆ng, na klo kăn mă đơ̆ng rŏng noh kư̆m dang pơm yoch mơ̆n, yua kơ klo sư hơdrol achăng ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong achăng, na 'Bok Kei-Dei oei jô̆ bre sư klo kăn so đĕch. Mă-lei tơdrong yoch lu sư noh, klo sư mă hơdrol pơm kơ lu sư jing yoch đĭ-đăng.

English: “Again you have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not swear falsely, but shall perform your oaths to the Lord.’
Bahnar: “Iĕm kơtơ̆ng boih tơdrong đe bơtho lu khŭl kră sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Bu pơkă kơ đe mah hiap akâu sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơngai noh ưh kơ gơh hơlĕnh, ưh kơ gơh anul ôh, bơngai noh athei pơm 'blep thoi sư pơkă tơpă.’

English: But I say to you, do not swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is God’s throne
Bahnar: Na Inh bơtho iĕm dang ei thoi âu: Dôm tơdrong iĕm pơkă wă kơ đe băt kơ iĕm gô pơm, iĕm 'nĕ pă hiap akâu kơdih kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei dah hiap akâu kơ tơdrong kiơ nai. Thoi noh na iĕm 'nĕ pă pơkă pao anăn plĕnh, yua kơ plĕnh dang tang-dŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơoei, noh dang iĕm pơkă pao anăn 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: nor by the earth, for it is His footstool; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pă pơkă pao anăn teh yua kơ teh âu dang anih Sư 'măn wă pioh jơ̆ng. 'Nĕ pă pơkă pao anăn Pơlei Jêrusalem, yua kơ pơlei noh jơ̆ pơlei Pơtao tih.

English: Nor shall you swear by your head, because you cannot make one hair white or black.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ pă pơkă pao kơ̆l iĕm, yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ gơh pơm kơ minh dăng sŏk găm dah kok, 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch gơh pơm tơdrong noh.

English: But let your ‘Yes’ be ‘Yes,’ and your ‘No,’ ‘No.’ For whatever is more than these is from the evil one.
Bahnar: Iĕm wă pơkă kơ đe tơdrong kiơ kiơ, iĕm athei pơkă mă tơpăt hăm 'bơ̆r hoh đĕch, 'nĕ pă pơkă pao anăn 'Bok Kei-Dei dah tơdrong kiơ kiơ nai. Dah iĕm pơkă kơ đe thoi noh hei, 'noh đơ̆ng yang kơnê̆ pơhlŭ iĕm pơm thoi noh đĕch.

English: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
Bahnar: “Iĕm kơtơ̆ng boih tơdrong đe bơtho thoi âu: ‘Bu pơrăm măt đe, đe pơrăm măt sư mơ̆n; bu pơrăm sơnĕnh đe, đe pơrăm sơnĕnh sư mơ̆n.’

English: But I tell you not to resist an evil person. But whoever slaps you on your right cheek, turn the other to him also.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na gah Inh bơtho iĕm thoi âu: Đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm, iĕm 'nĕ pơm plơ̆ kơ đe; đe tap 'bŏ iĕm gah 'ma, ăn sư tap gah minh dơ̆ng.

English: If anyone wants to sue you and take away your tunic, let him have your cloak also.
Bahnar: Bu kêng iĕm tơ đe kră wă kơ iĕm duh kơ sư minh blah ao, iĕm athei ăn đĭ hloi 'bar blah.

English: And whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two.
Bahnar: Lu linh pơgŏ wă kơ iĕm kiơ̆ tơgŭm sư dang minh kơsô̆, iĕm athei pơhloh truh 'bar kơsô̆.

English: Give to him who asks you, and from him who wants to borrow from you do not turn away.
Bahnar: Bu apinh tơmam iĕm, iĕm athei asong; bu apinh mơng, iĕm athei ăn 'bônh.

English: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’
Bahnar: “Păng iĕm kư̆m kơtơ̆ng boih tơdrong đe bơtho sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Athei 'mêm kơ bôl juăt, areh kơ bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ bơ̆n.’

English: But I say to you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who spitefully use you and persecute you
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah Inh bơtho iĕm thoi âu: Iĕm athei 'mêm mơnat kơ lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm, krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư

English: that you may be sons of your Father in heaven; for He makes His sun rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.
Bahnar: thoi noh na iĕm gơh jing kon 'Bok Kei-Dei 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti, yua kơ Sư kư̆m 'mêm kơ lu bơngai noh, na Sư ăn măt 'năr pơchrang hơdah kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai, mă bơngai 'lơ̆ng mă bơngai kơnê̆. Sư ăn đak 'mi lei-lăi mơ̆n ưh kơ 'mêm kơ bu wă pơdê bu ôh.

English: For if you love those who love you, what reward have you? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?
Bahnar: Dah iĕm 'mêm pôm lu bơngai mă 'mêm kơ iĕm đĕch, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ bơnê kơ iĕm ôh. Bĭ lu bơngai pơgŏ iŏk jên thuê̆ kư̆m băt 'mêm kơ bôl sư.

English: And if you greet your brethren only, what do you do more than others? Do not even the tax collectors do so?
Bahnar: Dah iĕm bôl tơduă lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm đĕch, lei 'Bok Kei-Dei lăng iĕm ưh kơ đei pha kiơ ôh. Lei lu bơngai mă ưh kơ lui kư̆m pơm thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Therefore you shall be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei 'mêm kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai kư̆m thoi 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti 'mêm kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: “Take heed that you do not do your charitable deeds before men, to be seen by them. Otherwise you have no reward from your Father in heaven.
Bahnar: “Iĕm athei kơchăng, 'nĕ pơang tơdrong 'lơ̆ng iĕm pơm kơ đe 'bôh; dah iĕm pơang tơ'bôh kơ đe tơdrong 'lơ̆ng iĕm pơm, lei 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti ưh kơ bơnê kơ iĕm ôh.

English: Therefore, when you do a charitable deed, do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory from men. Assuredly, I say to you, they have their reward.
Bahnar: Yua thoi noh na mưh iĕm wă tơgŭm đe tơmam, dah jên, iĕm 'nĕ ăn 'bơ̆t anăp đe bôl buăl 'bôh thoi lu bơngai pơang akâu kơdih lu sư chă ăn kơ đe tơmam tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei, tơ kơphô̆, tơ kơchơ, wă kơ đe ư-ang kơ sư khan sư bơngai băt tơgŭm đe. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, lu bơngai mă pơang kơ đe thoi noh tơdrong bơnê lu sư jơ̆ lu đe mă ư-ang kơ sư noh đĕch, ưh kơ đei đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei bơnê ôh.

English: But when you do a charitable deed, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing
Bahnar: Dah iĕm wă tơgŭm đe tơmam, dah jên, iĕm 'nĕ roi kơ đe, mă bôl juăt kơdih kư̆m 'nĕ kơ roi.

English: that your charitable deed may be in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will Himself reward you openly.
Bahnar: Iĕm thĕng đĕch mă-lei 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti 'bôh boih tơdrong iĕm pơm 'noh, thoi noh na Sư gô bơnê kơ iĕm tơpă.

English: “And when you pray, you shall not be like the hypocrites. For they love to pray standing in the synagogues and on the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Assuredly, I say to you, they have their reward.
Bahnar: “Iĕm 'nĕ krao khan thoi lu bơngai pơang akâu, lu sư wă kơ đe ư-ang kơ sư na lu sư pơm iung dơ̆ng krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bơ̆t anăp bôl tơ lăm hnam akŭm, phŏ tơ kơphô̆, phŏ tơ kơchơ, wă kơ đe 'bôh na ư-ang kơ sư khan sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, lu bơngai thoi noh tơdrong bơnê lu sư jơ̆ lu đe mă ư-ang kơ sư noh đĕch, ưh kơ đei đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei bơnê ôh.

English: But you, when you pray, go into your room, and when you have shut your door, pray to your Father who is in the secret place; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm wă krao khan, iĕm athei tang 'măng kơdrô̆ tơ anih hrĕp. Iĕm krao khan thoi noh na iĕm tơchĕng truh tơ 'Bă bơ̆n Yang mă bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh 'bôh. Mă iĕm krao khan tơ anih hrĕp Sư kư̆m 'bôh mơ̆n, Sư ăn tơdrong iĕm apinh noh tơpă.

English: And when you pray, do not use vain repetitions as the heathen do. For they think that they will be heard for their many words.
Bahnar: “Kơplah iĕm krao khan, iĕm athei tơchĕng tơpă tơdrong iĕm krao khan noh, 'nĕ pơma pơlơ̆k pơle đon tơchĕng tơ nai thoi bơngai kơkuh kơ yang nai, yua kơ lu sư tơchĕng ăp kơ pơma pơlơ̆k pơle lơ 'mơ̆i na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn.

English: “Therefore do not be like them. For your Father knows the things you have need of before you ask Him.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ krao khan thoi noh hŏ, yua kơ 'Bă bơ̆n băt hơdrol kơ tơdrong iĕm wă krao khan apinh Sư noh.

English: In this manner, therefore, pray: Our Father in heaven, Hallowed be Your name.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei krao khan thoi âu: ‘Ơ 'Bă lu nhôn mă oei tơ plĕnh ti, ăn anăn Ih jing ư-ang.

English: Your kingdom come. Your will be done On earth as it is in heaven.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ dêh char Ih tĕnh truh. Ăn kơ tơdrong tơchĕng Ih gơh jing, mă tơ teh âu kư̆m thoi tơ plĕnh ti.

English: Give us this day our daily bread.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih ăn kơ nhôn năr 'nâu đei sŏng sa mah.

English: And forgive us our debts, As we forgive our debtors.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'nĕ jô̆ yo kơ nhôn, thoi nhôn ưh kơ jô̆ yo kơ đe pơm yoch păng nhôn.

English: And do not lead us into temptation, But deliver us from the evil one. For Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen.
Bahnar: Apinh Ih 'nĕ ăn kơ nhôn lui kơ đe pơhlŭ pơlung. Apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih nhôn đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆, kơlih kơ dêh char Ih, tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Ih, tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ Ih oei tơ Ih ling-lang. A-men.’

English: “For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
Bahnar: “Dah iĕm huay kơ jô̆ yo kơ đe pơm yoch kơ iĕm, lei 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti kư̆m huay kơ jô̆ yo kơ iĕm mơ̆n.

English: But if you do not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm oei jô̆ yo kơ đe pơm yoch kơ iĕm, lei 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti kư̆m jô̆ yo kơ tơdrong yoch iĕm mơ̆n.

English: “Moreover, when you fast, do not be like the hypocrites, with a sad countenance. For they disfigure their faces that they may appear to men to be fasting. Assuredly, I say to you, they have their reward.
Bahnar: “Năr iĕm ơ̆t kơ por wă kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, iĕm 'nĕ pơm đon sơ'ngon thoi lu bơngai pơang akâu. Lu sư pơm kơ akâu akar muh măt sư sơ'ngon, wă kơ đe băt tơdrong lu sư ơ̆t kơ por. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, lu bơngai thoi noh tơdrong bơnê lu sư jơ̆ lu đe mă ư-ang kơ sư noh đĕch, ưh kơ đei đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei bơnê ôh.

English: But you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face
Bahnar: Năr iĕm ơ̆t kơ por iĕm athei 'nhao muh măt kor sŏk mă 'lơ̆ng hơnơ̆ng

English: so that you do not appear to men to be fasting, but to your Father who is in the secret place; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.
Bahnar: wă kơ đe ưh kơ băt tơdrong iĕm ơ̆t kơ por. Thoi noh na 'Bă bơ̆n Yang mă iĕm ưh kơ gơh 'bôh, Sư 'bôh tơdrong hrĕp iĕm pơm noh na Sư mơnat, Sư asong tơdrong iĕm apinh Sư noh tơpă.

English: “Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal
Bahnar: “Iĕm 'nĕ chă mong mŭk tơmam dah jên tơ teh âu lơ, yua kơ tơ teh âu đei sang-sa, mua reh, hăm hli kơ đe iŏk tơtông mơ̆n.

English: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys and where thieves do not break in and steal.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei chă mong mŭk tơmam tơ plĕnh ti đĕch huay kơ đei sang-sa, mua reh, hăm ưh kơ đei bu gơh iŏk tơtông.

English: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm đei mŭk tơmam tơ plĕnh ti, jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm kư̆m tơchĕng tơ noh mơ̆n. Dah iĕm đei mŭk tơmam tơ teh âu, jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm kư̆m tơchĕng tơ teh âu mơ̆n.

English: “The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is good, your whole body will be full of light.
Bahnar: “Măt pơm ŭnh kơđeng kơ akâu bơ̆n. Dah măt bơ̆n hơdah 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ hưch hanh tơdrong ala teh, lei tôm tơdrong akâu bơ̆n jang kư̆m 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: But if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is that darkness!
Bahnar: Dah măt bơ̆n hưch hanh tơdrong ala teh đĕch lei măt bơ̆n dang tol, tôm tơdrong akâu bơ̆n jang kư̆m ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, dang bơ̆n oei lăm măng mu đĕch.

English: “No one can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will be loyal to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.
Bahnar: “Minh 'nu đĭch ưh kơ gơh jang kơ 'bar 'nu yŏng ôh, hli kơ sư 'mêm kơ yŏng âu, areh kơ yŏng to; chu yom kơ yŏng to, pơjăm pơjuă yŏng âu. Na mŭk tơmam kư̆m dang pơm yŏng mơ̆n. Dah iĕm băt 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Yŏng iĕm tơpă lei iĕm ưh kơ 'mêm kơ dôm mŭk tơmam tơ ala teh âu ôh.

English: “Therefore I say to you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat or what you will drink; nor about your body, what you will put on. Is not life more than food and the body more than clothing?
Bahnar: “Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh wă khan kơ iĕm, 'nĕ tơchĕng kơ tơmam sŏng sa, 'nĕ tơchĕng kơ hơbĕn ao hrŭk. 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơjing iĕm arih, Sư kư̆m băt ăn kơ iĕm tơmam sa mơ̆n, Sư kư̆m băt ăn kơ iĕm hơbĕn ao hrŭk mơ̆n.

English: Look at the birds of the air, for they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?
Bahnar: Iĕm lăng lu sem păr, sư ưh kơ đei pơtăm 'ba, ưh kơ đei kĕch 'măn lê̆ tơ kŭ ôh, mă-lei 'Bă bơ̆n mă oei tơ plĕnh ti kư̆m hiĕm 'me sư mơ̆n. Pơma kiơ kơ iĕm, 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti Sư 'mêm kơ iĕm hloh kơ lu sem păr tơpă.

English: Which of you by worrying can add one cubit to his stature?
Bahnar: Iĕm tơchĕng dêh gah tơdrong arih. Mă iĕm nŏng tơchĕng dang yơ gah tơdrong arih noh ră, kư̆m ưh kơ đei yua tơgŭm iĕm arih đunh 'biơ̆ hơya minh năr ôh.

English: “So why do you worry about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin
Bahnar: “Bĭ gah hơbĕn ao hrŭk, iĕm mah tơchĕng kơ kiơ? Iĕm lăng lu pơkao 'nhĕt tơ bri brah. Sư ưh kơ bơ̆jang, ưh kơ tanh sĭt hơbĕn ao sư kơdih ôh, mă-lei bơ̆n lăng sư 'lơ̆ng dêh.

English: and yet I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, pơtao Sôlômôn sơ̆ sư mơdrŏng tih tơpă, mă-lei hơbĕn ao sư ưh kơ mah 'lơ̆ng dang pơkao 'nhĕt bri brah ôh.

English: Now if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today is, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will He not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?
Bahnar: Tơdrong lui iĕm rơdu dêh, iĕm kuă kơ kiơ tơchĕng kơ lu pơkao 'nhĕt bri brah: Sư 'bônh kơ hơlŭng, klaih hơlŭng đe soh hŭt lê̆ lăm ŭnh, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ăn kơ sư 'lơ̆ng dang noh, pơma kiơ kơ iĕm kon bơngai kăl hloh kơ sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ iĕm hơbĕn ao tơpă.

English: “Therefore do not worry, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wear?’
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm 'nĕ pă tơchĕng khan: ‘Bơ̆n wă sa kiơ, hrŭk kiơ?’

English: For after all these things the Gentiles seek. For your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai nai mă ưh kơ lui, lu sư tơchĕng kơ tơdrong noh ling-lang. Mă-lei 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti kư̆m băt boih dôm tơdrong lu iĕm kăl yua, Sư gô tơgŭm iĕm tơpă.

English: But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things shall be added to you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei ăn kơ Sư pơgơ̆r iĕm, hăm adrin pơm 'lơ̆ng thoi Sư wă, noh kăl hloh kơ dôm tơdrong nai; pơm thoi noh na Sư gô ăn kơ iĕm tôm tơmam iĕm kăl yua.

English: Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about its own things. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp, iĕm 'nĕ pă tơchĕng minh tơdrong kiơ kiơ. Năr dơning măk ai kơ năr dơning, năr âu măk ai kơ năr âu, yua kơ tơdrong kơ'bah bơ̆n rim năr đĕch.

English: “Judge not, that you be not judged.
Bahnar: “Iĕm 'nĕ bâu roi đe, khan đe bơngai ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng. Dah iĕm jô̆ kơ đe bơngai ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, kơnh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m jô̆ kơ iĕm bơngai ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: For with what judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with the measure you use, it will be measured back to you.
Bahnar: Iĕm jô̆ kơ đe thoi yơ, 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ kơ iĕm thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: And why do you look at the speck in your brother’s eye, but do not consider the plank in your own eye?
Bahnar: Lơliơ iĕm jô̆ kơ 'nhŏng oh iĕm đei tơdrong yoch mă iĕm đei tơdrong yoch tih hloh kơ sư dơ̆ng, dang iĕm 'bôh 'bruih iĕ đom lăm klong măt 'nhŏng oh iĕm, mă iĕm ưh kơ mơn kơ 'long tih oei đom lăm klong măt iĕm kơdih?

English: Or how can you say to your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye’; and look, a plank is in your own eye?
Bahnar: Lơliơ iĕm pơ̆n khan kơ 'nhŏng oh iĕm khan: ‘Lê̆ inh iŏk 'bruih đom lăm klong măt ih,’ lăm klong măt iĕm kơdih 'long tih đom ră mă-lei kơdih iĕm ưh kơ mơn?

English: Hypocrite! First remove the plank from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother’s eye.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh, iĕm iŏk tŭk 'long tih đom lăm klong măt iĕm 'mơ̆i na iĕm gơh 'bôh hơdah iŏk tŭk 'bruih iĕ đom lăm klong măt 'nhŏng oh iĕm.

English: “Do not give what is holy to the dogs; nor cast your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you in pieces.
Bahnar: “Iĕm 'nĕ pă bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ lu bơngai mă ưh kơ lui mă wă pơjăm pơjuă iĕm ling-lang. 'Noh dang bơ̆n tŭk 'nhĕm giĕng ăn kơ kŏ sa, dang dơmŏng đe gĭt mă ăn kơ nhŭng, hli kơ lu sư pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm dơ̆ng.

English: “Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
Bahnar: “Krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei khŏm khŏm na Sư gô asong kơ iĕm. Iĕm nŏng kơ chă khŏm khŏm, Sư gô tơ'bôh kơ iĕm. Iĕm dơdŭ 'măng Sư khŏm khŏm, na Sư gô pơih ăn.

English: For everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks it will be opened.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ kiơ, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô asong. Bơngai bu chă kiơ kiơ, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơ'bôh ăn. Bơngai bu dơdŭ 'măng 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơih ăn.

English: Or what man is there among you who, if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?
Bahnar: Na bĭ lăm lu iĕm hăm đei bu kon sư apinh por mă ăn tơmo?

English: Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent?
Bahnar: Kon sư apinh ka mă ăn 'bih kơep?

English: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask Him!
Bahnar: Iĕm bơngai kơnê̆ ră mă-lei iĕm kư̆m băt chă ăn kơ kon iĕm tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng, pơma kiơ kơ 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti, Sư asong ăn kơ bơ̆n tơmam 'lơ̆ng tơpă dôm lu bơngai mă krao khan apinh Sư, Sư ưh kơ kret ôh.

English: Therefore, whatever you want men to do to you, do also to them, for this is the Law and the Prophets.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na mă dôm tơdrong kiơ iĕm wă kơ đe pơm tơgŭm iĕm, iĕm athei pơm tơgŭm đe lei-lăi thoi noh. 'Noh trŏ kơ tơdrong juăt Môis păng tơdrong lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.

English: “Enter by the narrow gate; for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and there are many who go in by it.
Bahnar: “Iĕm athei adrin mơ̆t trong 'măng iĕ mă năm tơ anih arih ling-lang. Trong 'măng tih mơ̆t 'bônh ră, mă-lei năm tơ dơnâu ŭnh 'Bok Kei-Dei phak, kư̆m lơ bơngai năm trong noh.

English: Because narrow is the gate and difficult is the way which leads to life, and there are few who find it.
Bahnar: Trong 'măng mơ̆t tơ anih arih ling-lang iĕ păng anat kơ yak tơpă, na hui bơngai 'bôh 'măng iĕ noh.

English: “Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves.
Bahnar: “Iĕm kơchăng kơ lu bơngai hơlĕnh khan sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh. Bơ̆n lăng gah 'ngoaih sư hơbŏ dim thoi triu, mă-lei lăm to sư dang kŏ-so 'maih chă kăp đe.

English: You will know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes from thornbushes or figs from thistles?
Bahnar: Iĕm băt kơ sư bơngai kơnê̆, yua kơ iĕm 'bôh tơdrong kơnê̆ sư pơm. Kư̆m thoi lu 'long, khŭl 'long jơla ưh kơ gơh pơjing plei hơmu ôh; thoi lĕ kơ 'long bơmrôm sư ưh kơ gơh pơjing plei hơra ôh.

English: Even so, every good tree bears good fruit, but a bad tree bears bad fruit.
Bahnar: 'Long 'lơ̆ng pơjing plei 'lơ̆ng, 'long kơnê̆ pơjing plei kơnê̆.

English: A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit.
Bahnar: 'Long 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ gơh pơjing plei kơnê̆, 'long kơnê̆ ưh kơ gơh pơjing plei 'lơ̆ng.

English: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
Bahnar: 'Long ayơ mă ưh kơ pơjing plei 'lơ̆ng, 'long 'noh đe kăl 'buh tŭk lăm ŭnh.

English: Therefore by their fruits you will know them.
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi lu 'long 'noh mơ̆n, lu bơngai hơlĕnh khan sư pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơ̆n 'bôh dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ sư pơm na bơ̆n băt sư bơngai kơnê̆.

English: “Not everyone who says to Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ shall enter the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of My Father in heaven.
Bahnar: “Ưh kơ sĭ dôm lu bơngai mă krao Inh Kră Yang gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei pơđĭ ôh. Pôm lu bơngai mă lui kiơ̆ kơ 'Bă Inh đĕch gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh char Sư noh.

English: Many will say to Me in that day, ‘Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in Your name, cast out demons in Your name, and done many wonders in Your name?’
Bahnar: Năr tôch ning-mônh đei lơ bơngai pơma lung Inh thoi âu: ‘Ơ Kră Yang, nhôn yua anăn Ih pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, nhôn yua anăn Ih pơpuh yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu bơngai păng nhôn pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang nai yua anăn Ih.’

English: And then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you; depart from Me, you who practice lawlessness!’
Bahnar: Mă-lei năr 'noh kơnh Inh gô khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: ‘Inh ưh kơ băt kơ lu iĕm âu ôh. Weh tơ nai năm, iĕm bơngai kơnê̆ ngăl.’

English: “Therefore whoever hears these sayings of Mine, and does them, I will liken him to a wise man who built his house on the rock
Bahnar: “Bơngai bu mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh bơtho, na kiơ̆ hloi, bơngai 'noh dang bơngai hơgei pơm hnam kơpal tơmo kŭk.

English: and the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house; and it did not fall, for it was founded on the rock.
Bahnar: Mă 'mi tih, mă đak lơ̆p, mă kial hơbŭt kư̆m ưh kơ hơlŭng, ưh kơ păk ôh, yua kơ sư pơm klop kơ tơmo kŭk.

English: “But everyone who hears these sayings of Mine, and does not do them, will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh bơtho, mă ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆, bơngai 'noh thoi bơngai kơtul pơm hnam tơ pơlao chuơh.

English: and the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house; and it fell. And great was its fall.”
Bahnar: Na mưh truh bơyan 'mi tih, đak lơ̆p, kial hơbŭt, hnam 'noh hơlŭng păk pơchah hoch đĭ.”

English: And so it was, when Jesus had ended these sayings, that the people were astonished at His teaching
Bahnar: Hlôi Yêsu bơtho đang boih, na lu bơngai tơpôl ei mah chrêu kơ đon tơdrong Sư bơtho noh

English: for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
Bahnar: yua kơ Sư bơtho hơgei thoi lĕ Sư băt kơdih, ưh kơ thoi lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê chă bơtho đe.

English: When He had come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed Him.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu jur đơ̆ng kông lu bơngai tơpôl lơ noh kư̆m jur kiơ̆ Sư mơ̆n.

English: And behold, a leper came and worshiped Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đei minh 'nu bơngai jĭ chin năm jê̆ Sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng păng khan: “Ơ 'Bok, dah Ih wă, Ih gơh pơklaih inh.”

English: Then Jesus put out His hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing; be cleansed.” Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu chro ti pel bơngai ei păng khan: “Inh wă tơpă pơklaih ih, Inh pơklaih ih dang ei.” Na bơngai jĭ ei klaih kơtă hloi.

English: And Jesus said to him, “See that you tell no one; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ih 'nĕ chă roi kơ đe. Dang ei ih klaih boih na ih năm tơ'bôh akâu ih kơ 'bok soi păng ih soi sơmah kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ thoi Môis pơkă sơ̆ wă kơ đe băt tơdrong jĭ ih klaih tơpă boih.”

English: Now when Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, pleading with Him
Bahnar: Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei Kapernum. Tơ ei đei minh 'nu 'bok tih linh sư bơngai Rôm, chă Yêsu. Lăp 'bôh boih na sư apinh thoi âu

English: saying, “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, dreadfully tormented.”
Bahnar: “Ơ 'Bok, đĭch inh păn kơ jĭ tơ hnam pă kĕ iung.”

English: And Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ŏ, Inh năm pơklaih sư.”

English: The centurion answered and said, “Lord, I am not worthy that You should come under my roof. But only speak a word, and my servant will be healed.
Bahnar: 'Bok tih linh ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok, inh ưh kơ hơnhŏ wă anhăk ba Ih tơ hnam inh ôh, inh wă kơ Ih sơkat đơ̆ng âu đĕch na sư tơ hnam klaih.

English: For I also am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m đei đe pơgơ̆r inh păng inh kư̆m đei pơgơ̆r lu linh mơ̆n. Dah inh khan kơ bơngai âu mă bơngai to: Năm bĕ, sư năm hloi chu inh. Dah inh bơtho lu đĭch đam inh jang, mă dôm tơdrong kiơ, lu sư jang hloi. Inh wă kơ thoi noh đĕch, na dang ei inh wă kơ Ih sơkat đơ̆ng âu đĕch na sư tơ hnam klaih.”

English: When Jesus heard it, He marveled, and said to those who followed, “Assuredly, I say to you, I have not found such great faith, not even in Israel!
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng 'bok tih linh khan thoi noh, Sư mah hlĭch kơ đon yua kơ 'bok noh đei đon lui tơpă. Thoi noh na Sư khan kơ lu bơngai kiơ̆ ei: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đơ̆ng sơ̆ Inh tam mă 'bôh ôh khŭl bơngai Juđê lui kơjăp dang bơngai Rôm âu.

English: And I say to you that many will come from east and west, and sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.
Bahnar: Na Inh wă khan kơ iĕm dơ̆ng, ning-mônh gô đei lơ bơngai jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak âu năm sŏng sa hơdai hăm Abraham, Isăk, Jakôp tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: But the sons of the kingdom will be cast out into outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơeng kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư ră, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă lui, na ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơlơ̆ tŭk lu sư tơ lăm anih măng mu, lê̆ lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi tơkăp sơnĕnh tơ noh.”

English: Then Jesus said to the centurion, “Go your way; and as you have believed, so let it be done for you.” And his servant was healed that same hour.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ 'bok tih linh: “Brŏk mă 'lơ̆ng, đĭch ih klaih boih yua kơ ih lui.” Đĭch sư klaih hloi đơ̆ng jơ 'noh tơpă.

English: Now when Jesus had come into Peter’s house, He saw his wife’s mother lying sick with a fever.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm tơ hnam Pêtrôs 'bôh tơnei sư oei păn kơ bơlŏ.

English: So He touched her hand, and the fever left her. And she arose and served them.
Bahnar: Yêsu pel pôm ti, sư klaih hloi kơ bơlŏ, na iung chă awih awăn kơ đe Yêsu.

English: When evening had come, they brought to Him many who were demon-possessed. And He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr mơ̆t adrơ̆m kơsơ̆ ei đei lơ bơngai năm ba lu bơngai yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t pơm kơ sư wơnh. Na Yêsu pơma kơ lu yang kơnê̆ lăp minh nơ̆r đĕch, mă-lei lu yang kơnê̆ lĕch jăk hloi đơ̆ng akâu lu bơngai noh. Păng Sư kư̆m pơklaih dôm lu bơngai jĭ jăn nai.

English: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying: “He Himself took our infirmities And bore our sicknesses.”
Bahnar: Yêsu pơm thoi noh wă kơ 'blep trŏ thoi Êsai khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu: “Sư pơklaih tôm tơdrong jĭ jăn kon bơngai bơ̆n.”

English: And when Jesus saw great multitudes about Him, He gave a command to depart to the other side.
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh lơ bơngai tăp dăr kơ Sư, na Sư pơtơm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư găn tŏk pah to đak.

English: Then a certain scribe came and said to Him, “Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go.”
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư wă yak đei minh 'nu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê apinh Sư: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, mă Ih năm tơ yơ yơ, inh wă kiơ̆ Ih ngăl.”

English: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Mơja đei anih tep, sem păr kư̆m đei tơpu. Inh Kon Bơngai ră mă-lei ưh kơ đei anih tep ôh.”

English: Then another of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai lui nai khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, inh wă kiơ̆ Ih mơ̆n, mă-lei gô inh 'bŭ 'bă inh 'mơ̆i.”

English: But Jesus said to him, “Follow Me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ưh ôh, ih kiơ̆ Inh dang ei hloi, tơdrong 'bŭ bơngai lôch lê̆ tơduă lu bơngai lôch tung 'bŭ dih băl.”

English: Now when He got into a boat, His disciples followed Him.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu hao thŏng-nan, lu bơngai pơhrăm kư̆m hao kiơ̆ Sư mơ̆n.

English: And suddenly a great tempest arose on the sea, so that the boat was covered with the waves. But He was asleep.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei yak kơpal đak dơsĭ, đei kial hơbŭt păng đak poh-yă tih tơprah mơ̆t lăm thŏng-nan lu sư, pă 'biơ̆ wă jê̆ 'bĕnh. Kơplah noh Yêsu oei tep.

English: Then His disciples came to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”
Bahnar: Na lu đe ei năm râu Yêsu khan: “Ơ 'Bok, dŏng bơ̆n bĕ, bơ̆n wă lôch kơ đak lơ̆p.”

English: But He said to them, “Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?” Then He arose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu đe ei: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm hli, iĕm tam băt gơnang kơ Inh hă?” Sư iung khă hloi kial hăm đak poh-yă. Kial thĕng hloi, đak poh-yă kư̆m pă adrŏ adrĕnh.

English: So the men marveled, saying, “Who can this be, that even the winds and the sea obey Him?”
Bahnar: Lu đe ei lăng hlĭch, na lu sư jet băl: “Bơngai bu âu kih, kial hơbŭt, đak dơsĭ poh-yă tih dang noh, mă kư̆m chu yom kơ Sư.”

English: When He had come to the other side, to the country of the Gergesenes, there met Him two demon-possessed men, coming out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that no one could pass that way.
Bahnar: Lu sư tŏk hlôi pah to đak dơsĭ tơ tơring đe Gadara, 'bơ̆t ei đei 'bar 'nu bơngai yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t pơm kơ sư wơnh, lĕch đơ̆ng bơsat năm tơkan tơ Yêsu. Ưh kơ đei bu pơ̆n năm brih trong ei yua kơ bre sư khĕnh dêh.

English: And suddenly they cried out, saying, “What have we to do with You, Jesus, You Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time?”
Bahnar: Lăp truh tơ Yêsu bre sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ơ Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih truh tơ âu wă pơrăm nhôn hă? Ưh tam mă trŏ kơ năr Ih wă pơrăm nhôn ôh lah.”

English: Now a good way off from them there was a herd of many swine feeding.
Bahnar: Jơ'bôt 'noh đei minh tơpôl nhŭng chă sa.

English: So the demons begged Him, saying, “If You cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of swine.”
Bahnar: Lu yang kơnê̆ ei apinh Yêsu khan: “Dah Ih puh nhôn lĕch đơ̆ng bre âu, lei Ih ăn kơ nhôn mơ̆t tơ lu nhŭng to.”

English: And He said to them, “Go.” So when they had come out, they went into the herd of swine. And suddenly the whole herd of swine ran violently down the steep place into the sea, and perished in the water.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Năm bĕ.” Yang kơnê̆ lĕch hloi đơ̆ng akâu bre noh mơ̆t tơ minh tơpôl nhŭng oei chă sa kiơ̆ groi kông ei, lu nhŭng ei kơdâu jur đơ̆ng kông groi ei huŏng hơtat tơ đak dơsĭ glơ̆k lôch đĭ minh tơpôl nhŭng ei.

English: Then those who kept them fled; and they went away into the city and told everything, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă wei nhŭng 'bôh thoi noh na kơdâu brŏk tơ pơlei lu sư chă roi kơ đe tơdrong nhŭng păng tơdrong 'bar 'nu bơngai yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t klaih boih.

English: And behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw Him, they begged Him to depart from their region.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla năm tơkan tơ Yêsu apinh Sư weh đơ̆ng tơring lu sư.

English: So He got into a boat, crossed over, and came to His own city.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu brŏk tơ pơlei Sư kơdih pah to đak.

English: Then behold, they brought to Him a paralytic lying on a bed. When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, “Son, be of good cheer; your sins are forgiven you.”
Bahnar: Tơ noh đe tung ba minh 'nu bơngai hơwen hơwo kơpal anhŭn anhăk tơ Yêsu. Yêsu 'bôh tơdrong lui đe noh 'lơ̆ng tơpă na Sư khan kơ bơngai hơwen hơwo ei thoi âu: “Ơ dăm, hiôk bĕ ih, yua kơ tơdrong yoch ih Inh pơklaih đĭ boih.”

English: And at once some of the scribes said within themselves, “This Man blasphemes!”
Bahnar: Lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê kơtơ̆ng sư pơma thoi noh na lu sư mơmơnh lăm to khan: “Sư pơma blông kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: But Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu sư pơma mơmơnh lăm to jô̆ kơ Sư tơdrong 'noh na Sư khan: “Liơ iĕm pơma mơmơnh lăm to, khan Inh pơma kơnê̆?

English: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk’?
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ bơngai hơwen hơwo âu tơdrong yoch sư Inh pơklaih đĭ boih, tơdrong 'noh dah iĕm 'bôh Inh athei sư iung yak, na sư iung yak hloi, 'noh iĕm kư̆m băt kơ Inh gơh pơklaih yoch sư mơ̆n. Yua kơ kiơ iĕm pơma mơmơnh khan Inh pơma blông?

English: But that you may know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins”—then He said to the paralytic, “Arise, take up your bed, and go to your house.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei Inh wă pơklaih jĭ sư, wă tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm băt kơ Inh Kon Bơngai gơh pơklaih tơdrong yoch kon bơngai ala teh âu.” Na Yêsu khan kơ bơngai hơwen hơwo ei thoi âu: “Iung bĕ, chĕp anhŭn ih brŏk tơ hnam.”

English: And he arose and departed to his house.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơwen noh iung yak brŏk hloi tơ hnam sư.

English: Now when the multitudes saw it, they marveled and glorified God, who had given such power to men.
Bahnar: Lu đe oei kiơ̆ ei 'bôh tơdrong noh, lu sư hli na ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Bơngai âu 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă pơklaih yoch păng jĭ jăn kon bơngai tơpă.”

English: As Jesus passed on from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, “Follow Me.” So he arose and followed Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm ataih 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng noh, na Sư 'bôh Mathiơ oei jang 'bơ̆t hnam thuê̆. Yêsu pơtơm sư khan: “Bĕ kiơ̆ Inh.” Na sư gruih iung kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu.

English: Now it happened, as Jesus sat at the table in the house, that behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Him and His disciples.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu năm sŏng sa tơ hnam Mathiơ. Tơ ei đei lơ bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ hăm bơngai pơm yoch sŏng sa hơdai Yêsu hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư.

English: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to His disciples, “Why does your Teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi 'bôh thoi noh na jet lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư thoi âu: “Yua kơ kiơ Yêsu sŏng sa hơdai păng lu bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ hăm lu bơngai pơm yoch?”

English: When Jesus heard that, He said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick.
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng hloi lu sư pơma thoi noh na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Lu bơngai liĕm akâu ưh kơ kăl kơ 'bok pơgang ôh, pôm lu bơngai jĭ jăn đĕch kăl kơ 'bok pơgang.

English: But go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice.’ For I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.”
Bahnar: Lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Tơdrong iĕm soi sơmah kơ Inh ưh kơ kăl ôh, Inh wă kơ iĕm 'mêm mơnat dih băl, noh kăl hloh kơ tơdrong iĕm soi sơmah kơ Inh.’ Na iĕm tơchĕng lăng tơdrong 'noh bĕ, wă kơ iĕm băt 'mêm mơnat kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai. Inh jur tơ âu ưh kơ sĭ chă wơ̆n lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng ôh. Inh năm tơ âu wă wơ̆n chă lu bơngai yoch wă kơ sư tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch sư.”

English: Then the disciples of John came to Him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but Your disciples do not fast?”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan mă pơm 'batem, lu sư năm jet Yêsu thoi âu: “Yua kơ kiơ nhôn hăm lu bơngai Pharisi ơ̆t kơ por wă kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Ih ưh kơ ơ̆t?”

English: And Jesus said to them, “Can the friends of the bridegroom mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Kơplah đe pơkong kơ bơngai mă iŏk akăn, lu bôl bơngai mă iŏk akăn noh chhôk ngă 'nă hal dêh, lu sư ưh kơ đei bu ơh sơ'ngon ơ̆t kơ por ôh. Pôm ning-mônh đĕch đe wă rôp anhăk bơngai mă iŏk akăn noh đơ̆ng bôl sư, 'bơ̆t ei kơnh trŏ kơ lu bôl sư ơh sơ'ngon ơ̆t kơ por.

English: No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; for the patch pulls away from the garment, and the tear is made worse.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma pơtih gia dơ̆ng gah tơdrong đêl lu sư jet noh hei thoi âu: “Kơbĭ bu 'maih klĕp che 'nao tam mă tơtrŭt tơ che ao so. Tơ̆ng bu klĕp, ưh kơ jor che 'nao gô hek che ao so să hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng.

English: Nor do they put new wine into old wineskins, or else the wineskins break, the wine is spilled, and the wineskins are ruined. But they put new wine into new wineskins, and both are preserved.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n kơbĭ bu 'maih tring sik 'nao 'băt kơtang mong tơ kơdŭng akar so. Tơ̆ng bu tring sik 'nao 'băt kơtang noh tơ kơdŭng akar so pă jor gô pơchah. Đak sik gô lĕch hiong, kơdŭng gô pơchah răm. Tơ̆ng bu wă tring, sư athei tring mong sik 'nao tơ kơdŭng akar 'nao, yua kơ kơdŭng akar 'nao 'noh kơjăp.”

English: While He spoke these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped Him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay Your hand on her and she will live.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei pơma tơdrong 'noh, na blư 'bôh minh 'nu kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm đe Juđê sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh păng khan: “Kon adruh inh 'nao lôch, inh apinh Ih năm chro ti pel akâu sư wă kơ sư iung arih dơ̆ng.”

English: So Jesus arose and followed him, and so did His disciples.
Bahnar: Yêsu iung kiơ̆ hloi sư, lu bơngai pơhrăm kư̆m kiơ̆ Sư mơ̆n.

English: And suddenly, a woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years came from behind and touched the hem of His garment.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn tuh pham mơjĭt-'bar sơnăm boih, sư kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng wă pel tơdrơi ao Yêsu.

English: For she said to herself, “If only I may touch His garment, I shall be made well.”
Bahnar: Drŏ-kăn noh sư tơchĕng khan: “Dah inh pel pôm ao Sư đĕch kư̆m klaih mơ̆n.” Na sư pel hloi ao Yêsu.

English: But Jesus turned around, and when He saw her He said, “Be of good cheer, daughter; your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well from that hour.
Bahnar: Yêsu hue tơ rŏng 'bôh duch ei păng khan: “Ơ duch, ih 'nĕ kơ hli, kơlih kơ ih lui na ih klaih.” Drŏ-kăn noh klaih hloi 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: When Jesus came into the ruler’s house, and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd wailing
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu truh tơ hnam kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm, Sư mơ̆t tơ hnam 'bôh bơngai hlôm tơgiĕp, bơngai nhơ̆m hmoi tơjrông tơjrang mang.

English: He said to them, “Make room, for the girl is not dead, but sleeping.” And they ridiculed Him.
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Iĕm lĕch đĭ tơ 'ngoaih, bơngai adruh âu ưh kơ lôch ôh, sư tep đĕch.” Na đe ei hiĕk kơ Sư.

English: But when the crowd was put outside, He went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.
Bahnar: Sư pơpuh đe lĕch đĭ tơ 'ngoaih boih na Yêsu mơ̆t tơ anih đe pơdong atâu. Yêsu rôp ti sư, na bơngai noh iung arih hloi.

English: And the report of this went out into all that land.
Bahnar: Lu đe kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh năm chă roi jơ̆p kơ tơring ei.

English: When Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed Him, crying out and saying, “Son of David, have mercy on us!”
Bahnar: Yêsu lĕch đơ̆ng noh, kơplah oei rok trong đei 'bar 'nu bơngai măt tol năm kiơ̆ Sư. Na bre sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ơ 'Bok Krist Kon Sâu pơtao Đawit, apinh Ih mơnat kơ nhi 'biơ̆ bĕ.”

English: And when He had come into the house, the blind men came to Him. And Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu mơ̆t tơ hnam, bre sư kư̆m mơ̆t kiơ̆ mơ̆n. Na Yêsu jet bre sư khan: “Biĕm hăm lui kơ Inh gơh pơklaih biĕm?” Bre sư khan: “Lui.”

English: Then He touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith let it be to you.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu pel măt bre sư păng khan: “Yua kơ biĕm lui na klaih.”

English: And their eyes were opened. And Jesus sternly warned them, saying, “See that no one knows it.”
Bahnar: Đang Yêsu pơma thoi noh, na măt bre sư klaih hloi. Yêsu khan tơdrăp kuă ăn bre sư roi kơ đe ră.

English: But when they had departed, they spread the news about Him in all that country.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bre sư lĕch đơ̆ng noh năm chă roi kơ đe tơdrong Yêsu pơklaih măt bre sư jơ̆p-jang kơ tơring ei.

English: As they went out, behold, they brought to Him a man, mute and demon-possessed.
Bahnar: Lăp bre noh 'nao wă lĕch tơ nai, đei bơngai nai năm ba minh 'nu bơngai yang mơ̆t pơm kơ sư kơmlo.

English: And when the demon was cast out, the mute spoke. And the multitudes marveled, saying, “It was never seen like this in Israel!”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu pơpuh yang kơnê̆ ei lĕch đơ̆ng akâu bơngai noh na bơngai noh gơh pơma hloi. Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơpôl oei kiơ̆ ei lăng hlĭch, na lu sư khan: “Dêh char Isơrael bơ̆n đơ̆ng sơ̆ ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang thoi âu ôh ii?”

English: But the Pharisees said, “He casts out demons by the ruler of the demons.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai Pharisi khan: “'Noh đơ̆ng yŏng pơgơ̆r yang kơnê̆ tơgŭm sư na sư gơh pơpuh lu yang kơnê̆ noh.”

English: Then Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm chă bơtho tơ rim pơlei tih iĕ, tơ lăm hnam akŭm, bơtho gah tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n. Păng Sư pơklaih rah dôm tơdrong jĭ jăn kon pơlei pơla pơmat-tat.

English: But when He saw the multitudes, He was moved with compassion for them, because they were weary and scattered, like sheep having no shepherd.
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh lu bơngai tơpôl noh Sư mơnat dêh, lu sư oei hli sơ'ngon đon ưh kơ băt pơm thoi yơ, dang lĕ kơ triu ưh kơ đei tơ'ngla wei-lăng.

English: Then He said to His disciples, “The harvest truly is plentiful, but the laborers are few.
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh bơngai tơpôl lơ noh, na Sư pơma pơtih gia kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư gah tơdrong đei lơ bơngai tam mă lui, mă-lei hui bơngai năm bơtho lu sư: “'Bôh ră 'ba lơ dôm noh, mă-lei hui bơngai wă năm kĕch iŏk.

English: Therefore pray the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into His harvest.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na bơ̆n athei adrin krao khan apinh tơ'ngla tơm mir âu wă wơh lơ bơngai năm tơgŭm kĕch iŏk 'ba âu.”

English: And when He had called His twelve disciples to Him, He gave them power over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all kinds of sickness and all kinds of disease.
Bahnar: Yêsu krao mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, ăn kơ lu sư gơh pơpuh tơlĕch lu yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng akâu bơngai păng ăn kơ lu sư gơh pơklaih rim tơdrong jĭ jăn kon bơngai.

English: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother
Bahnar: Na âu jô̆ tôm lu anăn mơjĭt-'bar 'nu lu sư: Simôn mă Yêsu anăn Pêtrôs, sư pơm tih 'biơ̆ kơ bôl sư; oh sư Andrê; Yakơ hăm oh sư Yôhan. 'Bă bre sư Sêbêđê.

English: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu đe Philip hăm 'Barthôlêmi; Thôm hăm Mathiơ, bơngai mă iŏk jên thuê̆ sơ̆; Yakơ kon Alphê hăm Thađê

English: Simon the Cananite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him.
Bahnar: Simôn mă kiơ̆ khŭl đe Sêlôt sơ̆ hăm Juđa Ikariôt, bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Yêsu.

English: These twelve Jesus sent out and commanded them, saying: “Do not go into the way of the Gentiles, and do not enter a city of the Samaritans.
Bahnar: Yêsu wơh mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư âu, Sư khan: “Iĕm 'nĕ kơ năm tơring đe mă ưh kơ khŭl Isơrael păng 'nĕ kơ năm tơring đe Samri.

English: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei năm tơ tơring bơngai Isơrael bơ̆n, yua kơ lu sư dang triu jrok trong.

English: And as you go, preach, saying, ‘The kingdom of heaven is at hand.’
Bahnar: Iĕm năm bơtho lu sư khan: ‘Năr âu trŏ năr 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r iĕm boih.’

English: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out demons. Freely you have received, freely give.
Bahnar: Păng iĕm chă pơklaih hloi lu bơngai jĭ jăn, tơiung arih lu bơngai đơ̆ng lôch, pơklaih lu bơngai jĭ chin păng pơpuh tơlĕch lu yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng akâu bơngai. Inh asong đĕch tôm tơdrong iĕm gơh pơm noh. Na iĕm kư̆m bơtho asong đe thoi Inh asong iĕm mơ̆n, ưh kơ iŏk jên ôh.

English: Provide neither gold nor silver nor copper in your money belts
Bahnar: Păng 'nĕ kơ chĕp ba jên.

English: nor bag for your journey, nor two tunics, nor sandals, nor staffs; for a worker is worthy of his food.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ chĕp kơdŭng tah tơmam, dah hrŭk 'bar blah ao, dah chĕp hiă chơkhŏ, dah 'long jra, yua kơ iĕm dang bơngai jang sa apah, iĕm jang tơgŭm đe, đe 'me sa iĕm.

English: “Now whatever city or town you enter, inquire who in it is worthy, and stay there till you go out.
Bahnar: “Iĕm truh tơ pơlei ayơ, mă pơlei tih iĕ, iĕm jet lăng tơ ei bơngai bu 'lơ̆ng na iĕm oei hloi tơ hnam bơngai noh truh tơ năr iĕm wă năm tơ pơlei nai.

English: And when you go into a household, greet it.
Bahnar: Lăp wă mơ̆t tơ hnam, iĕm khan: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ hnam iĕm chơt hiôk.’

English: If the household is worthy, let your peace come upon it. But if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai lăm hnam ei bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpă, lei iĕm apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ hnam noh chơt hiôk khŏm khŏm; dah ưh, iĕm lê̆.

English: And whoever will not receive you nor hear your words, when you depart from that house or city, shake off the dust from your feet.
Bahnar: Anih hnam ayơ dah pơlei ayơ ưh kơ sơng iŏk iĕm păng ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng tơdrong iĕm bơtho sư, thoi noh na lăp iĕm brŏk đơ̆ng pơlei 'noh iĕm sơpuih 'bruih tơ jơ̆ng iĕm tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak lu sư ning-mônh.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei wă sek tơlang ning-mônh Sư gô phak kon pơlei Sôđôm păng kon pơlei Gômôrơ hơiơch 'biơ̆ kơ pơlei mă ưh kơ sơng iŏk iĕm, mă khan 'bar tŏ pơlei noh pơm kơnê̆ dêh ră sơ̆.
