English: “Behold, I send you out as sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents and harmless as doves.
Bahnar: “Inh wơh iĕm năm chă bơtho đe iĕm athei kơchăng hŏ, yua kơ dang lĕ wơh triu năm tơ kŏ-so. Na iĕm athei chă đon hơgei thoi 'bih, iŏk jơhngơ̆m dim dang kơtơp.

English: But beware of men, for they will deliver you up to councils and scourge you in their synagogues.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei kơchăng, yua kơ đe gô rôp iĕm jao kơ lu kră sek tơlang păng tôn teh iĕm tơ hnam akŭm đe Juđê.

English: You will be brought before governors and kings for My sake, as a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Păng đe gô jao iĕm kơ lu 'bok tih păng 'bok pơtao yua kơ iĕm jang tơdrong Inh. Iĕm kư̆m gơh ră roi kơ lu sư păng roi kơ lu bơngai dêh đe tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Inh.

English: But when they deliver you up, do not worry about how or what you should speak. For it will be given to you in that hour what you should speak
Bahnar: Mưh đe rôp iĕm jao kơ lu kră sek tơlang, iĕm 'nĕ mah tơchĕng kơ tơdrong iĕm wă pơma kơ lu sư noh hŏ.

English: for it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bă bơ̆n tơgŭm kơplah lăm iĕm pơma, ưh kơ sĭ kơ iĕm gơh pơma kơdih ôh.

English: “Now brother will deliver up brother to death, and a father his child; and children will rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.
Bahnar: “Gô đei 'nhŏng jao oh sư bơngai lui tơ̆p mă đe pơlôch. Kư̆m đei mơ'nah 'bă sư jao kon sư tơ̆p mă đe pơlôch. Kư̆m đei mơ'nah kon sư hil plơ̆ kơ mĕ 'bă sư jao ăn kơ đe pơlôch.

English: And you will be hated by all for My name’s sake. But he who endures to the end will be saved.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai gô areh arĕnh kơ iĕm yua kơ tơdrong jang Inh. Thoi noh bu wă adrin lui kơ Inh truh tôch, bơngai 'noh gô klaih.

English: When they persecute you in this city, flee to another. For assuredly, I say to you, you will not have gone through the cities of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
Bahnar: Dah đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm tơ pơlei âu, iĕm kơdâu bơtho pơlei nai dơ̆ng. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, kơplah iĕm oei chă bơtho đe tam mă jơ̆p kơ dêh Isơrael, Inh Kon Bơngai jur boih.

English: “A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his master.
Bahnar: “Bơngai mă pơhrăm ưh kơ gơh pơhloh kơ 'bok thây. Bơngai đĭch ưh kơ layơ pơhloh kơ yŏng sư ôh.

English: It is enough for a disciple that he be like his teacher, and a servant like his master. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more will they call those of his household!
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong đe pơm kơ 'bok thây, bơngai pơhrăm athei chu đe pơm kơ sư mơ̆n; dôm tơdrong đe pơm kơ yŏng sư, đĭch sư kư̆m athei chu mơ̆n. Dah đe mah jô̆ kơ Inh yang Belsêbul khŭl yang kơnê̆, đe jô̆ kơ iĕm kang loi.

English: Therefore do not fear them. For there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, and hidden that will not be known.
Bahnar: “Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ mah hli kơ lu sư ôh, yua kơ dôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng đe gô băt, dôm tơdrong hrĕp đe gô 'bôh ning-mônh.

English: “Whatever I tell you in the dark, speak in the light; and what you hear in the ear, preach on the housetops.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na tơdrong âu Inh bơtho kơdrô̆ iĕm, thoi lĕ kơ bơtho lăm măng mu ưh kơ đei bu băt, ưh kơ đei bu 'bôh. Mă-lei iĕm gô bơtho tơ hơdah măt 'năr, wă khan iĕm gô bơtho tơ anăp bôl lơ.

English: And do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. But rather fear Him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ hli kơ đe pơlôch akâu iĕm, mă-lei bơhngol iĕm sư ưh kơ gơh pơlôch ôh. Iĕm athei hli kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch, Sư gơh pơrăm akâu iĕm hăm bơhngol iĕm tơ dơnâu ŭnh.

English: Are not two sparrows sold for a copper coin? And not one of them falls to the ground apart from your Father’s will.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt sem rĕch tĕch hơi dêh, 'bar tŏ lăp minh hlak jên, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m wei rong sư mơ̆n. Mă minh pôm păr huŏng tơ teh, Sư kư̆m băt mơ̆n.

English: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
Bahnar: Sŏk bơ̆n Sư jô̆ băt tôm.

English: Do not fear therefore; you are of more value than many sparrows.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli, 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ iĕm hloh kơ Sư 'mêm kơ sem rĕch.

English: “Therefore whoever confesses Me before men, him I will also confess before My Father who is in heaven.
Bahnar: “Bu roi kơ đe khan sư lui kơ Inh, Inh kư̆m roi kơ 'Bă Inh tơ plĕnh ti, bơngai 'noh sư lui kơ Inh tơpă.

English: But whoever denies Me before men, him I will also deny before My Father who is in heaven.
Bahnar: Bu hli kơ đe, mơlâu kơ đe na sư khan sư ưh kơ lui kơ Inh, Inh kư̆m roi kơ 'Bă Inh tơ plĕnh ti thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: “Do not think that I came to bring peace on earth. I did not come to bring peace but a sword.
Bahnar: “Iĕm 'nĕ tơchĕng Inh jur tơ teh âu dang ei na kon bơngai wă jing hiôk-hian hloi. Ưh ôh. Inh jur tơ teh âu dang lĕ pơchĕp ăn kơ kon bơngai tak đao tơblah băl wă kơ hang nuih 'mơ̆i.

English: For I have come to ‘set a man against his father, a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law’
Bahnar: Inh jur tơ teh âu na kon bơngai hil areh kơ tơduă bôl sư mă lui kơ Inh. Kon drŏ-nglo areh kơ 'bă sư yua kơ 'bă sư lui kơ Inh; kon drŏ-kăn areh kơ mĕ sư, mai sư areh kơ tơnei sư.

English: and ‘a man’s enemies will be those of his own household.’
Bahnar: 'Nhŏng oh pôm hnam mă ưh kơ lui hil areh kơ 'nhŏng oh mă lui.

English: He who loves father or mother more than Me is not worthy of Me. And he who loves son or daughter more than Me is not worthy of Me.
Bahnar: “Bu 'mêm kơ mĕ 'bă sư hloh kơ sư 'mêm kơ Inh, bơngai 'noh ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơbôl hăm Inh ôh. Bu 'mêm kơ kon sư hloh kơ sư 'mêm kơ Inh, bơngai 'noh kư̆m ưh kơ trŏ wă tơbôl hăm Inh mơ̆n.

English: And he who does not take his cross and follow after Me is not worthy of Me.
Bahnar: Bu ưh kơ chu tôi 'long pơglang sư kơdih lôch kiơ̆ Inh, bơngai 'noh kư̆m ưh kơ trŏ wă tơbôl hăm Inh mơ̆n.

English: He who finds his life will lose it, and he who loses his life for My sake will find it.
Bahnar: Bu ưh kơ chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh, bơngai 'noh lôch hoh hoh đĕch, ưh kơ yua kiơ ôh. Bu chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh, bơngai 'noh gô arih ling-lang.

English: “He who receives you receives Me, and he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.
Bahnar: “Bu sơng iŏk iĕm, bơngai 'noh dang sơng iŏk Inh; bu sơng iŏk Inh, noh dang sư sơng iŏk 'Bă Inh mă wơh Inh.

English: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet’s reward. And he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man’s reward.
Bahnar: Bu sơng iŏk bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư băt kơ bơngai noh pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, bơngai 'noh gô đei tơdrong apah thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei apah bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r Sư noh. Bu sơng iŏk bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, sư băt kơ bơngai noh tơpăt tơpă, bơngai 'noh gô đei tơdrong apah thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei apah bơngai mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt noh mơ̆n.

English: And whoever gives one of these little ones only a cup of cold water in the name of a disciple, assuredly, I say to you, he shall by no means lose his reward.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu asong minh kơchŏk đak nhă kơ lu bôl bơ̆n mă pơm iĕ âu yua kơ bôl bơ̆n kiơ̆ Inh, bơngai 'noh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô apah sư tơpă.”

English: Now it came to pass, when Jesus finished commanding His twelve disciples, that He departed from there to teach and to preach in their cities.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho khan kơ mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư đang boih, na Yêsu năm chă bơtho kon pơlei pơla tơring ei.

English: And when John had heard in prison about the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples
Bahnar: Yôhan mă pơm kơ đe 'batem, đe tah sư lăm hnam phak. Sư kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong mơsêh mơyang 'Bok Krist pơm, na sư wơh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng sư năm jet Yêsu thoi âu

English: and said to Him, “Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?”
Bahnar: “Ih hăm trŏ kơ 'Bok Krist mă Yôhan khan gô truh, dah nhôn oei gô bơngai nai dơ̆ng?”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “Go and tell John the things which you hear and see
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm wih roi kơ Yôhan tơdrong mă iĕm kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng Inh bơtho hăm iĕm 'bôh noh bĕ.

English: The blind see and the lame walk; the lepers are cleansed and the deaf hear; the dead are raised up and the poor have the gospel preached to them.
Bahnar: Lu măt tol gơh 'bôh hơdah, lu jơ̆ng kue mah gơh yak, lu jĭ chin mah klaih, lu klĭk gơh kơtơ̆ng, lu bơngai lôch mah gơh iung arih, lu bơngai dơnuh hin mah mơ̆ng Inh bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng.

English: And blessed is he who is not offended because of Me.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă lui kơ Inh khŏm khŏm ưh kơ achăng lê̆ Inh, lu sư hiôk dêh.”

English: As they departed, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan wih boih, na Yêsu pơma kơ lu bơngai tơpôl mă oei kiơ̆ ei: “Iĕm năm tơ Yôhan tơ char glă sơ̆ iĕm chă kiơ? Ưh kơ sĭ iĕm năm chă bơngai ngĭl ngŭl tơchĕng đon 'bar pah thoi lĕ hla kial thu wơ̆t lăk ôh.

English: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft garments? Indeed, those who wear soft clothing are in kings’ houses.
Bahnar: Lei iĕm chă kiơ? Dah iĕm năm lăng bơngai hrŭk hơbĕn ao 'lơ̆ng? Tơ̆ng iĕm wă lăng bơngai hrŭk hơbĕn ao 'lơ̆ng, lei sư oei tơ hnam 'bok pơtao.

English: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.
Bahnar: Lei iĕm chă kiơ? Iĕm năm chă bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm trŏ? Trŏ boih, iĕm chă bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Yôhan boih sư tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.

English: For this is he of whom it is written: ‘Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, Who will prepare Your way before You.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ Yôhan boih na đe mah chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ thoi âu: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: ‘Âu Inh wơh minh 'nu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Inh hơdrol, wă kơ sư hơmet trong kơ Ih.’

English: “Assuredly, I say to you, among those born of women there has not risen one greater than John the Baptist; but he who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Yôhan sư tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai mơ̆n, mă-lei bơngai bu iĕ hloh kơ đe lăm chăl 'nao mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r dang ei, sư kư̆m hlôh wao tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei nhên hloh kơ Yôhan dơ̆ng.

English: And from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Yôhan bơtho sơ̆ truh dang ei đei lơ bơngai adrin tơpă wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei truh tơ Yôhan păng đĭ dôm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei, roi lê̆ hơdrol khan 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai tơpă, na dang ei bơ̆n 'bôh tơpă boih 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r kon bơngai.

English: And if you are willing to receive it, he is Elijah who is to come.
Bahnar: Sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan Êli wă jur. Mă tơpă Yôhan noh boih Êli, hli kơ iĕm ưh kơ lui đĕch na khan ưh kơ trŏ kơ Êli.

English: He who has ears to hear, let him hear!
Bahnar: Na bu đei đon athei mơ̆ng wă kơ kơtơ̆ng nhên.

English: “But to what shall I liken this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces and calling to their companions
Bahnar: “Lu bơngai ahrei âu phara dêh, na Inh wă pơtih gia tơdrong sư lơliơ? Lu sư dang lĕ hơ'lơ̆p pơchơt ngôi tơ kơchơ. Lu sư đei 'bar khŭl. Minh khŭl pơma 'bơ̆r re kơ bôl sư khan

English: and saying: ‘We played the flute for you, And you did not dance; We mourned to you, And you did not lament.’
Bahnar: ‘Nhôn hlôm tơgiĕp wă kơ tơdrong chơt, mă-lei iĕm kuă kơ suang pơrŏ. Nhôn hơri tơdrong đe lôch, mă-lei iĕm kuă kơ nhơ̆m hmoi.’

English: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’
Bahnar: Na tơdrong iĕm kuă kơ nhi Yôhan kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n. Sơ̆ Yôhan ơ̆t kơ por, ưh kơ et sik, na đe jô̆ kơ sư khan wơnh.

English: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Look, a glutton and a winebibber, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is justified by her children.”
Bahnar: Na gah Inh Kon Bơngai jur tơ teh âu, sŏng sa mơh 'nhot hơdai kon bơngai, na đe jô̆ kơ Inh khan bơngai sa bơlŭk, et dư, tơbôl hăm bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆, lu bơngai yoch mơ̆n. Mă-lei dah bơ̆n 'bôh đe jang 'lơ̆ng, bơ̆n băt kơ đe jang trŏ jang hơgei.”

English: Then He began to rebuke the cities in which most of His mighty works had been done, because they did not repent
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu lach kơ kon pơlei pơla 'bôh Sư pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tơ pơlei lu sư, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ wă tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.

English: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
Bahnar: Na Sư khan: “Ơ Pơlei Chơrasin, iĕm gô đei tơdrong pơmat tơpă ning-mônh. Ơ Pơlei 'Betsaiđa, iĕm kư̆m đei tơdrong pơmat tơpă mơ̆n ning-mônh. Dah Inh pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tơ Pơlei Tirơ hăm Pơlei Siđôn dang Inh pơm tơ pơlei iĕm ki, lei 'bar tŏ pơlei noh tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch 'bônh đĕch; lei lu sư hrŭk hloi ao 'bi păng iŏk hloi tơnuh ŭnh pik tơ akâu lu sư wă kơ đe băt kơ lu sư sơ'ngon kơ tơdrong yoch sư tơpă. Mă-lei lu iĕm âu phara dêh, iĕm ưh kơ băt tơbral thoi noh.

English: But I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judgment than for you.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei wă sek tơlang ning-mônh, Sư gô phak Pơlei Tirơ păng Pơlei Siđôn hơiơch 'biơ̆ kơ pơlei iĕm, mă khan 'bar tŏ pơlei noh pơlei dêh tơmoi.

English: And you, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to Hades; for if the mighty works which were done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
Bahnar: Bĭ iĕm, ơ Pơlei Kapernum, iĕm tơchĕng iĕm tih dang yơ, iĕm tih atŏ truh tơ plĕnh ti hă? Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơhuŏng iĕm truh tơ dơnâu ŭnh sŭng. Dah Inh pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tơ Pơlei Sôđôm sơ̆ dang Inh pơm tơ pơlei iĕm dang ei, lei Pơlei Sôđôm tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch 'bônh đĕch. Lei 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ soh pơlei sư ôh sơ̆, pơlei sư oei truh dang ei đĕch.

English: But I say to you that it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment than for you.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, mưh truh năr sek tơlang ning-mônh, Sư gô phak tơring Sôđôm hơiơch 'biơ̆ kơ pơlei iĕm.”

English: At that time Jesus answered and said, “I thank You, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that You have hidden these things from the wise and prudent and have revealed them to babes.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Yêsu krao khan kơ 'Bă Sư khan: “Ơ 'Bă, Ih boih Kră Yang plĕnh teh. Inh bơnê kơ Ih, yua kơ dôm tơdrong Inh bơtho, Ih tơbăt kơ lu bơngai mă băt gơnang kơ Ih thoi lu hơ'lơ̆p băt gơnang kơ mĕ 'bă; păng Ih ưh kơ wă tơhlôh kơ lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ akâu sư kơdih hŏk hơgei.

English: Even so, Father, for so it seemed good in Your sight.
Bahnar: Ơ 'Bă, Ih pơm thoi noh trŏ tơpă, kiơ̆ thoi Ih lăp đon.

English: All things have been delivered to Me by My Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father. Nor does anyone know the Father except the Son, and the one to whom the Son wills to reveal Him.
Bahnar: “'Bă Inh jao ăn kơ Inh tôm tĕch tơdrong. Minh 'nu 'Bă Inh đĕch băt kơ Inh păng minh 'nu Inh đĕch băt kơ Sư. Na tơdrong tơbăt ăn kơ iĕm 'Bă Inh, Sư gô mơ̆ng kơ Inh wă.

English: Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu bơngai mă oei pŭ trăp, năm tơ Inh bĕ, lê̆ Inh tơgŭm iĕm pŭ hơiơch.

English: Take My yoke upon you and learn from Me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh bơngai dim, băt 'mêm mơnat, na apinh iĕm pŭ iŏk bĕ, pơhrăm iŏk bĕ tơdrong Inh âu, wă kơ iĕm pơdơh hiôk.

English: For My yoke is easy and My burden is light.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh, na iĕm rơhơi jơhngơ̆m păng pŭ hơiơch.”

English: At that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the Sabbath. And His disciples were hungry, and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lăp truh năr giĕng đe Juđê mă đe anăn năr Sa'bat, Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư drong mơ̆t tơ mir, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư pơngot na lu sư broch găr 'ba kăp sa ngôi.

English: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to Him, “Look, Your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath!”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi 'bôh thoi noh na khan kơ Yêsu: “Ih lăng, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Ih pơm ưh kơ trŏ lăm năr pơdơh, năr pơdơh khan jang.”

English: But He said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he was hungry, he and those who were with him
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai Pharisi: “Iĕm tam biơh đŏk lăng lăm hla bơar tơdrong pơtao Đawit ôh hă? Sơ̆ sư kư̆m pơm ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong juăt mơ̆n, sư păng bôl sư pơngot ưh kơ đei tơmam sa.

English: how he entered the house of God and ate the showbread which was not lawful for him to eat, nor for those who were with him, but only for the priests?
Bahnar: Lu sư mơ̆t tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Đawit sư ưh kơ pơm 'bok soi ră, mă-lei sư gơh iŏk sa 'bĕng đe pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n. 'Bĕng đe pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pôm lu 'bok soi đĕch gơh iŏk sa, mă-lei lu bôl Đawit gơh iŏk sa mơ̆n.

English: Or have you not read in the law that on the Sabbath the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, and are blameless?
Bahnar: “Bĭ iĕm tam biơh đŏk lăng tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh hă? Rim năr pơdơh Sa'bat lu 'bok soi kư̆m pơm ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong juăt thoi iĕm khan 'noh mơ̆n. Rim năr pơdơh Sa'bat lu sư jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ lăm hnam akŭm tơm. Mă-lei, mă đe 'bôh, ưh kơ đei bu khă khan kơ̆m ôh, yua kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong jang lu sư.

English: Yet I say to you that in this place there is One greater than the temple.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, tơdrong jang Inh kăl hloh kơ tơdrong jang đe noh jang lăm hnam akŭm.

English: But if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the guiltless.
Bahnar: Lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Tơdrong iĕm soi sơmah kơ Inh ưh kơ kăl ôh, Inh wă kơ iĕm 'mêm mơnat dih băl 'noh kăl hloh kơ tơdrong iĕm soi sơmah kơ Inh.’ ” Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Dah iĕm hlôh tơdrong noh, lei iĕm ưh kơ đei jô̆ kơ lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng pơm yoch ôh.

English: For the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
Bahnar: Inh Kon Bơngai, Inh gơh tơblang ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong kơ̆m lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat.”

English: Now when He had departed from there, He went into their synagogue.
Bahnar: Yêsu brŏk đơ̆ng noh năm akŭm tơ hnam akŭm lu bơngai Pharisi ei.

English: And behold, there was a man who had a withered hand. And they asked Him, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”—that they might accuse Him.
Bahnar: Lăm hnam akŭm noh đei minh 'nu bơngai ti kue minh pah, na lu sư răp lăng Yêsu hăm ming pơklaih ti sư dah ưh, yua kơ năr noh năr pơdơh Sa'bat. Dah Sư pơklaih lei lu sư wă jô̆ Sư bơngai yoch yua kơ lu sư khan lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat ưh kơ gơh jang păng ưh kơ gơh pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn ôh. Na lu sư jet Yêsu khan: “Kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n hăm gơh ming pơklaih đe jĭ jăn lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat dah ưh?”

English: Then He said to them, “What man is there among you who has one sheep, and if it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will not lay hold of it and lift it out?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Dah iĕm đei minh pôm triu huŏng lăm sơlŭng đak kơplah lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat iĕm jur iŏk sư hloi dah kiơ?

English: Of how much more value then is a man than a sheep? Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”
Bahnar: Minh kơ̆l bơngai kăl hloh kơ minh pôm triu; thoi noh na tơdrong juăt bơ̆n mă lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat gơh tơgŭm pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn.”

English: Then He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched it out, and it was restored as whole as the other.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu khan kơ bơngai ti kue: “Chro ti ih bĕ.” Na bơngai ti kue ei chro ti sư klaih hloi thoi ti 'lơ̆ng.

English: Then the Pharisees went out and plotted against Him, how they might destroy Him.
Bahnar: Lu khŭl Pharisi noh lĕch đơ̆ng hnam akŭm noh năm pơđâu chă tơdrong wă kơ gơh rôp pơlôch Yêsu.

English: But when Jesus knew it, He withdrew from there. And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them all.
Bahnar: Yêsu băt thoi noh Sư lĕch đơ̆ng noh năm tơ nai, đei lơ bơngai kiơ̆ Sư; Sư kư̆m ming pơklaih đĭ-đăng lu bơngai jĭ jăn.

English: Yet He warned them not to make Him known
Bahnar: Sư khă lu đe noh 'nĕ roi tơbăt anăn Sư kơ đe.

English: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'blep trŏ thoi Êsai chih khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu

English: “Behold! My Servant whom I have chosen, My Beloved in whom My soul is well pleased! I will put My Spirit upon Him, And He will declare justice to the Gentiles.
Bahnar: “'Bok Kei-Dei khan: ‘Âu boih đam Inh, Inh rơih iŏk Sư, Inh 'mêm kơ Sư tơpă, Inh lăp đon kơ Sư dêh. Inh gô ăn kơ Sư Yang Bơhngol Inh, Wă bơtho tơbăt ăn kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai gah tơdrong Inh wă sek tơlang ning-mônh.

English: He will not quarrel nor cry out, Nor will anyone hear His voice in the streets.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sư ưh kơ chă pơjah pơjăng hăm đe, ưh kơ pơma pơret ôh, Kư̆m ưh kơ bơtho đe tơ anih kư̆ kă rok trong dah rok cham kon pơlei wă kơ đe ư-ang kơ Sư ôh.

English: A bruised reed He will not break, And smoking flax He will not quench, Till He sends forth justice to victory
Bahnar: Sư bơngai dim khôn dêh. Mă đe lui rơdu dang hla 'long wă jê̆ hơlŭng, Sư ưh kơ phĕ tŭk ôh; Mă đe lui rơdu dang ŭnh kơđeng wă jê̆ păt, Sư kư̆m ưh kơ pĭt tŭk ôh; Sư kư̆ kơ jang truh tơ kon bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt dih băl.

English: And in His name Gentiles will trust.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng khŭl kon bơngai gơnêh gơnơm sơđơ̆ng kơ Sư tơgŭm.’ ”

English: Then one was brought to Him who was demon-possessed, blind and mute; and He healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đe năm ba tơ Yêsu minh 'nu bơngai măt tol păng sư kư̆m kơmlo yua kơ yang kơnê̆ pơm kơ sư. Na Yêsu pơpuh yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu bơngai noh na bơngai noh gơh 'bôh hơdah păng gơh pơma.

English: And all the multitudes were amazed and said, “Could this be the Son of David?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpôl lăng hlĭch na chă tơkhan dih băl: “Băt 'Bok âu boih kơlĕ, đe khan Sư Kon Sâu 'bok pơtao Đawit đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn pơm pơtao bơ̆n?”

English: Now when the Pharisees heard it they said, “This fellow does not cast out demons except by Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, lu sư khan: “'Noh đơ̆ng yang Belsêbul yŏng yang kơnê̆ tơgŭm Sư na Sư gơh pơpuh lu yang kơnê̆ noh.”

English: But Jesus knew their thoughts, and said to them: “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand.
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu sư tơchĕng thoi noh na Sư khan: “Dah minh pôm teh đak tơblah dih băl, teh đak noh gô pơchah hiong tôch. Dah minh pôm pơlei dah minh pôm hnam dơnŏ tơblah dih băl, pơlei dah hnam dơnŏ noh gô hiong hiach.

English: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?
Bahnar: Thoi noh dah yŏng pơgơ̆r yang kơnê̆ tơblah tơduă yang kơnê̆, dôm tơdrong sư pơgơ̆r gô hiong tôch.

English: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they shall be your judges.
Bahnar: Na lơliơ iĕm khan đơ̆ng yang Belsêbul khŭl yang kơnê̆ ăn kơ Inh gơh pơpuh yang kơnê̆? Lei bĭ buăl iĕm gơh pơpuh yang kơnê̆ noh lu sư gơh đơ̆ng yơ? Đơ̆ng yang noh mơ̆n dah đơ̆ng yơ? Bơ̆n băt kơ đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu sư ngăl. Thoi noh na lu buăl iĕm kư̆m băt kơ iĕm pơma kơ Inh kư̆ kă đĕch.

English: But if I cast out demons by the Spirit of God, surely the kingdom of God has come upon you.
Bahnar: Mă tơpă đơ̆ng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Inh, na Inh gơh pơpuh yang kơnê̆. Thoi noh na iĕm 'bôh ră 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r tơ ala teh âu boih, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ băt ôh.

English: Or how can one enter a strong man’s house and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man? And then he will plunder his house.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu gơh mơ̆t tơtông tơmam bơngai pran, dah ưh kơ chô̆ jơ̆ng ti sư hơdrol; đe chô̆ jơ̆ng ti sư hơdrol 'mơ̆i na gơh mơ̆t tơtông tơmam sư lăm hnam. Na Inh tơblah hăm yŏng yang kơnê̆ kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters abroad.
Bahnar: “Iĕm kơchăng hŏ, bu ưh kơ wă kiơ̆ Inh, sư dang ayăt kơ Inh; bu ưh kơ pôm đon hăm Inh, sư gô tơklah tơklang.

English: “Therefore I say to you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Inh khan kơ iĕm thoi âu: Mă dôm tơdrong yoch, mă dôm 'măng pơjăm 'Bok Kei-Dei, dah bơ̆n apinh Sư 'nĕ jô̆ yo, 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ jô̆ yo ôh, Sư oei tơgŭm pơklaih đĕch. Mă-lei dah bu pơjăm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh pă wă pơklaih bơngai mă pơjăm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư ôh.

English: Anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, either in this age or in the age to come.
Bahnar: Bu pơjăm Inh Kon Bơngai, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m huay kơ jô̆ yo kơ sư ôh, Sư oei tơgŭm pơklaih đĕch. Mă-lei dah bu pơjăm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh pă wă pơklaih boih bơngai noh, mă đơ̆ng dang ei truh tơ ning-mônh.

English: “Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or else make the tree bad and its fruit bad; for a tree is known by its fruit.
Bahnar: “Iĕm băt boih, tơnơm 'lơ̆ng ling-lang pơjing plei 'lơ̆ng. Tơnơm kơnê̆ pơjing plei kơnê̆. Bơ̆n băt kơ 'long 'lơ̆ng dah ưh, bơ̆n lăng plei sư.

English: Brood of vipers! How can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.
Bahnar: Iĕm âu bơngai dang 'bih, iĕm ưh kơ layơ wă pơma 'lơ̆ng 'biơ̆ tŏ sĕt, yua kơ iĕm bơngai kơnê̆ dêh. Lăm to iĕm tơchĕng thoi yơ, 'bơ̆r iĕm pơma kiơ̆ thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth good things, and an evil man out of the evil treasure brings forth evil things.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'lơ̆ng, sư đei jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng, sư pơma kiơ̆ 'lơ̆ng. Bơngai kơnê̆, sư đei jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆, sư pơma kiơ̆ kơnê̆.

English: But I say to you that for every idle word men may speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, na mưh truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ning-mônh, Sư roi tôm dôm tơdrong 'bơ̆r iĕm pơma kơnê̆.

English: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
Bahnar: Dah 'bơ̆r iĕm pơma 'lơ̆ng, Sư kư̆m jô̆ iĕm bơngai 'lơ̆ng; dah 'bơ̆r iĕm pơma kơnê̆, Sư kư̆m jô̆ iĕm bơngai kơnê̆.”

English: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees answered, saying, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from You.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu khŭl Pharisi apinh Yêsu khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, nhôn wă kơ 'bôh Ih pơm tơdrong mơsêh 'mơ̆i na nhôn băt kơ Ih bơngai đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: But He answered and said to them, “An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Jơhnơr iĕm ahrei kơnê̆ dêh, na mă kuă kơ lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Iĕm pơm pơlong Inh tơ'bôh kơ iĕm tơdrong mơsêh wă kơ iĕm băt kơ Inh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă dah ưh. Mă-lei Inh ưh kơ wă pơm tơdrong mơsêh thoi iĕm apinh noh ôh. Bĭ tơdrong Jôna sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, na ka luăn sư pêng măng pêng năr, noh kư̆m dang pơm tơdrong mơsêh tơ'bôh kơ iĕm boih.

English: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the great fish, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
Bahnar: Jôna sơ̆ sư oei lăm klak ka tih pêng măng pêng năr, na Inh Kon Bơngai gô oei lăm trôm teh pêng măng pêng năr kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and indeed a greater than Jonah is here.
Bahnar: Truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ning-mônh lu kon pơlei Ninêwơ jô̆ kơ lu jơhnơr iĕm dang ei bơngai yoch tih, yua kơ lu sư kơtơ̆ng Jôna bơtho athei tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, lu sư tơbral hloi, mă-lei iĕm âu đei bơngai bơtho hơgei hloh kơ Jôna ră pơm kuă kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.

English: The queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and indeed a greater than Solomon is here.
Bahnar: Truh năr 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ning-mônh kư̆m đei minh 'nu yă pơtao đơ̆ng dêh Sêba wang jô̆ kơ lu jơhnơr iĕm dang ei bơngai yoch, yua kơ sơ̆ sư đơ̆ng dêh ataih kư̆m adrin năm mơ̆ng pơtao Sôlômôn bơtho, mă-lei iĕm âu đei bơngai bơtho hơgei hloh kơ pơtao Sôlômôn bơtho ră pơm kuă kơ tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.

English: “When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, he goes through dry places, seeking rest, and finds none.
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu bơngai, năm tơ char glă, sư chă anih pơdơh ră, sư chă ưh kơ đei.

English: Then he says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’ And when he comes, he finds it empty, swept, and put in order.
Bahnar: Na sư tơchĕng khan: ‘Inh brŏk oei tơ bơngai đêl inh oei ki đĕch.’ Lăp sư brŏk, sư 'bôh bơngai đêl sư oei noh thoi hnam đe sơpuih hơmet lê̆ 'lơ̆ng boih mă-lei ưh kơ đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei.

English: Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter and dwell there; and the last state of that man is worse than the first. So shall it also be with this wicked generation.”
Bahnar: Na sư năm chă pơtơm buăl sư tơpơh 'nu mă kơnê̆ hloh kơ sư dơ̆ng mơ̆t oei tơ bơngai noh; na bơngai noh sư jing pơmat hloh kơ minh 'nu yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t ki. Na lu bơngai kơnê̆ jơhnơr ahrei kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ wă lui kơ Inh.”

English: While He was still talking to the multitudes, behold, His mother and brothers stood outside, seeking to speak with Him.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei bơtho lu đe ei, na đei oh Sư hăm mĕ Sư dơ̆ng tơ 'ngoaih chă Sư wă pơma dơnuh.

English: Then one said to Him, “Look, Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, seeking to speak with You.”
Bahnar: Na đe khan kơ Sư: “Mĕ Ih hăm oh Ih dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'ngoaih hnam to chă Ih.”

English: But He answered and said to the one who told Him, “Who is My mother and who are My brothers?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Bu mĕ Inh hăm oh Inh ei?”

English: And He stretched out His hand toward His disciples and said, “Here are My mother and My brothers!
Bahnar: Yêsu tơhlâu tơ'bôh kơ lu bơngai mă kiơ̆ Sư, khan: “Lu bơngai âu dang mĕ Inh, 'nhŏng oh Inh.

English: For whoever does the will of My Father in heaven is My brother and sister and mother.”
Bahnar: Bu pơm kiơ̆ kơ 'Bă Inh mă oei tơ plĕnh ti, bơngai 'noh dang 'nhŏng oh Inh păng mĕ Inh.”

English: On the same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the sea.
Bahnar: Năr noh mơ̆n, Yêsu lĕch đơ̆ng hnam năm tơ jih đak dơsĭ tơoei bơtho đe.

English: And great multitudes were gathered together to Him, so that He got into a boat and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai akŭm tăp dăr kơ Sư, na Sư tŏk oei kơpal thŏng-nan tơ đak, lu bơngai tơpôl oei tơ jih đak.

English: Then He spoke many things to them in parables, saying: “Behold, a sower went out to sow.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho lơ tơdrong hăm nơ̆r pơtih gia kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai năm rei adrĕch 'ba.

English: And as he sowed, some seed fell by the wayside; and the birds came and devoured them.
Bahnar: Lăp sư rei, đei găr mơ'nah huŏng tơ trong, na sem jur sa.

English: Some fell on stony places, where they did not have much earth; and they immediately sprang up because they had no depth of earth.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei mơ'nah huŏng kơpal tơmo trêl ưh kơ gan đei teh lơ. Ưh kơ đunh sư kư̆m chăt mơ̆n, mă teh ưh kơ mah.

English: But when the sun was up they were scorched, and because they had no root they withered away.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr tŏ boih sư jô na lôch hloi, yua kơ rơh sư chăt ưh kơ jrŭ.

English: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns sprang up and choked them.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei mơ'nah huŏng tơ 'nhĕt jơla. Lăp 'nhĕt jơla kơjung boih jơla krênh 'ba noh.

English: But others fell on good ground and yielded a crop: some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei mơ'nah huŏng tơ teh 'lơ̆ng, na đei hloi plei trem mơ'nah minh-hrĕng, mơ'nah tơdrâu-jĭt, mơ'nah pêng-jĭt.

English: He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
Bahnar: Bu đei đon athei tơchĕng kơdih bĕ.”

English: And the disciples came and said to Him, “Why do You speak to them in parables?”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm jet Sư: “Yua kơ kiơ Ih wă bơtho pơjuang ngăl?”

English: He answered and said to them, “Because it has been given to you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it has not been given.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm băt gah tơdrong Sư wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai thoi yơ, mă-lei Sư ưh kơ ăn kơ lu bơngai tơpôl noh băt ôh.

English: For whoever has, to him more will be given, and he will have abundance; but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hlôh, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơthim ăn kơ sư hlôh hloh kơ noh na sư gô hlôh tơpă. Bơngai bu ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng, bơngai noh rai hiong dôm tơdrong sư hlôh.

English: Therefore I speak to them in parables, because seeing they do not see, and hearing they do not hear, nor do they understand.
Bahnar: Inh bơtho pơjuang yua kơ lu sư lăng khŏm khŏm, mă lu sư ưh kơ 'bôh; lu sư mơ̆ng Inh bơtho tơhlôh ră, mă lu sư ưh kơ wao.

English: And in them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled, which says: ‘Hearing you will hear and shall not understand, And seeing you will see and not perceive
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'blep trŏ thoi Êsai chih khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Lu sư mơ̆ng Inh bơtho khŏm khŏm ră mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ hlôh, Măt lu sư lăng khŏm khŏm ră mă ưh kơ 'bôh tơdrong kiơ.

English: For the hearts of this people have grown dull. Their ears are hard of hearing, And their eyes they have closed, Lest they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears, Lest they should understand with their hearts and turn, So that I should heal them.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ đon lu sư kơtul dêh, Mă-lei lu sư oei wă pơchĭt đon sư kơdih khŏm khŏm 'mơ̆i, Păng măt lu sư wă kơ tep ling-lang. Dah lu sư 'nĕ kơ pơm đon thoi noh, lei măt lu sư gơh 'bôh, Đon lu sư gơh kơtơ̆ng nhên, lu sư gơh tơchĕng kơdih băt wih tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, Na Sư gô pơklaih đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch lu sư.’

English: But blessed are your eyes for they see, and your ears for they hear
Bahnar: Yêsu oei pơma kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Mă-lei gah lu iĕm âu, iĕm hiôk yua kơ măt iĕm 'bôh, đon iĕm gơh hlôh.

English: for assuredly, I say to you that many prophets and righteous men desired to see what you see, and did not see it, and to hear what you hear, and did not hear it.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đei lơ bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei păng lơ bơngai lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ sơdơ̆r kơ 'bôh tơdrong iĕm 'bôh dang ei ră mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ tam 'bôh ôh; lu sư 'maih mơ̆ng dôm tơdrong iĕm kơtơ̆ng dang ei ră, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ tam kơtơ̆ng ôh.

English: “Therefore hear the parable of the sower
Bahnar: “Iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ wă kơ hlôh tơdrong bơngai rei 'ba 'noh hei wă khan kiơ.

English: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom, and does not understand it, then the wicked one comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is he who received seed by the wayside.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mơ̆ng đe bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n, lu mơ'nah ưh kơ hlôh, lu sư thoi lĕ găr 'ba đe rei huŏng 'bơ̆t trong. Na yang kơnê̆ Satan năm tơbeh lê̆ kuă ăn iŏk nơ̆r đe bơtho 'noh.

English: But he who received the seed on stony places, this is he who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă thoi lĕ găr 'ba huŏng 'bơ̆t tơmo trêl, lu sư kơtơ̆ng đe bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư hưch hanh păng iŏk hloi mơ̆n.

English: yet he has no root in himself, but endures only for a while. For when tribulation or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei ră tơnơm 'ba mă-lei rơh sư chăt ưh kơ jrŭ sư jing jô lôch hloi, 'noh wă khan lu sư đei ră đon lui mă-lei ưh kơ đunh lu sư jing achăng lê̆ yua kơ đe areh kơ lu sư lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now he who received seed among the thorns is he who hears the word, and the cares of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful.
Bahnar: Lu mơ'nah thoi lĕ kơ găr 'ba huŏng 'bơ̆t 'nhĕt jơla. Lu sư kơtơ̆ng đe bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ră mă-lei lu sư wă tơchĕng tơdrong arih sư kăl hloh, sư wă kơ mơdrŏng; thoi noh na tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ gơh wơ̆ păng ưh kơ đei plei.

English: But he who received seed on the good ground is he who hears the word and understands it, who indeed bears fruit and produces: some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.”
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai mă thoi lĕ kơ găr 'ba huŏng 'bơ̆t teh 'lơ̆ng, lu bơngai noh boih kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei păng hlôh wao, kiơ̆ hloi kơjăp, na đei plei tơpă, mơ'nah minh-hrĕng, mơ'nah tơdrâu-jĭt, mơ'nah pêng-jĭt.”

English: Another parable He put forth to them, saying: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma pơtih gia dơ̆ng kơ đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n thoi âu: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai năm rei adrĕch 'ba 'lơ̆ng tơ mir sư.

English: but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat and went his way.
Bahnar: Na đei minh 'nu bơngai nai areh kơ sư, tơ kơmăng kơplah hnam dơnŏ sư oei tep minh 'nu bơngai mă areh kơ sư noh năm rei găr 'nhĕt tơ mir sư na weh tơ nai.

English: But when the grain had sprouted and produced a crop, then the tares also appeared.
Bahnar: 'Ba păng 'nhĕt wơ̆ hơdai hơnơ̆ng truh huăt, na bơngai mă rei 'ba noh kơnăl kơ 'ba noh 'nhĕt krênh dêh.

English: So the servants of the owner came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? How then does it have tares?’
Bahnar: Na lu đĭch sư năm jet sư khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, sơnăm sơ̆ ih rei adrĕch 'lơ̆ng kư̆m thoi sơnăm âu, mă-lei 'nhĕt dă 'biơ̆, na liơ sơnăm âu 'nhĕt krênh kranh hloh kơ sơnăm sơ̆?’

English: He said to them, ‘An enemy has done this.’ The servants said to him, ‘Do you want us then to go and gather them up?’
Bahnar: Yŏng sư khan: ‘Đei bơngai nai areh kơ inh na sư năm rei găr 'nhĕt tơ mir bơ̆n.’ Lu đĭch sư khan: ‘Ih hăm wă kơ nhôn buch pơđĭ 'nhĕt noh?’

English: But he said, ‘No, lest while you gather up the tares you also uproot the wheat with them.
Bahnar: Yŏng sư khan: ‘Ưh ôh, hli kơ iĕm buch 'bơm 'ba.

English: Let both grow together until the harvest, and at the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, “First gather together the tares and bind them in bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my barn.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Lê̆ 'ba hăm 'nhĕt wơ̆ hơdai truh đum kư̆m bưh na inh gô khan kơ iĕm bơngai mă kĕch 'ba noh ning-mônh thoi âu: Hơdrol kơ iĕm wă kĕch, iĕm buch pơđĭ 'nhĕt noh 'mơ̆i chô̆ akŭm tung tŭk tơ ŭnh, đơ̆ng noh na iĕm kĕch tuh 'ba bơ̆n tơ kŭ.’ ”

English: Another parable He put forth to them, saying: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and sowed in his field
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma pơtih gia dơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai tơpôl noh thoi âu: “Lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r, lu sư thoi lĕ kơ găr sơ'bei, găr noh iĕ hloh kơ đĭ-đăng găr nai.

English: which indeed is the least of all the seeds; but when it is grown it is greater than the herbs and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and nest in its branches.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp đe rei boih sư chăt kơjung hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu hla 'nhot nai. Sư chăt kơjung atŏ kơ 'long nai mơ̆n na sem gơh pơm tơpu tơ dơng sư.”

English: Another parable He spoke to them: “The kingdom of heaven is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal till it was all leavened.”
Bahnar: Yêsu oei bơtho pơtih gia kơ lu sư dơ̆ng: “Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r kon bơngai thoi lĕ kơ 'buih pông. Minh 'nu drŏ-kăn iŏk 'buih pông tŏ sĕt bơlŭ păng tơpŭng mi minh kơthŭng na tơpŭng noh kư̆m pông pơđĭ kơ minh kơthŭng noh mơ̆n.”

English: All these things Jesus spoke to the multitude in parables; and without a parable He did not speak to them
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dôm tơdrong noh kơ lu bơngai tơpôl, Sư bơtho pơtih gia ngăl

English: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying: “I will open My mouth in parables; I will utter things kept secret from the foundation of the world.”
Bahnar: wă kơ trŏ thoi minh 'nu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu: “Inh iŏk tơdrong mă đe ưh tam kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆, Wă bơtho pơtih gia kơ lu sư dang ei.”

English: Then Jesus sent the multitude away and went into the house. And His disciples came to Him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the tares of the field.”
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho kơ lu bơngai tơpôl đang boih, na Sư mơ̆t tơ hnam. Lu bơngai pơhrăm năm jet Sư thoi âu: “Apinh Ih tơblang kơ nhôn tơdrong pơtih gia 'ba păng 'nhĕt chăt hơdai noh hei wă khan kiơ.”

English: He answered and said to them: “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu tơblang ăn kơ lu sư: “Bơngai mă rei adrĕch 'ba 'lơ̆ng noh wă khan Inh Kon Bơngai.

English: The field is the world, the good seeds are the sons of the kingdom, but the tares are the sons of the wicked one.
Bahnar: Mir noh wă khan jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak. Adrĕch 'ba 'lơ̆ng noh wă khan lu bơngai mă ăn kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r sư. 'Nhĕt noh wă khan bơngai kiơ̆ yang kơnê̆.

English: The enemy who sowed them is the devil, the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are the angels.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă rei găr 'nhĕt noh wă khan yŏng pơgơ̆r yang kơnê̆. Bơyan 'ba noh wă khan năr tôch ning-mônh. Lu bơngai kĕch noh wă khan lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng.

English: Therefore as the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of this age.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă chô̆ akŭm 'nhĕt mă tung tŭk tơ ŭnh noh wă khan gô truh năr tôch ning-mônh Inh Kon Bơngai gô wơh lu linh jang kơ Inh năm rôp dôm lu bơngai mă pơtuah lu bơngai mă lui kơ Inh păng dôm lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm dêh char Inh pơgơ̆r

English: The Son of Man will send out His angels, and they will gather out of His kingdom all things that offend, and those who practice lawlessness
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă chô̆ akŭm 'nhĕt mă tung tŭk tơ ŭnh noh wă khan gô truh năr tôch ning-mônh Inh Kon Bơngai gô wơh lu linh jang kơ Inh năm rôp dôm lu bơngai mă pơtuah lu bơngai mă lui kơ Inh păng dôm lu bơngai mă pơm kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm dêh char Inh pơgơ̆r

English: and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
Bahnar: na klơ̆m tŭk lu sư tơ dơnâu ŭnh, lê̆ lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi tơkăp sơnĕnh tơ noh.

English: Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear!
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, năr noh kơnh lu sư oei hiôk hơđơ̆ng tơ dêh char 'Bă bơ̆n, dang lu sư pơchrang hơdah thoi lĕ kơ măt 'năr. Bu đei đon athei tơchĕng kơdih bĕ.

English: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, which a man found and hid; and for joy over it he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.
Bahnar: “Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r bơ̆n kư̆m thoi tơmam đe gĭt 'bŭ ôn lăm teh. Đei minh 'nu bơngai nai 'bôh tơmam đe 'bŭ tơ mir noh na sư gơlơ̆p tơmam noh păng teh wă kơ hrĕp. Jơhngơ̆m sư hiôk dêh. Sư brŏk tơ hnam tĕch đĭ dôm mŭk tơmam sư na răt mir đe 'noh.

English: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant seeking beautiful pearls
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia thoi âu dơ̆ng: Lu bơngai mă ăn 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r sư, noh kư̆m thoi bơngai adrin răt tơmam hu đe gĭt dêh.

English: who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it.
Bahnar: Lăp sư 'bôh đe tĕch tơmam hu rang hloh kơ hu nai na sư brŏk tơ hnam tĕch đĭ mŭk tơmam sư na răt tơmam hu mă đe gĭt noh.

English: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea and gathered some of every kind
Bahnar: “'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r bơ̆n thoi âu: Pơtih gia thoi lu bơngai juăt kơ traih jal tơ đak dơsĭ sư đei ka lơ, ka đe gĭt, ka đe ưh

English: which, when it was full, they drew to shore; and they sat down and gathered the good into vessels, but threw the bad away.
Bahnar: 'bĕnh kơ jal sư. Na sư hiot atŏk tơ kông tơoei rơih iŏk dôm lu ka đe gĭt tah lăm bai. Ka đe ưh sư tŭk.

English: So it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come forth, separate the wicked from among the just
Bahnar: Na mưh truh năr tôch ning-mônh kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n. Lu linh jang kơ Inh năm rơih iŏk dôm lu bơngai kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng

English: and cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth.”
Bahnar: tơlơ̆ tŭk lu sư tơ dơnâu ŭnh, lê̆ lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi kăp sơnĕnh tơ noh.”

English: Jesus said to them, “Have you understood all these things?” They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”
Bahnar: Yêsu jet lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Dôm tơdrong pơtih gia noh hei iĕm tam hlôh?” Lu sư khan: “Nhôn hlôh boih.”

English: Then He said to them, “Therefore every scribe instructed concerning the kingdom of heaven is like a householder who brings out of his treasure things new and old.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Thoi noh na lu iĕm bơngai mă pơhrăm păng Inh, iĕm gô jing thây bơtho đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r kon bơngai, na iĕm bơtho đe tơdrong 'nao tơdrong so kư̆m thoi 'bok tơ'ngla hnam chă asong kơ đe tơmam 'nao păng tơmam so sư, gô mơ̆ng kơ sư wă.”

English: Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these parables, that He departed from there.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dôm tơdrong pơtih gia noh đang boih, na Sư brŏk tơ pơlei Sư kơdih. Sư bơtho đe tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư mơ̆ng hlĭch kơ đon păng khan: “Lơliơ Sư băt dôm tơdrong noh? Păng Sư gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh tăm.

English: When He had come to His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished and said, “Where did this Man get this wisdom and these mighty works?
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dôm tơdrong pơtih gia noh đang boih, na Sư brŏk tơ pơlei Sư kơdih. Sư bơtho đe tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư mơ̆ng hlĭch kơ đon păng khan: “Lơliơ Sư băt dôm tơdrong noh? Păng Sư gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh tăm.

English: Is this not the carpenter’s son? Is not His mother called Mary? And His brothers James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?
Bahnar: Sư kon 'bok ot 'long đĕch lah, mĕ Sư Mari păng lu oh Sư Yakơ, Yôsep, Simôn, Jut.

English: And His sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this Man get all these things?”
Bahnar: Lu oh Sư drŏ-kăn oei tơ âu mơ̆n. Na liơ Sư gơh pơm dôm tơdrong noh?”

English: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the report about Jesus
Bahnar: Kơplah noh pơtao Hêrôt kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong mơsêh Yêsu. Pơtao Hêrôt kơplah noh sư pơgơ̆r dêh Galilê.

English: and said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist; he is risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ lu jơ̆ng 'bang sư: “'Noh Yôhan bơngai mă pơm 'batem kơ đe, sư lôch boih na dang ei sư iung arih dơ̆ng. Thoi noh na sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang.”

English: For Herod had laid hold of John and bound him, and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ pơtao Hêrôt wơh đe năm rôp chô̆ Yôhan tah tơ lăm hnam phak, yua kơ minh 'nu duch anăn sư Hêrôđia wă kơ thoi noh. Duch Hêrôđia ei akăn oh pơtao Hêrôt, anăn sư Philip. Mă-lei 'nhŏng sư Hêrôt tơgar iŏk akăn oh sư.

English: Because John had said to him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
Bahnar: Na Yôhan khan kơ Hêrôt: “Ih tơgar iŏk akăn oh ih ưh kơ trŏ ôh.”

English: And although he wanted to put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong noh na pơtao Hêrôt athei đe rôp tah Yôhan lăm hnam phak. Sư wă pơlôch kơplah noh hloi ră mơ̆n mă-lei sư ưh kơ pơ̆n, hli kơ lu kon pơlei pơla Juđê yua kơ lu bơngai Juđê băt kơ Yôhan bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: But when Herod’s birthday was celebrated, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod.
Bahnar: Lăp trŏ năr đe tơpŭ kơ Hêrôt, đe sa et pơrŏ na kon adruh duch Hêrôđia mơ̆t suang tơ anih đe et sa, na pơtao Hêrôt lăp đon dêh.

English: Therefore he promised with an oath to give her whatever she might ask.
Bahnar: Na sư mah khan kơ adruh noh thoi âu: “Dah inh hơlĕnh mă 'Bok Kei-Dei phak inh, ih wă kơ kiơ inh kư̆m ăn.”

English: So she, having been prompted by her mother, said, “Give me John the Baptist’s head here on a platter.”
Bahnar: Na mĕ sư athei kon sư apinh chơ̆ng kơ̆l Yôhan. Na adruh ei khan kơ pơtao: “Inh wă kơ ih chơ̆ng ăn kơ inh kơ̆l Yôhan 'măn 'bơ̆t pơnhan chhĕr dang ei hloi; bơngai mă pơm 'batem kơ đe, 'noh boih inh wă.”

English: And the king was sorry; nevertheless, because of the oaths and because of those who sat with him, he commanded it to be given to her.
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao Hêrôt kơtơ̆ng thoi noh sư sơ'ngon dêh. Mă-lei đêl nơ̆r sư pơkă hơdrol mah hiap akâu sư kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai et sa, na sư ưh kơ gơh lê̆ ôh, sư hơloh athei lu linh sư năm chơ̆ng kơ̆l Yôhan tơ hnam phak na ăn kơ adruh noh.

English: So he sent and had John beheaded in prison.
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao Hêrôt kơtơ̆ng thoi noh sư sơ'ngon dêh. Mă-lei đêl nơ̆r sư pơkă hơdrol mah hiap akâu sư kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai et sa, na sư ưh kơ gơh lê̆ ôh, sư hơloh athei lu linh sư năm chơ̆ng kơ̆l Yôhan tơ hnam phak na ăn kơ adruh noh.

English: And his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.
Bahnar: Na linh ei năm chơ̆ng hloi ako Yôhan 'măn 'bơ̆t pơnhan chhĕr chĕp ba kơ adruh noh. Na adruh noh iŏk năm ăn kơ mĕ sư.

English: Then his disciples came and took away the body and buried it, and went and told Jesus.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan năm iŏk akâu sư tung 'bŭ tơ bơsat. Đơ̆ng noh lu sư năm roi kơ Yêsu.

English: When Jesus heard it, He departed from there by boat to a deserted place by Himself. But when the multitudes heard it, they followed Him on foot from the cities.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh Sư lĕch hloi đơ̆ng hnam năm tơ thŏng-nan wơ̆r năm tơ anih kueng kơdrô̆. Lu pơlei kiơ̆ ei băt kơ Yêsu năm tơ anih noh boih na lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei noh yak jơ̆ng kiơ̆ Yêsu tơ anih kueng noh.

English: And when Jesus went out He saw a great multitude; and He was moved with compassion for them, and healed their sick.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan Sư 'bôh lơ bơngai kiơ̆ Sư na Sư mơnat dêh kơ lu bơngai noh, na Sư pơklaih hloi lu bơngai jĭ jăn.

English: When it was evening, His disciples came to Him, saying, “This is a deserted place, and the hour is already late. Send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages and buy themselves food.”
Bahnar: Lăp hiưp kơsơ̆ boih na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan kơ Sư thoi âu: “Anih âu kueng chơngue dêh păng kơsơ̆ boih tăm. Ih kuă kơ kiơ athei lu sư năm chă răt kơdih tơmam sa kiơ̆ pơlei jê̆ âu 'biơ̆?”

English: But Jesus said to them, “They do not need to go away. You give them something to eat.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Ưh kơ kăl kơ năm răt tơmam sa tơ pơlei đe ôh, iĕm 'me sư wăi.”

English: And they said to Him, “We have here only five loaves and two fish.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Bơ̆n đei lăp pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi păng 'bar hlak ka, liơ gơh mah?”

English: He said, “Bring them here to Me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Iĕm ba kơ Inh tơ âu.”

English: Then He commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass. And He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed and broke and gave the loaves to the disciples; and the disciples gave to the multitudes.
Bahnar: Yêsu athei đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơpôl ei tơoei kơpal 'nhĕt. Klaih kơ noh Sư iŏk pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi păng 'bar hlak ka ei ngoi tơ plĕnh krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei, na phĕ 'bĕng mi ăn kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư chă asong kơ bôl buăl.

English: So they all ate and were filled, and they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments that remained.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai sa 'bĕng mi ei phĭ mah rơkah rơkai boih. Đơ̆ng noh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư chă dônh tah tơ bai mă đơ̆ng đêl lu sư sa rơkah, kư̆m mah oei 'bĕnh kơ mơjĭt-'bar tŏ bai plơ̆ng dơ̆ng.

English: Now those who had eaten were about five thousand men, besides women and children.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă sŏng sa ei pơđăm-rơbâu 'nu jô̆ gah bơngai drŏ-nglo đĕch, ưh kơ đei jô̆ drŏ-kăn păng hơ'lơ̆p ôh.

English: Immediately Jesus made His disciples get into the boat and go before Him to the other side, while He sent the multitudes away.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu athei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư hao thŏng-nan rai tŏk gô pah to đak dơsĭ Galilê păng Sư athei hloi lu bơngai tơpôl noh brŏk tơ anih hnam lu sư kơdih kơdih.

English: And when He had sent the multitudes away, He went up on the mountain by Himself to pray. Now when evening came, He was alone there.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu sơlah đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơpôl noh tŏk tơ kông kơdrô̆ wă krao khan kơ 'Bă Sư. Lăp 'năr mơ̆t măng mơt boih Sư oei tơ noh mơ̆n.

English: But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, tossed by the waves, for the wind was contrary.
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư oei wơ̆r thŏng-nan tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ. Lu sư wơ̆r anat dêh yua kơ đak poh-yă păng kial tơhlu sơdrơ̆k.

English: Now in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went to them, walking on the sea.
Bahnar: Lăp tŏk-bŏk leng gong Yêsu jur đơ̆ng kông yak kơpal đak dơsĭ năm tơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư.

English: And when the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, “It is a ghost!” And they cried out for fear.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư 'bôh Yêsu yak kơpal đak dơsĭ lu sư hli dêh, lu sư khan: “'Noh atâu boih.” Na lu sư ôr tơkĕch.

English: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Be of good cheer! It is I; do not be afraid.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu thar khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm 'nĕ pă hli, Inh âu lah.”

English: And Peter answered Him and said, “Lord, if it is You, command me to come to You on the water.”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan kơ Sư: “Ơ 'Bok, tơ̆ng Ih tơpă lei Ih ăn kơ inh gơh yak kơpal đak năm tơ Ih.”

English: So He said, “Come.” And when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Năm tơ âu wăi.” Na Pêtrôs jur hloi đơ̆ng thŏng-nan yak kơpal đak năm tơ Sư.

English: But when he saw that the wind was boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink he cried out, saying, “Lord, save me!”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs sư hli kơ kial hơbŭt tih na akâu sư hiŭp hiŭp wă krăm hloi, na sư jah tơtom krao Yêsu khan: “Ơ 'Bok, hiot inh bĕ.”

English: And immediately Jesus stretched out His hand and caught him, and said to him, “O you of little faith, why did you doubt?”
Bahnar: Yêsu thar tơkan rôp ti păng khan: “Liơ ih lui rơdu dêh, liơ ih ưh kơ lui ngeh kơ Inh?”

English: And when they got into the boat, the wind ceased.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh bre Sư tŏk tơ thŏng-nan kial thĕng hloi ưh pă tơhlu dơ̆ng.

English: Then those who were in the boat came and worshiped Him, saying, “Truly You are the Son of God.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư oei lăm thŏng-nan sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh kơ Sư păng khan: “Ih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.”

English: When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư tŏk găn hlôi kơ đak dơsĭ boih, lu sư truh tơ tơring Gênêsaret.

English: And when the men of that place recognized Him, they sent out into all that surrounding region, brought to Him all who were sick
Bahnar: Đe kơnăl hloi kơ Sư na đe năm chă roi jơ̆p-jang tơring ei athei anhăk ba lu bơngai jĭ jăn năm tơ Yêsu.

English: Then the scribes and Pharisees who were from Jerusalem came to Jesus, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na lu bơngai Pharisi păng lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt Juđê đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem năm tơ Yêsu. Lu sư jet Yêsu khan

English: “Why do Your disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”
Bahnar: “Yua kơ kiơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Ih ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt yă 'bok bơ̆n pơkă sơ̆, lu sư sŏng sa ưh kơ ôp ti?”

English: He answered and said to them, “Why do you also transgress the commandment of God because of your tradition?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Bĭ lei iĕm tŭk kơ kiơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă jing kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt iĕm kơdih?

English: For God commanded, saying, ‘Honor your father and your mother’; and, ‘He who curses father or mother, let him be put to death.’
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă thoi âu: ‘Iĕm athei lui yom kơ mĕ 'bă păng dah bơngai bu pơma kơnê̆ kơ mĕ 'bă sư, athei pơlôch tŭk bơngai noh.’

English: But you say, ‘Whoever says to his father or mother, “Whatever profit you might have received from me is a gift to God”
Bahnar: Gah lu iĕm khan: ‘Bơngai bu khan kơ mĕ 'bă sư khan: Mŭk tơmam inh wă 'me sa biĕm ră inh pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĭ boih,’

English: then he need not honor his father or mother.’ Thus you have made the commandment of God of no effect by your tradition.
Bahnar: na iĕm khan bơngai noh huay pă kăl kơ 'me rong mĕ 'bă sư dơ̆ng. Iĕm pơjing tơdrong juăt kơdih bơtho đe thoi noh na iĕm jing tŭk tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei boih.

English: Hypocrites! Well did Isaiah prophesy about you, saying
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh, Êsai chih nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu na 'blep kơ iĕm dang ei tơpă

English: ‘These people draw near to Me with their mouth, And honor Me with their lips, But their heart is far from Me.
Bahnar: ‘Lu bơngai âu ư-ang kơ Inh păng 'bơ̆r đĕch, jơhngơ̆m klơm klak sư ataih đơ̆ng Inh.

English: And in vain they worship Me, Teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”
Bahnar: Lu sư kơkuh kơ Inh ưh kơ yua kiơ. Lu sư bơtho tơdrong ala teh; mă-lei khan tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.’ ”

English: When He had called the multitude to Himself, He said to them, “Hear and understand
Bahnar: Yêsu krao đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kiơ̆ ei na khan: “Apinh iĕm mơ̆ng Inh 'biơ̆ păng pơwao kơdih

English: Not what goes into the mouth defiles a man; but what comes out of the mouth, this defiles a man.”
Bahnar: Dôm lu tơmam sa kon bơngai sa ưh kơ đei pơm kơ kon bơngai jing yoch ôh, tơdrong pơm yoch noh lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r kon bơngai na kon bơngai jing yoch.”

English: Then His disciples came and said to Him, “Do You know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?”
Bahnar: Đang Yêsu pơma thoi noh boih na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm khan kơ Sư: “Ih hăm băt lu bơngai Pharisi ơh kơ Ih pơma thoi noh hei?”

English: But He answered and said, “Every plant which My heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu pơma pơjuang kơ lu bơngai ei thoi âu: “'Long kiơ 'Bă Inh tơ plĕnh ti ưh kơ đei pơtăm, 'long noh Sư buch tŭk pơđĭ.

English: Let them alone. They are blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind leads the blind, both will fall into a ditch.”
Bahnar: Na iĕm 'nĕ mah hiơ̆k tơdrong sư ơh noh, yua kơ lu sư bơngai bơtho đe ră mă-lei dang bơngai măt tol. Dah bơngai măt tol chông ba bôl sư măt tol bre sư nơnăm gô huŏng tơ sơlŭng đĕch ưh kơ yua kiơ kơ bre sư ôh.”

English: Then Peter answered and said to Him, “Explain this parable to us.”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan: “Apinh Ih tơblang kơ nhôn tơdrong Ih pơtih gia noh hei.”

English: So Jesus said, “Are you also still without understanding?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ hlôh ôh hă?

English: Do you not yet understand that whatever enters the mouth goes into the stomach and is eliminated?
Bahnar: Đĭ dôm tơmam sa, bơ̆n sa mơ̆t lăm klak, klaih kơ noh lĕch đĭ.

English: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come from the heart, and they defile a man.
Bahnar: Pôm nơ̆r pơma đĕch, lĕch đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m đon kon bơngai, na pơm kơ kon bơngai jing yoch.

English: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m đon kon bơngai tơchĕng kơnê̆ na jing yoch: Sư pơlôch đe, kơtrŏ hăm akăn đe, sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, sư tơtông, sư oei pơma hơlĕnh, sư pơjăm pơjuă đe.

English: These are the things which defile a man, but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile a man.”
Bahnar: Tôm tơdrong kơnê̆ noh lĕch đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m đon kon bơngai na jing yoch. Tơdrong iĕm sŏng sa ưh kơ ôp ti noh ưh kơ đei pơm kơ iĕm yoch ôh.”

English: Then Jesus went out from there and departed to the region of Tyre and Sidon.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu năm tơ tơring Pơlei Tirơ hăm Pơlei Siđôn.

English: And behold, a woman of Canaan came from that region and cried out to Him, saying, “Have mercy on me, O Lord, Son of David! My daughter is severely demon-possessed.”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn bơngai Kanaan đơ̆ng tơring kiơ̆ ei năm tơ Yêsu apinh thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok, Ih kon sâu Đawit mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh wă pơm pơtao kon bơngai. Dang ei inh apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh năm pơklaih kon adruh inh yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t, sư pơmat măng năr.”

English: But He answered her not a word. And His disciples came and urged Him, saying, “Send her away, for she cries out after us.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu ưh kơ tơl sư. Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan kơ Sư thoi âu: “Apinh Ih jah tơgŭm sư, na sư jah brŏk, sư kiơ̆ bơ̆n nŏng kơ pơma 'bơ̆r re.”

English: But He answered and said, “I was not sent except to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Liơ, 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh Inh wă kơ Inh tơgŭm lu bơngai Isơrael, yua kơ lu bơngai Isơrael thoi triu jrok trong, na iĕm khan wă kơ Inh tơgŭm sư?”

English: Then she came and worshiped Him, saying, “Lord, help me!”
Bahnar: Na bơngai drŏ-kăn ei kơkuh 'nap 'bơ̆t anăp Sư păng khan: “Ơ 'Bok, apinh Ih mơnat tơgŭm inh 'biơ̆ bĕ.”

English: But He answered and said, “It is not good to take the children’s bread and throw it to the little dogs.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Lu bơngai Isơrael dang kon Inh, dah Inh tơgŭm ih bơngai tơmoi, lei dang Inh klơ̆m tŭk tơmam sa kon Inh ăn kơ kŏ sa.”

English: And she said, “Yes, Lord, yet even the little dogs eat the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok, trŏ boih, mă-lei inh wă kơ Ih tơgŭm inh 'biơ̆, yua kơ phŏ phŏ inh kư̆m 'bôh kŏ năm alep sa đêl kon hơ'lơ̆p sa asĭ.”

English: Then Jesus answered and said to her, “O woman, great is your faith! Let it be to you as you desire.” And her daughter was healed from that very hour.
Bahnar: Sư pơma trŏ thoi noh, na Yêsu khan: “Ơ yă, ih lui kơjăp tơpă. Tơdrong ih apinh noh gô đei kơ ih.” Kơplah noh kon adruh sư klaih hloi.

English: Jesus departed from there, skirted the Sea of Galilee, and went up on the mountain and sat down there.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu năm tơ jih đak dơsĭ Galilê, đang ngôi kiơ̆ jih đak noh Sư tŏk tơ kông tơoei pơdơh ngôi 'biơ̆.

English: Then great multitudes came to Him, having with them the lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others; and they laid them down at Jesus’ feet, and He healed them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kư̆m đei lơ bơngai năm chă Sư anhăk lu bơngai kue jo, mơ'nah măt tol, mơ'nah kơmlo, lơlap lơlang bơngai jĭ jăn nai. Lu sư tơ'bĭch pơdă 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu, na Yêsu tơgŭm pơklaih đĭ dôm lu bơngai jĭ jăn noh.

English: So the multitude marveled when they saw the mute speaking, the maimed made whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing; and they glorified the God of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpôl ei 'bôh tơdrong noh hlĭch tơpă: Bơngai kơmlo mah gơh pơma, bơngai kue jo kư̆m klaih 'lơ̆ng, bơngai măt tol gơh 'bôh hơdah, na lu sư ư-ang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael juăt kơkuh đơ̆ng sơ̆.

English: Now Jesus called His disciples to Himself and said, “I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now continued with Me three days and have nothing to eat. And I do not want to send them away hungry, lest they faint on the way.”
Bahnar: Yêsu krao lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư na khan: “Inh mơnat kơ lu bơngai tơpôl âu dêh, oei hơdai bơ̆n pêng năr boih tơmam sa lu sư đĭ pă đei boih. Dah bơ̆n tơwih lu sư brŏk klak hoh Inh hli kơ lu sư rơmơ̆n rok trong.”

English: Then His disciples said to Him, “Where could we get enough bread in the wilderness to fill such a great multitude?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Thoi yơ bơ̆n gơh đei tơmam sa 'me lu sư yua kơ anih kueng chơngue thoi âu?”

English: Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?” And they said, “Seven, and a few little fish.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet lu sư: “Iĕm đei dôm tŏ 'bĕng mi? Chĕp ba ăn kơ Inh tơ âu.” Lu sư khan: “Lăp tơpơh tŏ păng 'bar pêng găr ka.”

English: So He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.
Bahnar: Yêsu athei lu bơngai tơpôl ei tơoei tơ teh.

English: And He took the seven loaves and the fish and gave thanks, broke them and gave them to His disciples; and the disciples gave to the multitude.
Bahnar: Yêsu iŏk tơpơh tŏ 'bĕng mi păng 'bar pêng găr ka noh, krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei, phĕ hloi 'bĕng mi păng ka noh ăn kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư chă asong kơ lu bơngai tơpôl ei.

English: So they all ate and were filled, and they took up seven large baskets full of the fragments that were left.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai sŏng sa 'bĕng mi păng ka ei phĭ mah rơkah rơkai boih, na lu sư dônh tah tơ bai 'bĕnh tơpơh tŏ bai 'bĕng mi păng ka rơkah.

English: Now those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă sŏng sa ei puăn-rơbâu 'nu jô̆ gah drŏ-nglo đĕch, ưh kơ đei jô̆ drŏ-kăn păng hơ'lơ̆p ôh.

English: And He sent away the multitude, got into the boat, and came to the region of Magdala.
Bahnar: Đang lu sư sa phĭ boih na Yêsu athei lu bơngai tơpôl ei brŏk tơ hnam lu sư kơdih kơdih, na Yêsu tŏk thŏng-nan năm tơ tơring Magadan.

English: Then the Pharisees and Sadducees came, and testing Him asked that He would show them a sign from heaven.
Bahnar: Khŭl Pharisi păng khŭl Sađusê năm apinh Yêsu pơm tơdrong mơsêh đơ̆ng plĕnh ti. Lu sư khan wă kơ băt Yêsu đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă dah ưh. Mă tơpă sư wă pơlong Yêsu hăm gơh pơm dah ưh.

English: He answered and said to them, “When it is evening you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red’
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lăp 'năr mơ̆t, iĕm 'bôh hơdah 'năr pơchrang hơmơ̆l 'brê, noh iĕm băt năr dơning 'năr wă tŏ hlăng prăng hiôk.

English: and in the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ Hypocrites! You know how to discern the face of the sky, but you cannot discern the signs of the times.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr wă lĕch, iĕm 'bôh 'năr pơchrang 'brê păng đei hơmơ̆l găm, noh iĕm kư̆m băt kơ 'năr wă 'mi. Iĕm kơnăl kơ plĕnh wă 'mi dah prăng ră mă-lei liơ iĕm pơm ưh kơ băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r lu iĕm dang ei?

English: A wicked and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and no sign shall be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.” And He left them and departed.
Bahnar: Jơhnơr iĕm ahrei kơnê̆ dêh, na mă kuă kơ lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Iĕm pơm pơlong Inh tơ'bôh kơ iĕm tơdrong mơsêh wă kơ iĕm băt Inh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă dah ưh. Mă-lei Inh ưh kơ wă pơm tơdrong mơsêh thoi iĕm apinh noh ôh. Bĭ tơdrong Jôna sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, ka luăn sư pêng măng pêng năr, na ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m tơ'bôh kơ iĕm tơdrong mơsêh thoi noh mơ̆n, wă kơ iĕm băt Inh đơ̆ng Sư tơpă.” Đang kơ Sư pơma thoi noh Sư năm hloi tơ nai.

English: Now when His disciples had come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
Bahnar: Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tŏk thŏng-nan găn đak dơsĭ Galilê. Truh pah to boih na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư 'blŏk kơ 'bĕng mi lu sư hiơt kơ chĕp.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the Sadducees.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm athei kơchăng weh ataih kơ 'buih pông đe Pharisi păng đe Sađusê.”

English: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “It is because we have taken no bread.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong Sư pơma na lu sư tơkhan dih băl: “Sư pơma thoi noh băt Sư jô̆ kơ bơ̆n hiơt kơ chĕp 'bĕng mi kơlĕ.”

English: But Jesus, being aware of it, said to them, “O you of little faith, why do you reason among yourselves because you have brought no bread?
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu sư pơma gah tơdrong lu sư hiơt kơ chĕp 'bĕng mi na Yêsu khan: “Lơliơ iĕm lui oei rơdu hơnơ̆ng, Inh pơma tơdrong nai mă iĕm khan Inh jô̆ kơ iĕm hiơt kơ chĕp 'bĕng mi?

English: Do you not yet understand, or remember the five loaves of the five thousand and how many baskets you took up?
Bahnar: Iĕm ưh kơ băt ôh hă Inh gơh pơm 'bĕng mi? Liơ iĕm ưh kơ 'blŏk tơdrong Inh iŏk pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi 'me pơđăm-rơbâu 'nu bơngai? Iĕm dônh tah tơ bai rơkah dôm tŏ bai?

English: Nor the seven loaves of the four thousand and how many large baskets you took up?
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ 'blŏk ôh hă Inh iŏk tơpơh tŏ 'bĕng mi 'me puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai? Iĕm dônh tah tơ bai rơkah dôm tŏ bai?

English: How is it you do not understand that I did not speak to you concerning bread?—but to beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
Bahnar: Na lơliơ iĕm tơchĕng khan Inh jô̆ kơ iĕm hiơt kơ chĕp 'bĕng mi? Ưh kơ sĭ Inh jô̆ tơdrong noh ôh. Inh athei iĕm kơchăng weh ataih kơ 'buih pông đe Pharisi păng Sađusê.”

English: Then they understood that He did not tell them to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma thoi noh boih na lu sư băt kơ Yêsu ưh kơ athei sư kơchăng kơ 'buih 'bĕng mi pông tơpă ôh. Sư athei kơchăng weh ataih kơ 'bơ̆r đon đe Pharisi păng đe Sađusê bơtho, hli kơ apoh kơ lu sư.

English: When Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, saying, “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”
Bahnar: Yêsu năm truh tơ tơring Sêsarê Philip. Sư jet lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Đe krao anăn Inh Kon Bơngai bu?”

English: So they said, “Some say John the Baptist, some Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Mơ'nah đe krao Ih Yôhan bơngai pơm kơ đe 'batem. Mơ'nah khan Ih Êli, bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆. Đei bơngai mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan Ih 'bok Jêrêmi mă kư̆m pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, mơ'nah khan Ih bơngai nai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.”

English: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Bĭ iĕm khan Inh bu?”

English: Simon Peter answered and said, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
Bahnar: Simôn Pêtrôs khan: “Ih 'Bok Krist, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang.”

English: Jesus answered and said to him, “Blessed are you, Simon Bar-Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but My Father who is in heaven.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ơ Simôn, kon Yôhan, ih hiôk tơpă. Kon bơngai ưh kơ đei tơbăt kơ ih tơdrong noh ôh. 'Bă Inh mă oei tơ plĕnh ti đĕch tơbăt kơ ih tơdrong noh.

English: And I also say to you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build My church, and the gates of Hades shall not prevail against it.
Bahnar: Ơ Pêtrôs, Inh wă khan kơ ih, ih thoi lĕ kơ tơmo kŭk; kơpal tơmo kŭk noh boih Inh wă pơm hnam Inh, hnam noh wă khan lu bơngai lui kơ Inh. Na dôm lu yang kơnê̆ ưh kơ kĕ blah lu bơngai lui noh ôh.

English: And I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.”
Bahnar: Inh gô jao kơ ih chĕp khuă 'măng mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r. Thoi noh na mă dôm tơdrong kiơ ih wă kơ đe pơm tơ teh âu, 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti kư̆m ăn kơ lu sư pơm. Dôm tơdrong kiơ ih khă kuă ăn đe pơm tơ teh âu, 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti kư̆m khă ưh kơ ăn mơ̆n.”

English: Then He commanded His disciples that they should tell no one that He was Jesus the Christ.
Bahnar: Đang Sư pơma thoi noh boih na Sư khă lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kuă ăn roi kơ đe Sư boih 'Bok Krist.

English: From that time Jesus began to show to His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem, and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised the third day.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr noh boih Yêsu mă đe anăn 'Bok Krist, Sư roi kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Inh chu năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, tơ ei kơnh lu đe kră sek tơlang, lu 'bok soi tih păng lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê gô pơm kơ Inh lơ tơdrong kơnê̆ păng pơlôch hloi Inh. Mă-lei kơtĕch pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơiung arih Inh dơ̆ng.”

English: Then Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him, saying, “Far be it from You, Lord; this shall not happen to You!”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs krao Yêsu weh ataih 'biơ̆, sư wă khă Yêsu yua kơ Yêsu pơma thoi noh hei. Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ 'Bok, apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei 'nĕ ăn truh kơ Ih tơdrong 'noh.”

English: But He turned and said to Peter, “Get behind Me, Satan! You are an offense to Me, for you are not mindful of the things of God, but the things of men.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu hue lăng tơ Pêtrôs păng khan kơ sư: “Ơ Satan, jăk kơ e mă ataih đơ̆ng âu. Inh wă pơm kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă e pơgăn. E ưh kơ tơchĕng kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh, e tơchĕng kiơ̆ kơ kon bơngai đĕch.”

English: Then Jesus said to His disciples, “If anyone desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Dah bơngai bu wă kiơ̆ Inh, sư athei tŭk đĭ tơdrong sư kơdih păng tôi kơdih 'long pơglang chu lôch yua kơ wă kiơ̆ Inh.

English: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will find it.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh, bơngai noh gô lôch hoh hoh đĕch ưh kơ yua kiơ. Bơngai bu chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh, sư 'noh gô arih ling-lang.

English: For what profit is it to a man if he gains the whole world, and loses his own soul? Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
Bahnar: Mă bu mơdrŏng đei tôm mŭk tơmam tơ teh âu, dah sư ưh kơ arih ling-lang, lei truh sư lôch ưh pă đei yua kiơ boih. Mă sư mơdrŏng kư̆m ưh kơ gơh răt tơdrong arih sư ôh.

English: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of His Father with His angels, and then He will reward each according to his works.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh Inh Kon Bơngai gô jur dơ̆ng tơ teh âu hơdai păng linh jang 'lơ̆ng. Năr 'noh kơnh 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh mơsêh mơyang tih-tin rŏ sor tơpă. Inh gô sek tơlang kơ rim 'nu bơngai kiơ̆ thoi sư pơm tơ teh âu sơ̆.

English: “Assuredly, I say to you, there are some standing here who shall not taste death till they see the Son of Man coming in His kingdom.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đei lăm lu iĕm âu mơ'nah ưh tam mă lôch ôh, lu sư gô 'bôh Inh pơgơ̆r ning-mônh.”

English: Now after six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John his brother, led them up on a high mountain by themselves
Bahnar: Tơdrâu năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơ năr noh, Yêsu anhăk pêng 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, anăn lu sư Pêtrôs, Yakơ, Yôhan oh Yakơ, lu sư tŏk tơ kông kơjung kơdrô̆ lu sư.

English: and He was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and His clothes became as white as the light.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu tơwir akâu Sư kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp lu đe pêng 'nu noh, muh măt Sư, ao Sư, rang hơdah dang măt 'năr.

English: And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with Him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bôh blư kơ Môis hăm Êli jur pơma dơnuh hăm Yêsu.

English: Then Peter answered and said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here; if You wish, let us make here three tabernacles: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, bơ̆n oei tơ âu hiôk dêh. Lê̆ kơ inh pơm kơ bơ̆n pêng tŏ bơsŭn; minh pôm pơm kơ Ih, minh pôm pơm kơ Môis, minh pôm pơm kơ Êli.”

English: While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them; and suddenly a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. Hear Him!”
Bahnar: Kơplah Pêtrôs oei pơma thoi noh 'bôh glĭp kơ hơmơ̆l kok rang hơdah jur gom lu sư. Păng đei nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma đơ̆ng lăm hơmơ̆l noh khan: “Sư âu Kon Inh mă 'mêm kơeng tơpă, Inh lăp đon kơ Sư dêh. Na iĕm ling-lang athei chu yom kơ Sư.”

English: And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces and were greatly afraid.
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma thoi noh jơhngơ̆m lu sư hli dêh, lu sư 'nap kŭp kơ̆l tơ teh.

English: But Jesus came and touched them and said, “Arise, and do not be afraid.”
Bahnar: Yêsu năm tơiung lu sư păng khan: “Iung bĕ, huay kơ hli ôh.”

English: When they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no one but Jesus only.
Bahnar: Lu đe noh ngoi lăng jua ưh pă 'bôh bu dơ̆ng hơdai hăm Sư dơ̆ng, pă minh 'nu Sư đĕch oei 'bơ̆t noh.

English: Now as they came down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, “Tell the vision to no one until the Son of Man is risen from the dead.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh na lu sư jur đơ̆ng kông noh na Yêsu khă lu sư thoi âu: “Iĕm 'nĕ chă roi kơ đe hŏ dôm tơdrong iĕm 'bôh hei đơ̆ng dang ei truh Inh Kon Bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch ning-mônh.”

English: And His disciples asked Him, saying, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
Bahnar: Na lu sư jet Yêsu khan: “Lơliơ lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê khan Êli jur hơdrol kơ 'Bok Krist?”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “Indeed, Elijah is coming first and will restore all things.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Trŏ boih Êli jur hơdrol kơ Krist yua kơ sư bơngai hơmet ming tôm tơdrong hơdrol.

English: But I say to you that Elijah has come already, and they did not know him but did to him whatever they wished. Likewise the Son of Man is also about to suffer at their hands.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Êli truh boih, mă-lei đe ưh kơ kơnăl kơ sư, đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư kiơ̆ gô mơ̆ng kơ đe wă. Na đơ̆ng âu tơ dơning dơmônh đe kư̆m pơm kơnê̆ kơ Inh Kon Bơngai thoi noh mơ̆n.”

English: Then the disciples understood that He spoke to them of John the Baptist.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư băt kơ Êli noh, wă khan Yôhan, bơngai mă pơm kơ đe 'batem.

English: And when they had come to the multitude, a man came to Him, kneeling down to Him and saying
Bahnar: Yêsu păng pêng 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư noh brŏk tơ lu bơngai tơpôl. Tơ ei đei minh 'nu bơngai năm sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng 'bơ̆t anăp Sư păng khan

English: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is an epileptic and suffers severely; for he often falls into the fire and often into the water.
Bahnar: “Ơ 'Bok, apinh Ih mơnat 'biơ̆ kơ kon inh sư bơngai hơwing, yang kơnê̆ nŏng kơ glơ̆m sư, phŏ pơ̆k tơ ŭnh phŏ pơ̆k tơ đak pơmat-tat măng năr.

English: So I brought him to Your disciples, but they could not cure him.”
Bahnar: Inh năm apinh ră boih tơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Ih, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ gơh pơklaih.”

English: Then Jesus answered and said, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him here to Me.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Ơ lu iĕm mă oei lui rơdu hơnơ̆ng kư̆m oei pơm yoch, iĕm wă kơ Inh oei hơdai iĕm đunh dang yơ 'mơ̆i na iĕm lui kơjăp? Iĕm wă kơ Inh gleh dang yơ 'mơ̆i na iĕm gơh pơklaih đe?” Na Yêsu khan kơ bơngai ei: “Năm ba kon ih tơ âu năm”

English: And Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of him; and the child was cured from that very hour.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu pơpuh yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu bơngai 'lơ̆p noh. Yang kơnê̆ lĕch jăk hloi ưh pă pơm kơ bơngai 'lơ̆p noh pơ̆k dơ̆ng.

English: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why could we not cast it out?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu jet Yêsu kơdrô̆ khan: “Yua kơ kiơ nhôn ưh kơ gơh pơpuh yang kơnê̆?”

English: So Jesus said to them, “Because of your unbelief; for assuredly, I say to you, if you have faith as a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “'Noh yua kơ tơdrong lui iĕm oei rơdu iĕ. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, mă khan tơdrong lui iĕm rơdu iĕ tŏ găr sơ'bei dah sư rai wơ̆ thoi găr sơ'bei chăt kơjung lei iĕm gơh pơm tôm tơdrong nai hai.
