Pơtih gia iĕm sơkat kơ kông âu khan thoi âu: Ơ kông, hiŏng jăk kơdih tơ nai, na sư hiŏng hloi kơdih tơ nai.”

English: However, this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.”
Bahnar: Na gah tơdrong yang kơnê̆ thoi âu, dah bơ̆n ưh kơ krao khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hơdrol păng ưh kơ ơ̆t kơ por, mă bơ̆n pơpuh lap đĕch, sư ưh kơ chu kơdâu ôh.

English: Now while they were staying in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư brŏk akŭm tơ dêh Galilê Yêsu roi dơ̆ng tơdrong Sư wă lôch: “Đe gô rôp pơjao Inh Kon Bơngai tơ ti kon bơngai tơ ala teh âu.

English: and they will kill Him, and the third day He will be raised up.” And they were exceedingly sorrowful.
Bahnar: Lu đe ei boih pơlôch Inh, mă-lei kơtĕch pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng Inh iung arih dơ̆ng.” Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kơtơ̆ng Sư khan thoi noh, lu sư sơ'ngon dêh.

English: When they had come to Capernaum, those who received the temple tax came to Peter and said, “Does your Teacher not pay the temple tax?”
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Kapernum, lu bơngai ra iŏk jên thuê̆ jet Pêtrôs khan: “Thoi yơ, 'bok thây ih hăm wă ăn thuê̆?”

English: He said, “Yes.” And when he had come into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth take customs or taxes, from their sons or from strangers?”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan: “Sư ăn mơ̆n” Lăp Pêtrôs mơ̆t tơ hnam Yêsu thar jet hloi: “Ơ Simôn, lu 'bok pơtao iŏk thuê̆ đơ̆ng bu? Sư iŏk đơ̆ng lu kon sư, dah đơ̆ng bơngai nai?”

English: Peter said to Him, “From strangers.” Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are free.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan kơ Sư: “Lu sư iŏk thuê̆ đơ̆ng bơngai nai.” Yêsu khan kơ Pêtrôs: “'Noh bơ̆n băt kơ 'bok pơtao kuă ăn kon sư duh thuê̆, bơ̆n kư̆m ưh kơ duh ôh, yua kơ bơ̆n kon pơtao 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Nevertheless, lest we offend them, go to the sea, cast in a hook, and take the fish that comes up first. And when you have opened its mouth, you will find a piece of money; take that and give it to them for Me and you.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei ba ưh kơ wă pơkăl kơ lu bơngai iŏk thuê̆ ôh, ba athei duh pơyom. Na dang ei ih năm wah kơ ba ka tơ đak dơsĭ bĕ. Ih 'bôh ka mă kăp wah hơdrol ih iŏk pŏ 'bơ̆r sư hŏ, lăm 'bơ̆r sư noh đei minh hlak jên. Jên noh lăp tôm hloi kơ ba ăn thuê̆. Na ih iŏk jên noh ăn kơ lu bơngai mă iŏk thuê̆, khan kơ lu sư ba ăn tôm boih.”

English: At that time the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Who then is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
Bahnar: Hơtai noh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm jet Sư khan: “Dôm lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r bu pơm tih 'biơ̆?”

English: Then Jesus called a little child to Him, set him in the midst of them
Bahnar: Na Yêsu krao minh 'nu bơngai 'lơ̆p ăn kơ sư oei tŏk-bŏk lu sư.

English: and said, “Assuredly, I say to you, unless you are converted and become as little children, you will by no means enter the kingdom of heaven.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Iĕm lăng bơngai 'lơ̆p âu sư ưh kơ đei layơ pơma pơang akâu kơdih. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, dah iĕm khan wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r iĕm, lei iĕm athei tơplih ming jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm kiơ̆ thoi bơngai 'lơ̆p âu.

English: Therefore whoever humbles himself as this little child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
Bahnar: Dah iĕm pơm kiơ̆ bơngai 'lơ̆p âu ưh kơ pơang akâu, lei bơngai noh boih pơm tih lu bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r.

English: Whoever receives one little child like this in My name receives Me.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu sơng iŏk bơngai 'lơ̆p âu yua kơ bơngai 'lơ̆p âu lui kơ Inh, bơngai noh dang sơng iŏk Inh.

English: “Whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to sin, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were drowned in the depth of the sea.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơtuah lu bơngai hơ'lơ̆p mă lui kơ Inh 'lơ̆ng hloh đe jah chô̆ ako sư hăm tơpăl tơmo tih, hơtat lê̆ sư tơ klŏng đak dơsĭ, lei sư hiôk 'biơ̆ yua kơ sư huay kơ gơh pơtuah lu hơ'lơ̆p.

English: Woe to the world because of offenses! For offenses must come, but woe to that man by whom the offense comes!
Bahnar: Tơpă yơh bơ̆n gô đei tơdrong đe pơhlŭ bơ̆n pơm yoch, mă-lei lu bơngai pơhlŭ bơ̆n noh, ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô phak pơmat lu sư kal dêh.

English: “If your hand or foot causes you to sin, cut it off and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life lame or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet, to be cast into the everlasting fire.
Bahnar: “Dah minh pah ti iĕm dah jơ̆ng iĕm pơm kơ iĕm yoch, chơ̆ng tŭk minh pah ti dah jơ̆ng noh, na oei pă minh pah ti dah jơ̆ng noh, mă-lei gơh mơ̆t oei hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang. 'Noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ iĕm oei tôm 'bar pah jơ̆ng ti mă-lei wă huŏng pơđĭ hăm akâu tơ dơnâu ŭnh ưh kơ layơ păt.

English: And if your eye causes you to sin, pluck it out and cast it from you. It is better for you to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire.
Bahnar: Dah minh pah măt iĕm pơm kơ iĕm yoch, kuek tŭk minh pah măt iĕm noh, na oei pă minh pah măt mă-lei gơh mơ̆t oei hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang. 'Noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ iĕm oei tôm 'bar pah măt mă-lei huŏng tơ dơnâu ŭnh 'Bok Kei-Dei phak.

English: “Take heed that you do not despise one of these little ones, for I say to you that in heaven their angels always see the face of My Father who is in heaven.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, iĕm 'nĕ chă pơjăm pơjuă lu bơngai hơ'lơ̆p yua kơ lu sư đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng wei-lăng. Linh jang 'lơ̆ng noh oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei 'Bă Inh ling-lang.

English: For the Son of Man has come to save that which was lost.
Bahnar: Inh Kon Bơngai truh wă pơklaih kon bơngai hiong hiơt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: “What do you think? If a man has a hundred sheep, and one of them goes astray, does he not leave the ninety-nine and go to the mountains to seek the one that is straying?
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia minh 'nu bơngai đei minh-hrĕng tŏ triu na hiong minh pôm tơ nai, sư lê̆ tơsĭn-jĭt tơsĭn noh chă sa tơ groi, na tơ'ngla sư năm chă minh pôm hiong noh tơ̆p 'bôh.

English: And if he should find it, assuredly, I say to you, he rejoices more over that sheep than over the ninety-nine that did not go astray.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm dơ̆ng, lăp sư chă triu sư mă hiong noh 'bôh boih sư chhơp tơpă hloh kơ sư chhơp kơ tơsĭn-jĭt tơsĭn mă ưh kơ hiong noh.

English: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish.
Bahnar: Mă 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, Sư ưh kơ wă kơ minh 'nu bơngai 'lơ̆p thoi âu hiong răm.

English: “Moreover if your brother sins against you, go and tell him his fault between you and him alone. If he hears you, you have gained your brother.
Bahnar: “Dah bôl buăl bơngai lui pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm, iĕm athei khan kơ sư kơdrô̆ biĕm. Dah sư chu kơ iĕm khan, lei iĕm oei hiôk hăm sư.

English: But if he will not hear, take with you one or two more, that ‘by the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.’
Bahnar: Dah sư ưh kơ chu kơ nơ̆r iĕm khan, lei iĕm krao 'bar pêng 'nu 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui năm kiơ̆ mơ̆ng biĕm pơma băl, wă kơ lu bơngai mă kiơ̆ mơ̆ng biĕm noh, băt kơ tơdrong iĕm pơma dih băl noh thoi yơ.

English: And if he refuses to hear them, tell it to the church. But if he refuses even to hear the church, let him be to you like a heathen and a tax collector.
Bahnar: Dah sư ưh tam mă chu kơ lu bơngai kơdranh pơma lei iĕm khan kơ lu bơngai mă akŭm lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei. Dah sư oei sơngah ưh kơ chu kơ lu bơngai akŭm lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei lei iĕm lăng sư thoi bơngai tơmoi khŭl nai păng thoi bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ đĕch.

English: “Assuredly, I say to you, whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, tơdrong kiơ iĕm khă kuă ăn đe pơm tơ teh âu, 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti kư̆m khă ưh kơ ăn mơ̆n. Tơdrong kiơ iĕm wă kơ đe pơm tơ teh âu, Sư kư̆m wă thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: “Again I say to you that if two of you agree on earth concerning anything that they ask, it will be done for them by My Father in heaven.
Bahnar: Inh khan dơ̆ng thoi âu, dah 'bar 'nu bre bu oei tơ teh âu pôm đon dih băl krao khan wă apinh Sư tơdrong kiơ, 'Bă bơ̆n mă oei tơ plĕnh ti Sư gô asong tơdrong bre bu mă apinh noh tơpă.

English: For where two or three are gathered together in My name, I am there in the midst of them.”
Bahnar: Mă rim anih tơ yơ yơ, mă 'bar pêng 'nu bơngai dah akŭm băl tơdrong Inh, Inh kư̆m oei hơdai lu bơngai noh tơ noh.”

English: Then Peter came to Him and said, “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Up to seven times?”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs năm jet Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, dah inh đei 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui, sư pơm kơnê̆ hil kơ inh, truh dôm 'măng sư hil inh huay kơ jô̆ yo? Hăm trŏ hloh kơ tơpơh 'măng na inh jô̆ yo?”

English: Jesus said to him, “I do not say to you, up to seven times, but up to seventy times seven.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ưh ôh. Inh wă kơ ih huay kơ jô̆ yo truh tơ dôm hrĕng 'măng.

English: Therefore the kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who wanted to settle accounts with his servants.
Bahnar: Inh khan thoi noh yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n thoi âu: Pơtih gia đei minh 'nu 'bok pơtao tak lăng hla bơar lu bơngai jang kơ sư hre đom kơ sư.

English: And when he had begun to settle accounts, one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents.
Bahnar: Sư jet lu bơngai mă hre đom kơ sư noh, na đe năm ba kơ sư minh 'nu bơngai hre kơ sư mơjĭt-rơbâu jên hu.

English: But as he was not able to pay, his master commanded that he be sold, with his wife and children and all that he had, and that payment be made.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư ưh kơ đei jên wă kla ôh. Na 'bok pơtao athei sư tĕch đĭ akâu sư, kon akăn sư păng mŭk tơmam sư, wă kla tơdrong sư hre noh jah tôch.

English: The servant therefore fell down before him, saying, ‘Master, have patience with me, and I will pay you all.’
Bahnar: Na bơngai mă hre kơ sư ei sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh kơ 'bok pơtao. Sư khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, apinh ih gô 'biơ̆, inh gô duh kơ ih tôm.’

English: Then the master of that servant was moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao 'bôh bơngai hre pơma sơdrĭ sơdrôi thoi noh na sư mơnat. Sư ăn bơngai mă hre kơ sư noh brŏk tơ hnam păng tŭk đĭ dôm rơbâu đêl hre noh.

English: “But that servant went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii; and he laid hands on him and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe!’
Bahnar: Bơngai mă hre kơ 'bok pơtao noh brŏk tơ hnam, sư tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bôl sư kư̆m jang kơ 'bok pơtao. Bôl sư hre kơ sư lăp minh hlak jên hu đĕch, mă-lei sư pơplŏng rôp ket ako bôl sư păng khan: ‘Duh tôm bĕ na inh achăng.’

English: So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and begged him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will pay you all.’
Bahnar: Na bôl sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng sư păng khan: ‘Ơ 'nhŏng, apinh ih gô 'biơ̆, inh gô duh kơ ih tôm.’

English: And he would not, but went and threw him into prison till he should pay the debt.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai mă đêl hre kơ 'bok pơtao noh ưh kơ băt mơnat kơ bôl sư, sư tah bôl sư lăm hnam phak tơ̆p mă bôl sư duh tôm na tơlĕch.

English: So when his fellow servants saw what had been done, they were very grieved, and came and told their master all that had been done.
Bahnar: Lu bôl buăl nai 'bôh sư pơm kơ bôl sư thoi noh, lu sư sơ'ngon dêh păng năm roi hloi kơ 'bok pơtao dôm tơdrong sư pơm kơ bôl sư noh.

English: Then his master, after he had called him, said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt because you begged me.
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao kơtơ̆ng thoi noh krao sư păng khan: ‘Ơ bơngai jang kơ inh, ih pơm kơnê̆ dêh. Inh tŭk đĭ dôm jên ih hre kơ inh noh boih yua kơ ih apinh inh athei mơnat kơ ih

English: Should you not also have had compassion on your fellow servant, just as I had pity on you?’
Bahnar: na lơliơ ih ưh kơ băt mơnat kơ bôl ih thoi inh mơnat kơ ih?’

English: And his master was angry, and delivered him to the torturers until he should pay all that was due to him.
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao ơh kơ bơngai noh ưh kơ băt mơnat kơ bôl sư, na 'bok pơtao jao bơngai noh kơ 'bok tih wei hnam phak, chĭt sư lăm hnam phak tơ̆p sư duh tôm kơ 'bok pơtao.

English: “So My heavenly Father also will do to you if each of you, from his heart, does not forgive his brother his trespasses.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'noh thoi noh boih, na 'Bă bơ̆n tơ plĕnh ti gô pơm kơ iĕm thoi noh mơ̆n, dah iĕm ưh kơ mơnat kơ tơdrong yoch 'nhŏng oh iĕm hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m.”

English: Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these sayings, that He departed from Galilee and came to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma tơdrong noh đang boih, na Sư năm đơ̆ng dêh Galilê tơ dêh Juđê pah to krong Jôrđăn.

English: And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them there.
Bahnar: Tơ noh đei lơ bơngai kiơ̆ Sư, na Sư chă pơklaih lu bơngai jĭ jăn.

English: The Pharisees also came to Him, testing Him, and saying to Him, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for just any reason?”
Bahnar: Đei bơngai Pharisi năm jet pơlong Sư, wă kơ Sư pơma ưh kơ trŏ tơdrong juăt. Lu sư jet thoi âu: “Kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n, bơ̆n achăng akăn tơdrong kiơ kư̆m bưh dah thoi yơ?”

English: And He answered and said to them, “Have you not read that He who made them at the beginning ‘made them male and female,’
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm ưh tam mă đŏk lăng ôh hă sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei chih khan thoi âu: ‘Blŭng-a sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing minh 'nu drŏ-nglo, minh 'nu drŏ-kăn.’

English: and said, ‘For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh’?
Bahnar: ‘Yua kơ thoi noh na bơngai drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn tơklah đơ̆ng mĕ 'bă sư kơdih na oei hơdai, bre sư jing minh sĕch minh akar.’

English: So then, they are no longer two but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let not man separate.”
Bahnar: Bre sư ưh pă thoi 'bar 'nu bơngai boih, bre sư thoi minh 'nu bơngai đĕch. Yua kơ thoi noh na kon bơngai bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh achăng lê̆ akăn sư ôh, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆p bre sư jing klo kăn boih.”

English: They said to Him, “Why then did Moses command to give a certificate of divorce, and to put her away?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi jet dơ̆ng: “Lơliơ Môis pơkă khan dah pơm hla bơar trŏ gơh achăng?”

English: He said to them, “Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, permitted you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it was not so.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “'Noh yua kơ yă 'bok iĕm sơ̆ arăng kơ̆l na Môis pơkă khan gơh achăng. Mă tơpă đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei pơkă khan thoi noh ôh.

English: And I say to you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery; and whoever marries her who is divorced commits adultery.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh wă khan kơ iĕm dang ei thoi âu: Bơngai bu achăng lê̆ akăn sư, akăn sư ưh kơ đei pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, na sư iŏk akăn plơ̆ng, bơngai 'noh pơm yoch pơ'brơh kơ akăn sư. Mă-lei dah akăn sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă kơ klo sư hơdrol, 'noh klo sư gơh achăng. Klo sư mă hơdrol achăng lê̆ akăn sư boih, na dah bơngai nai đơ̆ng rŏng iŏk pơm akăn, bơngai noh kư̆m dang pơm yoch mơ̆n, yua kơ klo sư mă hơdrol achăng kư̆ kă ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong achăng.”

English: His disciples said to Him, “If such is the case of the man with his wife, it is better not to marry.”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Bơ̆n băt kơ achăng lê̆ akăn ưh kơ gơh, dah lê̆ kơ iŏk akăn đĕch 'lơ̆ng hloh.”

English: But He said to them, “All cannot accept this saying, but only those to whom it has been given
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu sư: “Đĭ-đăng bơngai ngôi hơdrô̆ kư̆m ưh kơ trŏ ôh. Tơdrong 'noh gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch.

English: For there are eunuchs who were born thus from their mother’s womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men, and there are eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs for the kingdom of heaven’s sake. He who is able to accept it, let him accept it.”
Bahnar: Đei bơngai mơ'nah ưh kơ wă iŏk akăn, yua kơ sư kơđo đơ̆ng klak mĕ sư tơpŭ sơ̆ ưh kơ gơh pơjing kon. Đei bơngai mơ'nah ưh kơ wă iŏk akăn, yua kơ đơ̆ng tơduă kon bơngai pơm kơ sư thoi noh. Đei bơngai mơ'nah ưh kơ wă iŏk akăn, yua kơ sư wă adrin jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei; na bu kĕ adrin tơdrong 'noh, adrin bĕ.”

English: Then little children were brought to Him that He might put His hands on them and pray, but the disciples rebuked them.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei đe anhăk lu hơ'lơ̆p tơ Yêsu wă kơ Sư pel kơ̆l krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh Sư wei-lăng lu hơ'lơ̆p, mă-lei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khă kuă ăn năm tơ Sư.

English: But Jesus said, “Let the little children come to Me, and do not forbid them; for of such is the kingdom of heaven.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Lê̆ lu hơ'lơ̆p năm tơ Inh, 'nĕ pă khă lu sư, yua kơ bơngai bu lui thoi lu hơ'lơ̆p âu lui, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r wei-lăng sư ling-lang.”

English: And He laid His hands on them and departed from there.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu pel kơ̆l krao khan kơ lu bơngai hơ'lơ̆p, klaih kơ noh năm tơ nai.

English: Now behold, one came and said to Him, “Good Teacher, what good thing shall I do that I may have eternal life?”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai năm tơ Yêsu jet thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, inh pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng ayơ wă kơ oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang?”

English: So He said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good but One, that is, God. But if you want to enter into life, keep the commandments.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Yua kơ kiơ ih jet Inh wă kơ băt gah tơdrong 'lơ̆ng? Kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ôh, pôm 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Dah ih wă kơ arih ling-lang, lei ih athei pơm kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.”

English: He said to Him, “Which ones?” Jesus said, “‘You shall not murder,’ ‘You shall not commit adultery,’ ‘You shall not steal,’ ‘You shall not bear false witness,’
Bahnar: Bơngai ei jet: “Tơdrong ayơ?” Yêsu khan: “'Nĕ pơlôch bơngai, 'nĕ pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, 'nĕ chă tơtông mŭk tơmam đe, 'nĕ pơma hơlĕnh

English: ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’”
Bahnar: bơ̆n athei lui yom kơ mĕ 'bă, bơ̆n athei 'mêm kơ bôl buăl thoi bơ̆n 'mêm akâu kơdih.”

English: The young man said to Him, “All these things I have kept from my youth. What do I still lack?”
Bahnar: Na bơngai tơdăm ei khan: “Dôm tơdrong 'noh inh pơm kiơ̆ boih. Hăm đei tơdrong nai dơ̆ng mă inh ưh tam băt?”

English: Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go, sell what you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Dah ih wă kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă lei ih athei tĕch đĭ mŭk tơmam ih chă asong kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin, na kiơ̆ hloi Inh. Thoi noh na ih gô đei mŭk tơmam tơ kơpal plĕnh ti ning-mônh.”

English: But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful, for he had great possessions.
Bahnar: Lăp bơngai tơdăm ei kơtơ̆ng thoi noh sư sơ'ngon dêh yua kơ sư mơdrŏng tơpă. Đơ̆ng noh na sư brŏk hloi.

English: Then Jesus said to His disciples, “Assuredly, I say to you that it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, lu bơngai mơdrŏng wă mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r anat dêh.

English: And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm thoi âu dơ̆ng, aseh lăk-đa mơ̆t bơlôh jrŭm 'bônh 'biơ̆ kơ bơngai mơdrŏng wă mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: When His disciples heard it, they were greatly astonished, saying, “Who then can be saved?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kơtơ̆ng thoi noh lu sư sơleng kơ đon. Na lu sư jet Yêsu khan: “Lei bu gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei lĕ?”

English: But Jesus looked at them and said to them, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
Bahnar: Yêsu lăng lu sư păng khan: “Kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t kơdih tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh, dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ pơklaih yoch sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch sư na sư gơh mơ̆t, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơm tôm tơdrong.”

English: Then Peter answered and said to Him, “See, we have left all and followed You. Therefore what shall we have?”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan kơ Sư: “Lu nhôn âu achăng lê̆ tôm tơdrong yua kơ kiơ̆ Ih, na lu nhôn gô đei kiơ?”

English: So Jesus said to them, “Assuredly I say to you, that in the regeneration, when the Son of Man sits on the throne of His glory, you who have followed Me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, ning-mônh lăp 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh teh 'nao dơ̆ng, Inh Kon Bơngai gô oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao 'lơ̆ng rŏ tơpă, na lu iĕm mơjĭt-'bar 'nu kiơ̆ Inh âu, lu iĕm kư̆m gô oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao mơ̆n, gô sek tơlang mơjĭt-'bar khŭl bơngai Isơrael.

English: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands, for My name’s sake, shall receive a hundredfold, and inherit eternal life.
Bahnar: Na bu achăng hnam sư, 'nhŏng oh sư, mĕ 'bă sư, kon sư, mir 'ba sư, yua kơ jang tơdrong Inh, bơngai noh gô đei tơmam lơ hloh kơ sư đei sơ̆ păng ning-mônh sư gô arih ling-lang hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ layơ tôch.

English: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai pơm tih dang ei, ning-mônh sư gô jing iĕ. Kư̆m lơ bơngai jang tơdrong iĕ dang ei, ning-mônh gô jang tơdrong tih.

English: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.
Bahnar: “Pơtih gia 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n thoi âu: Thoi minh 'nu tơ'ngla mir đơ̆ng pơgê hrôih chă bơngai jang tơ mir hơmu sư.

English: Now when he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.
Bahnar: Sư chă đei boih na sư pơma tơdrong jên kơ lu bơngai wă jang kơ sư, minh năr minh hlak jên so sơ̆. Đơ̆ng noh na lu đe ei năm jang tơ mir hơmu sư.

English: And he went out about the third hour and saw others standing idle in the marketplace
Bahnar: Truh tơsĭn jơ 'bok ei lĕch tơ 'ngoaih, sư 'bôh đe ngôi 'bơ̆t anih đe mơdro, lu sư ngôi đĕch.

English: and said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’ So they went.
Bahnar: Na 'bok tơ'ngla mir hơmu ei khan: ‘Iĕm hăm wă năm jang kơ inh, inh apah trŏ?’

English: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did likewise.
Bahnar: Lu đe ei năm jang hloi. Truh 'năr dơ̆ng, glơh, 'bok ei lĕch lăng anih đe mơdro, 'bôh đe ngôi kiơ̆ ei na sư khan lei-lăi thoi lu bơngai hơdrol hei.

English: And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing idle, and said to them, ‘Why have you been standing here idle all day?’
Bahnar: Truh 'năr pơđăm jơ kơsơ̆, 'bok ei lĕch lăng dơ̆ng tơ anih đe mơdro oei 'bôh bơngai nai ngôi đĕch lei-lăi, na 'bok ei khan kơ lu sư: ‘Lơliơ iĕm ngôi đĕch prăt năr ưh kơ wă jang?’

English: They said to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right you will receive.’
Bahnar: Lu đe ei khan: ‘Yua kơ ưh kơ đei bơngai chă nhôn jang.’ 'Bok ei khan: ‘Lei iĕm năm jang tơ mir inh bĕ.’ Lu đe noh năm jang hloi.

English: “So when evening had come, the owner of the vineyard said to his steward, ‘Call the laborers and give them their wages, beginning with the last to the first.’
Bahnar: “Lăp truh 'năr mơ̆t boih, 'bok tơ'ngla mir ei khan kơ bơngai kai wei-lăng đe jang khan: ‘Krao lu sư bĕ, jah apah jên. Ih apah lu bơngai jang đơ̆ng rŏng hơdrol, lu bơngai jang hơdrol đơ̆ng rŏng.’

English: And when those came who were hired about the eleventh hour, they each received a denarius.
Bahnar: Bơngai kai apah lu bơngai jang đơ̆ng pơđăm jơ, rim 'nu kơ lu sư minh hlak jên.

English: But when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more; and they likewise received each a denarius.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai jang hơdrol ngêh kơ 'bok tơ'ngla mir apah lu sư hloh 'biơ̆, plă kơ hơnơ̆ng lu bơngai 'nao jang mơ̆n.

English: And when they had received it, they complained against the landowner
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư iŏk iăi mơ̆n. Na lu sư pơma kơ 'bok tơ'ngla mir khan

English: saying, ‘These last men have worked only one hour, and you made them equal to us who have borne the burden and the heat of the day.’
Bahnar: ‘Lơliơ ih apah lu đe noh jang đơ̆ng rŏng nhôn mơ'nah lăp minh jơ đĕch mă hơnơ̆ng kơ nhôn jang lap tŏ prăt năr?’

English: But he answered one of them and said, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Did you not agree with me for a denarius?
Bahnar: Na 'bok tơ'ngla mir ei khan kơ minh 'nu lăm lu sư: ‘Ơ ma, inh ưh kơ pơma hơlĕnh kơ ih ôh, inh apah lu iĕm minh hlak jên noh, kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r ba pơma băl pơgê hei. Jên âu ưh kơ đei jên bu ôh jên inh kơdih.

English: Take what is yours and go your way. I wish to give to this last man the same as to you.
Bahnar: Iŏk jên noh brŏk kơ ih bĕ, inh apah lu bơngai jang đơ̆ng rŏng ih dôm ăi kơ ih kư̆m bưh.

English: Is it not lawful for me to do what I wish with my own things? Or is your eye evil because I am good?’
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh inh hơlăng kơ sư đĕch, ih 'nĕ pă 'nhĕng.’ ”

English: So the last will be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few chosen.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong âu Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n: “Mă dôm tơdrong kiơ lu bơngai mă pơm iĕ kơ đe dang ei, ning-mônh sư gô tih; dôm lu bơngai pơm tih kơ đe dang ei ning-mônh sư jing iĕ.”

English: Now Jesus, going up to Jerusalem, took the twelve disciples aside on the road and said to them
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei rok trong năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem na Yêsu krao mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư weh ataih 'biơ̆ kơ trong, na Sư khan

English: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and to the scribes; and they will condemn Him to death
Bahnar: “Iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ, bơ̆n năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Tơ ei kơnh đe wă rôp Inh Kon Bơngai, jao kơ lu 'bok soi tih păng lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê. Lu sư gô sek tơlang tơdrong Inh

English: and deliver Him to the Gentiles to mock and to scourge and to crucify. And the third day He will rise again.”
Bahnar: păng jao Inh kơ lu bơngai dêh đe pơlôch. Lu dêh đe ei gô hiĕk achơ̆ kơ Inh păng teh tach pơjĭ Inh, klaih kơ noh sư pơ̆ng pơlôch hloi tơ 'long pơglang. Mă-lei kơtĕch pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng Inh gô iung arih dơ̆ng.”

English: Then the mother of Zebedee’s sons came to Him with her sons, kneeling down and asking something from Him.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei akăn Sêbêđê năm tơ Yêsu yak hơdai kon sư bre Yakơ hăm Yôhan. Na sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh kơ Yêsu apinh Yêsu tơgŭm sư.

English: And He said to her, “What do you wish?” She said to Him, “Grant that these two sons of mine may sit, one on Your right hand and the other on the left, in Your kingdom.”
Bahnar: Yêsu jet sư: “Ih wă kơ kiơ?” Akăn Sêbêđê khan: “Inh wă kơ Ih ăn kơ 'bar 'nu kon inh âu oei minh 'nu gah 'ma, minh 'nu gah 'ngiĕo, kơplah Ih pơm pơtao nhôn ning-mônh.”

English: But Jesus answered and said, “You do not know what you ask. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?” They said to Him, “We are able.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ bre kon sư: “Lơliơ biĕm ưh kơ pơwao tơdrong biĕm wă noh? Biĕm hăm kĕ iŏk tơdrong anat thoi Inh iŏk?” Bre sư khan: “Nhi kĕ iŏk.”

English: So He said to them, “You will indeed drink My cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with; but to sit on My right hand and on My left is not Mine to give, but it is for those for whom it is prepared by My Father.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Biĕm gô iŏk tơdrong anat thoi Inh, mă-lei tơdrong pơm tih oei gah 'ma gah 'ngiĕo kơ Inh noh, ưh kơ trŏ kơ Inh ăn ôh, tơdrong noh gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bă Inh đĕch băt.”

English: And when the ten heard it, they were greatly displeased with the two brothers.
Bahnar: Na lu mơjĭt 'nu lu bôl sư kơtơ̆ng bre sư pơma thoi noh, na lu sư hil kơ bre noh.

English: But Jesus called them to Himself and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those who are great exercise authority over them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Yêsu krao akŭm pơđĭ lu sư păng khan: “Iĕm băt mơ̆n, lu bơngai ala teh âu mơ'nah pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r, sư chă pơgŏ pơđep lu teh đak sư pơgơ̆r.

English: Yet it shall not be so among you; but whoever desires to become great among you, let him be your servant.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ rok lu 'bok pơgơ̆r noh hŏ. Dah bu lăm lu iĕm 'maih pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu iĕm, bơngai noh athei pơm thoi lĕ đĭch đam iĕm.

English: And whoever desires to be first among you, let him be your slave
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ rok lu 'bok pơgơ̆r noh hŏ. Dah bu lăm lu iĕm 'maih pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu iĕm, bơngai noh athei pơm thoi lĕ đĭch đam iĕm.

English: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi Inh Kon Bơngai mơ̆n, Inh jur tơ ala teh âu ưh kơ sĭ Inh wă chă pơgŏ pơđep đe awih awăn kơ Inh ôh; Inh wă kơ tơ'ngla Inh kơdih awih awăn kơ đe păng Inh wă kơ tơ'ngla Inh kơdih lôch tang huai iŏk lơ bơngai.”

English: Now as they went out of Jericho, a great multitude followed Him.
Bahnar: Lăp lu đe Yêsu lĕch đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrikô đei lơ bơngai kiơ̆ Sư.

English: And behold, two blind men sitting by the road, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out, saying, “Have mercy on us, O Lord, Son of David!”
Bahnar: Tơ anăp lu sư đei 'bar 'nu bơngai măt tol oei ngôi 'bơ̆t cheng trong. Lăp bre sư kơtơ̆ng đe khan Yêsu wă yak trong bre sư, na bre sư krao 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ơ Yêsu, ơ 'Bok Krist Kon Sâu pơtao Đawit, apinh Ih mơnat kơ nhi 'biơ̆ bĕ.”

English: Then the multitude warned them that they should be quiet; but they cried out all the more, saying, “Have mercy on us, O Lord, Son of David!”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpôl ei khă bre sư kuă ăn krao dơ̆ng ră, mă-lei bre sư rai krao 'bơ̆r re: “Ơ 'Bok Krist Kon Sâu pơtao Đawit, apinh Ih mơnat kơ nhi 'biơ̆ bĕ.”

English: So Jesus stood still and called them, and said, “What do you want Me to do for you?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu dơ̆ng jet bre sư: “Biĕm wă kơ kiơ?”

English: They said to Him, “Lord, that our eyes may be opened.”
Bahnar: Bre sư khan: “Ơ 'Bok, nhi wă kơ Ih pơklaih măt nhi gơh 'bôh hơdah.”

English: Now when they drew near Jerusalem, and came to Bethphage, at the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples
Bahnar: Lu đe Yêsu wă jê̆ truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem boih, truh tơ Pơlei Betphagê 'bơ̆t kông Ôliwơ. 'Bơ̆t ei Yêsu wơh 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan

English: saying to them, “Go into the village opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Loose them and bring them to Me.
Bahnar: “Biĕm năm tơ pơlei tơpăt anăp biĕm to. Lăp biĕm truh tơ noh, biĕm 'bôh minh pôm aseh iĕ yŏng đe chô̆ hơdai hăm kon sư, na biĕm yaih dui anhăk kơ Inh tơ âu.

English: And if anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord has need of them,’ and immediately he will send them.”
Bahnar: Dah đe khan: ‘Biĕm iŏk pơm kiơ?’ Biĕm khan kơ sư thoi âu: ‘Kră Yang wă yua 'biơ̆.’ Thoi noh na sư ăn kơ biĕm dui anhăk aseh iĕ noh tơ âu.”

English: All this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying
Bahnar: Tơdrong âu 'blep trŏ thoi minh 'nu 'bok chih khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu

English: “Tell the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, your King is coming to you, Lowly, and sitting on a donkey, A colt, the foal of a donkey.’ ”
Bahnar: “Khan kơ kon pơlei pơla Jêrusalem hŏ: Pơtao iĕm wă mơ̆t tơ pơlei iĕm năr âu. Sư bơngai iơ̆m dim, Sư ưh kơ băt pơang akâu kơdih ôh; Sư hao minh pôm aseh iĕ, Sư oei kơpal kơdŭ aseh iĕ đĕch.”

English: So the disciples went and did as Jesus commanded them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Sư pơkă.

English: They brought the donkey and the colt, laid their clothes on them, and set Him on them.
Bahnar: Bre sư dui anhăk aseh iĕ yŏng hăm kon sư tơ Yêsu. Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư lơ̆k ao lu sư kơdih tơ kơpal kơdŭ aseh iĕ ăn kơ Yêsu hao.

English: And a very great multitude spread their clothes on the road; others cut down branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai lơlap lơlang lơ̆k ao lu sư kơdih kiơ̆ trong wă kơ 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Đei lu mơ'nah koh hơmŭl 'long, proh kơpal trong.

English: Then the multitudes who went before and those who followed cried out, saying: “Hosanna to the Son of David! ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!’ Hosanna in the highest!”
Bahnar: Yêsu hao aseh iĕ yak rok trong ei na lu bơngai tơpôl ei mơ'nah yak hơdrol kơ Sư, mơ'nah đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Sư. Lu sư chhôk na pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Hôsana, bơnê kơ 'Bok Krist Kon Sâu pơtao Đawit. Bơnê kơ Sư truh tơ bơ̆n năr âu yua kơ Kră Yang wơh. Păng bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal plĕnh ti.”

English: And when He had come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, “Who is this?”
Bahnar: Truh Yêsu mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem na đĭ-đăng kon bơngai yơyông yơyang mang, lu sư hli, na jet lu bơngai mă kiơ̆ jơ̆ng Yêsu khan: “Bu noh?”

English: So the multitudes said, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth of Galilee.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpôl kiơ̆ jơ̆ng Yêsu ei khan: “Sư 'noh Yêsu, Sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret, dêh Galilê.”

English: Then Jesus went into the temple of God and drove out all those who bought and sold in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who sold doves.
Bahnar: Yêsu mơ̆t tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, Sư 'bôh đe mơdro lăm hnam noh, na Sư pơpuh tơlĕch lu đe mă mơdro noh, tơlơ̆ tơpơ̆k lu gơ'bang lu đe tơplih băl jên. Lu tang-dŏ lu đe mă tĕch sem kơtơp Sư tơlơ̆ tơpơ̆k đĭ-đăng.

English: And He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of thieves.’ ”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ lu bơngai ei thoi âu: “Đe chih roi nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sư thoi âu: ‘Hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Inh wă lê̆ kơ đe krao khan kơ Inh lăm noh,’ Mă-lei iĕm mơdro lăm noh, pơgŏ athei đe răt kăp jên, iĕm pơm kơ hnam âu thoi lĕ kơ anih hnam đe tơtông klĕ.”

English: Then the blind and the lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đei lu bơngai măt tol, lu bơngai jơ̆ng kue năm tơ Sư, na Sư pơklaih hloi.

English: But when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that He did, and the children crying out in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” they were indignant
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih, lu thây bơtho đe Juđê 'bôh tơdrong mơsêh Sư pơm noh păng kơtơ̆ng lu đe hơ'lơ̆p wang hô pơma ư-ang kơ Sư khan: “Hôsana, bơnê kơ 'Bok Krist Kon Sâu pơtao Đawit.” Lu sư 'bôh thoi noh, lu sư blĕk dêh.

English: and said to Him, “Do You hear what these are saying?” And Jesus said to them, “Yes. Have you never read, ‘Out of the mouth of babes and nursing infants You have perfected praise’?”
Bahnar: Na lu sư năm khan kơ Yêsu: “Ih hăm kơtơ̆ng lu đe hơ'lơ̆p pơma ei?” Yêsu khan: “Kơtơ̆ng. Bĭ iĕm tam mă đŏk lăng ôh hă đe chih roi tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih ăn kơ lu hơ'lơ̆p păng lu bơngai nge băt pơma bơnê ư-ang kơ Ih?”

English: Then He left them and went out of the city to Bethany, and He lodged there.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Sư sơlah đơ̆ng lu đe noh năm tơ Pơlei Bethani 'bĭch tơ ei.

English: Now in the morning, as He returned to the city, He was hungry.
Bahnar: Lăp pơgê dơning Yêsu hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm dơ̆ng tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem na Yêsu pơngot.

English: And seeing a fig tree by the road, He came to it and found nothing on it but leaves, and said to it, “Let no fruit grow on you ever again.” Immediately the fig tree withered away.
Bahnar: Na Sư 'bôh minh tơnơm 'long hơra 'bơ̆t cheng trong. Na Sư thar năm lăng 'long hơra noh ngêh kơ đei plei, plă kơ ưh, 'bôh pôm hla đĕch. Na Yêsu sơkat kơ 'long hơra noh khan: “Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp e 'nĕ pă plei dơ̆ng.” Sĭt tơpă tơnơm 'long hơra noh kro lôch hloi.

English: And when the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, “How did the fig tree wither away so soon?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư 'bôh tơdrong noh mah hlĭch kơ đon păng khan: “Thoi yơ, bơ̆n 'nao 'bôh 'long hơra âu oei arih, mă dang ei khan kro lôch boih?”

English: So Jesus answered and said to them, “Assuredly, I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but also if you say to this mountain, ‘Be removed and be cast into the sea,’ it will be done.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, dah iĕm đei đon lui kơjăp, 'nĕ kơ pơngiĕl, lei ưh kơ sĭ kơ pôm 'long hơra âu đĕch ôh iĕm gơh sơkat. Dah iĕm wă sơkat kơ kông âu gơh mơ̆n. Iĕm khan thoi âu: ‘Weh bĕ e, hiŏng kơtah kơdih tơ đak dơsĭ to.’ Tơdrong iĕm pơma noh gô 'bôh hloi tơpă.

English: And whatever things you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.”
Bahnar: Mă tơdrong kiơ kiơ iĕm krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei, dah iĕm lui kơ Sư gô ăn tơdrong iĕm apinh noh, lei iĕm gô đei tơpă.”

English: Now when He came into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people confronted Him as He was teaching, and said, “By what authority are You doing these things? And who gave You this authority?”
Bahnar: Yêsu năm dơ̆ng tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm wă bơtho đe tơ noh. Kơplah Sư oei bơtho đei lu 'bok soi tih păng lu đe kră sek tơlang năm jet Yêsu thoi âu: “Bu ăn kơ Ih pơpuh đe mơdro đơ̆ng hnam akŭm âu păng chă bơtho đe lăm hnam akŭm âu mơ̆n?”

English: But Jesus answered and said to them, “I also will ask you one thing, which if you tell Me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lei Inh kư̆m wă jet iĕm minh tơdrong mơ̆n. Dah iĕm tơl Inh, lei Inh kư̆m tơl tơwih kơ iĕm băt bu ăn kơ Inh pơpuh đe păng bơtho đe tơ lăm hnam akŭm.

English: The baptism of John—where was it from? From heaven or from men?” And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say to us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
Bahnar: Bĭ tơdrong Yôhan pơm kơ đe 'batem noh sơ̆ đơ̆ng bu ăn, đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei dah đơ̆ng kon bơngai?” Na lu sư pơđâu băl khan: “Bơ̆n wă khan kơ Sư thoi yơ? ‘Dah bơ̆n khan đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei,’ lei Sư khan: ‘Iĕm kuă kơ kiơ lui kơ Yôhan bơtho?’

English: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the multitude, for all count John as a prophet.”
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n khan đơ̆ng kon bơngai, lei hli kơ lu kon pơlei klơ̆m bơ̆n păng tơmo, yua kơ đĭ-đăng jơ̆p-jang kơ lu kon pơlei pơla lu sư khan băt kơ Yôhan bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: So they answered Jesus and said, “We do not know.” And He said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu sư khan: “Nhôn ưh kơ băt ôh.” Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lei Inh kư̆m ưh kơ roi ăn kơ iĕm bu ăn kơ Inh pơpuh đe păng bơtho đe tơ lăm hnam akŭm âu mơ̆n.”

English: “But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first and said, ‘Son, go, work today in my vineyard.’
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu sư: “Minh 'nu bơngai đei 'bar 'nu kon. Sư wơh kon kơdră sư năm jang: ‘Ơ dăm, năr âu e năm jang tơ mir hơmu bơ̆n ho.’

English: He answered and said, ‘I will not,’ but afterward he regretted it and went.
Bahnar: Kon sư khan: ‘Hăt lah, inh ưh kơ wăn.’ Mă-lei pă 'biơ̆ kơ noh kon sư tơchĕng mơnat kơ 'bă sư, na sư năm jang hloi.

English: Then he came to the second and said likewise. And he answered and said, ‘I go, sir,’ but he did not go.
Bahnar: 'Bă sư wơh dơ̆ng kon sư mă 'bar kư̆m thoi sư khan kơ kon kơdră sư hei. Kon sư drơ̆ng: ‘Ŏ, inh năm jang 'bă.’ Mă-lei sư ưh kơ năm jang tơpă ôh, sư hơlĕnh kơ 'bă sư đĕch.

English: Which of the two did the will of his father?” They said to Him, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “Assuredly, I say to you that tax collectors and harlots enter the kingdom of God before you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na iĕm tơchĕng lăng, 'bar 'nu kon noh, kon ayơ chu kơ nơ̆r 'bă sư?” Lu sư khan: “Kon kơdră chu.” Na Yêsu khan: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, lu bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆, lu drŏ-kăn pơm đi, lu sư chu thoi kon kơdră noh boih. Lu sư băt ăn kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r lu sư boih mă-lei gah lu iĕm tam mă chu 'mơ̆i.

English: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him; but tax collectors and harlots believed him; and when you saw it, you did not afterward relent and believe him.
Bahnar: Yôhan, sư bơngai bơtho tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, sư bơtho truh tơ iĕm tơ âu boih wă kơ iĕm pơm đon 'lơ̆ng tơpăt păng 'Bok Kei-Dei ră, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă chu lui kơ nơ̆r sư bơtho. Lu bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ păng lu drŏ-kăn pơm đi wih lui hơdrol kơ iĕm dơ̆ng. Iĕm 'bôh lu sư đĭ lui boih lĕ mă-lei iĕm ưh tam chu tơbral 'mơ̆i.”

English: “Hear another parable: There was a certain landowner who planted a vineyard and set a hedge around it, dug a winepress in it and built a tower. And he leased it to vinedressers and went into a far country.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu sư: “Apinh iĕm mơ̆ng tơdrong pơtih gia âu dơ̆ng: Đei minh 'nu bơngai pơm mir wă pơtăm plei hơmu. Sư war mir tăp dăr boih, lăm mir noh sư pơm minh pôm tơpăl tơmo wă peh plei hơmu chơpĕt iŏk đak sư. Păng sư pơm minh pôm hnam tông wă gak plei hơmu. Sư pơm tôm tơdrong noh boih na sư ăn kơ đe jang mơng, tơ'ngla sư năm oei tơ dêh nai.

English: Now when vintage-time drew near, he sent his servants to the vinedressers, that they might receive its fruit.
Bahnar: Lăp trŏ kơ bơyan plei hơmu đum boih, na sư wơh lu đĭch đam sư năm tơ lu bơngai jang mơng noh wă iŏk plei hơmu mă 'măn kơ tơ'ngla sư.

English: And the vinedressers took his servants, beat one, killed one, and stoned another.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai jang mơng rôp lu đĭch đam sư, mơ'nah sư tôn teh, mơ'nah sư pơlôch, mơ'nah sư klơ̆m păng tơmo.

English: Again he sent other servants, more than the first, and they did likewise to them.
Bahnar: Na 'bok tơ'ngla mir noh wơh dơ̆ng lu đĭch đam sư năm lơ hloh kơ lu bơngai năm hơdrol, lu bơngai jang mơng pơm oei lei-lăi.

English: Then last of all he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
Bahnar: Tơpo hơtuch 'bok tơ'ngla mir wơh kon sư khan: ‘Lu đe noh gô chu yom kơ kon inh thâu.’

English: But when the vinedressers saw the son, they said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him and seize his inheritance.’
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai jang mơng 'bôh kon 'bok tơ'ngla mir truh tơ lu sư, lu sư pơđâu dih băl khan: ‘Bơngai âu boih kon 'bok tơ'ngla mir âu, na dang ei bĕ bơ̆n pơlôch sư na mă mir âu jing mir bơ̆n.’

English: So they took him and cast him out of the vineyard and killed him.
Bahnar: Lu đe noh rôp hloi kon 'bok tơ'ngla mir hiŏng hơtat tơ jih mir pơlôch hloi.

English: “Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those vinedressers?”
Bahnar: “Lu đe noh pơm thoi noh boih na 'bok tơ'ngla mir năm tơ lu bơngai noh, sư gô pơm kiơ kơ lu bơngai noh?”

English: They said to Him, “He will destroy those wicked men miserably, and lease his vineyard to other vinedressers who will render to him the fruits in their seasons.”
Bahnar: Na đe khan: “Sư gô pơlôch đĭ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ noh, na ăn kơ bơngai nai jang dơ̆ng, na lu bơngai jang mơng đơ̆ng rŏng noh gô klah asong sư plei hơmu tơpă.”

English: Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures: ‘The stone which the builders rejected Has become the chief cornerstone. This was the LORD’s doing, And it is marvelous in our eyes’?
Bahnar: Yêsu jet lu sư: “Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei âu iĕm tam mă đŏk lăng tơpă hă? ‘Tơmo lu bơngai man hnam tŭk boih, tơmo noh 'Bok Kei-Dei lăng gĭt tơpă man sư 'bơ̆t mum hnam. Sư pơm thoi noh trŏ tơpă, mă măt bơ̆n lăng kư̆m 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n.’

English: “Therefore I say to you, the kingdom of God will be taken from you and given to a nation bearing the fruits of it.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh gô trŏ kơ lu iĕm na Inh khan kơ iĕm: Iĕm pơm kuă kơ Inh thoi noh, na 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ wă pơm pơtao iĕm ôh. Sư pơm pơtao lu bơngai nai đĕch, lu bơngai nai gô pơm kiơ̆ kơ Sư.

English: And whoever falls on this stone will be broken; but on whomever it falls, it will grind him to powder.”
Bahnar: Tơmo mă iĕm kuă noh, dah bơngai bu huŏng hơtat 'bơ̆t tơmo noh, bơngai noh gô tơgơ̆ jơ̆ng ti sư păng pơchah kơ̆l sư. Dah tơmo noh huŏng 'bơm bơngai bu, akâu bơngai noh gô pơchah hĕch hoch thoi 'mui teh.”

English: Now when the chief priests and Pharisees heard His parables, they perceived that He was speaking of them.
Bahnar: Lu đe Pharisi păng 'bok soi tih kơtơ̆ng dôm tơdrong Yêsu pơma pơjuang noh hei, lu sư băt kơ tơdrong noh trŏ kơ lu sư tơpă, na lu sư wă rôp hloi Yêsu kơplah noh ră, mă-lei lu sư hli kơ lu kon pơlei pơla 'bơ̆t ei, yua kơ lu kon pơlei pơla băt kơ Yêsu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: And Jesus answered and spoke to them again by parables and said
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ lu sư dơ̆ng

English: “The kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who arranged a marriage for his son
Bahnar: “'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r kon bơngai thoi âu: Minh 'nu 'bok pơtao hơmet tơmam sa pơkong kơ kon sư iŏk akăn.

English: and sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the wedding; and they were not willing to come.
Bahnar: Na sư wơh lu bơngai jang kơ sư năm krao lu bơngai mă sư wơ̆n năm sŏng sa tơ hnam sư, mă-lei lu bơngai mă sư wơ̆n noh ưh kơ wă năm sŏng sa.

English: Again, he sent out other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who are invited, “See, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and fatted cattle are killed, and all things are ready. Come to the wedding.” ’
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao wơh dơ̆ng lu bơngai jang kơ sư nai năm krao păng khan kơ lu bơngai mă sư wơ̆n ei thoi âu: ‘Inh hơmet tơmam sa đang boih, dang ei oei chang gô iĕm; inh đei 'buh sa rơmo bek na dôm tơmam wă sŏng sa hơmet đang boih, apinh iĕm năm sŏng sa bĕ.’

English: But they made light of it and went their ways, one to his own farm, another to his business.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai mă sư wơ̆n ei oei ưh kơ chu kơ năm sŏng sa 'mơ̆i, lu sư khan ưh kơ kăl. Lu sư kơtơ̆ng boih bơngai jang kơ 'bok pơtao năm krao lu sư, mă-lei lu sư mơ'nah năm jang tơ mir, mơ'nah hăt kơ năm mơdro sa.

English: And the rest seized his servants, treated them spitefully, and killed them.
Bahnar: Lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng rôp lu bơngai jang kơ 'bok pơtao năm krao lu sư ei, blei hiap păng pơlôch hloi.

English: But when the king heard about it, he was furious. And he sent out his armies, destroyed those murderers, and burned up their city.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'bok pơtao ơh tơpă, sư wơh lu linh sư năm pơlôch đĭ-đăng lu bơngai mă pơlôch lu bơngai jang kơ sư ei păng soh rông chhông hnam kon pơlei pơla lu sư.

English: Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.
Bahnar: “'Blă kơ noh 'bok pơtao khan dơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai jang kơ sư: ‘Dôm tơmam sa inh hơmet keh tôm ră boih, mă-lei lu bơngai mă inh wơ̆n pơm ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng. Lê̆, ưh kơ trŏ kơ lu sư sŏng sa hơdai păng bơ̆n dơ̆ng.

English: Therefore go into the highways, and as many as you find, invite to the wedding.’
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na dang ei iĕm năm răp rim trong bĕ, kư̆ kơ 'bôh bơngai, krao sư sŏng sa tơ âu.’

English: So those servants went out into the highways and gathered together all whom they found, both bad and good. And the wedding hall was filled with guests.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai jang kơ sư năm răp jơ̆p-jang rim kơ trong. Lu sư 'bôh mă bơngai 'lơ̆ng, mă bơngai kơnê̆, kư̆ kơ krao anhăk tơ̆p anih hrăt-hrot 'bĕnh kơ bơngai.

English: “But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw a man there who did not have on a wedding garment.
Bahnar: “'Bok pơtao mơ̆t chă lăng lu bơngai sŏng sa, sư 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai ưh kơ hrŭk tơplih hơbĕn ao 'nao.

English: So he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you come in here without a wedding garment?’ And he was speechless.
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao khan kơ bơngai ei: ‘Ơ ma, lơliơ ih mơ̆t tơ lăm anih âu mă ưh kơ hrŭk tơplih hơbĕn ao tơdrong juăt pơkong?’ Mă-lei bơngai ei ưh kơ pơ̆n drơ̆ng sư thoi yơ.

English: Then the king said to the servants, ‘Bind him hand and foot, take him away, and cast him into outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
Bahnar: Na 'bok pơtao athei lu bơngai jang kơ sư chô̆ jơ̆ng ti bơngai noh tơlơ̆ tŭk tơ anih măng mu lê̆ sư nhơ̆m hmoi tơkăp sơnĕnh tơ noh.”

English: “For many are called, but few are chosen.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Tơdrong 'noh pơtih gia kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei krao lơ bơngai lui kơ Sư mă-lei Sư rơih iŏk lăp tŏ sĕt đĕch.”

English: Then the Pharisees went and plotted how they might entangle Him in His talk.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma tơdrong 'noh hei đang boih, na lu bơngai Pharisi pơđâu băl, lu sư wă jet pơlong Yêsu pơma hăm trŏ kơ tơdrong juăt dah ưh. Dah ưh kơ trŏ, lu sư wă kêng.

English: And they sent to Him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that You are true, and teach the way of God in truth; nor do You care about anyone, for You do not regard the person of men.
Bahnar: Lu sư wơh buăl lu sư năm hơdai khŭl pơtao Hêrôt năm jet Yêsu thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, nhôn băt kơ Ih bơngai tơpăt, Ih ưh kơ hli kơ bu ôh. Ih lăng lu bơngai pơm tih, lu bơngai iĕ lei-lăi ngăl păng bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt ling-lang.

English: Tell us, therefore, what do You think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”
Bahnar: Na nhôn wă jet Ih, Ih tơchĕng thoi yơ kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơngai Juđê bơ̆n? Bơ̆n hăm gơh ăn jên thuê̆ kơ Sêsar pơtao đe Rôm mă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n dah ưh?”

English: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said, “Why do you test Me, you hypocrites?
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu đe âu wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Sư, na Sư khan thoi âu: “Ơ lu bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh, yua kơ kiơ iĕm wă jet pơlong Inh?

English: Show Me the tax money.” So they brought Him a denarius.
Bahnar: Iĕm ăn Inh lăng jên iĕm wă ăn thuê̆ noh.” Lu sư ăn kơ Yêsu lăng minh hlak jên, na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư

English: And He said to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?”
Bahnar: “Rup bu âu? Anăn bu âu?”

English: They said to Him, “Caesar’s.” And He said to them, “Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “'Noh rup Sêsar păng anăn Sêsar mơ̆n.” Thoi noh na Yêsu khan: “Jên âu rup Sêsar tơpă na bơ̆n athei thuê̆ kơ sư yua kơ sư pơgơ̆r. Tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n athei pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ Sư tơgŭm ăn kơ bơ̆n.”

English: When they had heard these words, they marveled, and left Him and went their way.
Bahnar: Lu sư mơ̆ng Yêsu tơl trŏ tơpă, na lu sư achăng lê̆ Yêsu 'bơ̆t noh yak năm tơ nai.

English: The same day the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him and asked Him
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê mơ'nah lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ tơdrong Sađusê. Lu sư khan kon bơngai lôch ưh kơ iung arih dơ̆ng ôh. Lăm năr noh mơ̆n lu sư năm pơjah pơjăng păng Yêsu na lu sư jet Yêsu thoi âu

English: saying: “Teacher, Moses said that if a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.
Bahnar: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, tơdrong juăt Môis chih ată kơ bơ̆n sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Dah 'nhŏng bu lôch, mi sư adro ưh kơ đei kon, oh sư noh athei iŏk mi sư pơm akăn na pơjing kon kơ 'nhŏng sư.’

English: Now there were with us seven brothers. The first died after he had married, and having no offspring, left his wife to his brother.
Bahnar: Đei bôl nhôn tơ âu đei minh pôm hnam dơnŏ tơpơh 'nu 'nhŏng oh. 'Nhŏng kơdră sư iŏk akăn. Lăp 'nhŏng lu sư lôch ưh tam mă đei kon, na oh sư mă 'bar iŏk mi sư pơm akăn dơ̆ng.

English: Likewise the second also, and the third, even to the seventh.
Bahnar: Oh sư mă 'bar lôch kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơjing kon. Oh sư mă pêng iŏk mi sư pơm akăn dơ̆ng, mă-lei ưh kơ đei kon kư̆m lôch. Tơpơh 'nu 'nhŏng oh sư noh kư̆m iŏk minh 'nu akăn na lôch ngăl kư̆m ưh kơ đei kon ngăl mơ̆n.

English: Last of all the woman died also.
Bahnar: Tơpo hơtuch akăn lu sư noh kư̆m lôch kiơ̆ lu sư mơ̆n.

English: Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had her.”
Bahnar: Na Ih khan kon bơngai gô iung arih, na mưh lu sư iung arih đơ̆ng lôch ning-mônh, akăn lu sư noh jing akăn bu kơ lu sư mă tơpă, yua kơ tơpơh 'nu drŏ-nglo iŏk minh 'nu drŏ-kăn?”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “You are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong noh yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ pơwao sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei, na iĕm ưh kơ băt Sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong.

English: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels of God in heaven.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, đe ưh pă đei tơiŏk băl klo kăn dơ̆ng ôh, lu sư thoi lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng tơ plĕnh ti.

English: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God, saying
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma kơ iĕm gah tơdrong kon bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, iĕm kư̆m đŏk lăng boih mă liơ iĕm ưh kơ hlôh?

English: ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”
Bahnar: Sư khan thoi âu: ‘Inh boih Kră Yang wei-lăng Abraham, Kră Yang wei-lăng Isăk, Kră Yang wei-lăng Jakôp.’ ” Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Lu bơngai âu lôch đĭ boih kơplah noh sơ̆, mă-lei lu sư gô iung arih tôm kơ lu sư yua kơ Kră Yang wei-lăng gah tơdrong arih, ưh kơ sĭ Sư wei-lăng gah tơdrong lôch ôh.”

English: And when the multitudes heard this, they were astonished at His teaching.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng Yêsu bơtho thoi noh, na lu sư băt kơ Yêsu bơtho hơgei tơpă.

English: But when the Pharisees heard that He had silenced the Sadducees, they gathered together.
Bahnar: Khŭl Pharisi băt kơ jei Yêsu boih gah tơdrong pơjah hăm khŭl Sađusê. Na khŭl Pharisi akŭm băl.

English: Then one of them, a lawyer, asked Him a question, testing Him, and saying
Bahnar: Na đei minh 'nu bơngai khŭl Pharisi, sư pơm thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê, sư năm jet pơlong lăng Yêsu thoi âu

English: “Teacher, which is the great commandment in the law?”
Bahnar: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, dôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, tơdrong juăt ayơ kăl hloh?”

English: Jesus said to him, “‘You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư thoi âu: “ ‘Bơ̆n athei 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang bơ̆n hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak bơ̆n păng đĭ dôm tơdrong đon bơ̆n tơchĕng.’

English: This is the first and great commandment.
Bahnar: 'Noh tơdrong juăt mă mônh kăl hloh kơ dôm tơdrong juăt nai.

English: And the second is like it: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’
Bahnar: Tơdrong juăt mă 'bar dơ̆ng kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n: ‘Bơ̆n athei 'mêm kơ bôl buăl thoi bơ̆n 'mêm akâu kơdih.’

English: On these two commandments hang all the Law and the Prophets.”
Bahnar: Bu pơm kiơ̆ 'bar tơdrong juăt âu tơpă, bơngai 'noh sư huay kơ hŭt lê̆ dôm tơdrong juăt Môis păng dôm tơdrong lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei chih sơ̆.”

English: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them
Bahnar: Kơplah khŭl Pharisi oei akŭm băl tơ ei, na Yêsu jet lu sư thoi âu

English: saying, “What do you think about the Christ? Whose Son is He?” They said to Him, “The Son of David.”
Bahnar: “'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh pơm Pơtao, Sư bơngai thoi yơ? Sư kon sâu bu?” Lu sư khan: “Sư kon sâu pơtao Đawit.”

English: He said to them, “How then does David in the Spirit call Him ‘Lord,’ saying
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu sư: “Trŏ mơ̆n mă-lei liơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng athei Đawit krao kơ 'Bok Krist Yŏng Kơdră sư na Đawit khan sơ̆ thoi âu

English: ‘The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand, Till I make Your enemies Your footstool” ’?
Bahnar: ‘Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Yŏng Kơdră inh thoi âu: Ih kư̆ kơ oei gah 'ma kơ Inh pơgơ̆r tơ̆p Inh blah rôp lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ Ih thuơ tơ kơnơl jơ̆ng Ih.’

English: If David then calls Him ‘Lord,’ how is He his Son?”
Bahnar: Đawit krao kơ 'Bok Krist Yŏng Kơdră sư, na lơliơ dang ei iĕm khan 'Bok Krist kon sâu Đawit đĕch?”

English: And no one was able to answer Him a word, nor from that day on did anyone dare question Him anymore.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan thoi noh ưh kơ đei bu gơh tơl Sư păng đơ̆ng năr noh ưh kơ đei bu pơ̆n jet Sư dơ̆ng.

English: Then Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to His disciples
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Yêsu pơma kơ lu bơngai tơpôl păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư thoi âu

English: saying: “The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.
Bahnar: “Lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu khŭl Pharisi lu sư bơtho bơ̆n tơdrong juăt Môis pơkă.

English: Therefore whatever they tell you to observe, that observe and do, but do not do according to their works; for they say, and do not do.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei pơm kiơ̆ thoi sư bơtho păng rok dôm tơdrong sư pơkă. Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong arih lu sư. Tơdrong lu sư bơtho 'lơ̆ng ră, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng noh ôh.

English: For they bind heavy burdens, hard to bear, and lay them on men’s shoulders; but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơkă kơ iĕm lơ tơdrong juăt kiơ̆ kơ lu sư tơchĕng kơdih, kư̆m dang lĕ lu sư tơpŭ kơ iĕm tơmam trăp hloh kơ ai tơ̆p pă kĕ gơrŭn, dah wă kiơ̆ pơđĭ tơdrong juăt noh, iĕm ưh kơ kĕ ôh păng lu sư ưh kơ tơgŭm iĕm hơya tŏ sĕt.

English: But all their works they do to be seen by men. They make their phylacteries broad and enlarge the borders of their garments.
Bahnar: “Dôm tơdrong sư pơm, sư wă kơ đe 'bôh na ư-ang kơ sư, khan sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng. Kơdŭng lu sư tah hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei mă lu sư chô̆ 'băk tơ ako dah chô̆ bĕng tơ kơkŏng, kơdŭng noh lu sư pơm mă tih wă kơ đe 'bôh nhên; ao lu sư sĭt mă tai wă kơ đe 'bôh na ư-ang kơ lu sư.

English: They love the best places at feasts, the best seats in the synagogues
Bahnar: Kơplah akŭm lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei păng lăm năr et sa tih, lu sư wă oei tang-dŏ 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ đe.

English: greetings in the marketplaces, and to be called by men, ‘Rabbi, Rabbi.’
Bahnar: Lu sư wă kơ đe kơkuh kơ sư tơ anih đe akŭm tơpôl păng wă kơ đe krao lu sư 'bok thây.

English: But you, do not be called ‘Rabbi’; for One is your Teacher, the Christ, and you are all brethren.
Bahnar: “Gah lu iĕm, iĕm 'nĕ ăn đe krao lu iĕm 'bok thây hŏ, yua kơ iĕm đei minh 'nu 'Bok Thây boih, đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm jing 'nhŏng oh ngăl đĕch.

English: Do not call anyone on earth your father; for One is your Father, He who is in heaven.
Bahnar: Păng iĕm 'nĕ krao lu bơngai ala teh âu 'bă, yua kơ iĕm đei minh 'nu 'Bă tơ plĕnh ti boih.

English: And do not be called teachers; for One is your Teacher, the Christ.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ chă athei đe krao kơ iĕm yŏng, yua kơ iĕm đei minh 'nu Krist boih Yŏng iĕm.

English: But he who is greatest among you shall be your servant.
Bahnar: Lăm lu iĕm bu wă pơm tih, bơngai noh athei pơm thoi lĕ đĭch đam iĕm.

English: And whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơma pơang akâu sư wă kơ đe pôk sư pơm tih, bơngai noh ning-mônh sư gô mơlâu hloh kơ đe. Bơngai bu ưh kơ hơnhŏ chă pơang akâu sư kơ đe, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat, ăn kơ sư pơm tih.

English: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you shut up the kingdom of heaven against men; for you neither go in yourselves, nor do you allow those who are entering to go in.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu thây bơtho đe Juđê păng bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh, yua kơ iĕm bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh. Iĕm pơgăn đe kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r, tơ'ngla iĕm kơdih kuă kơ kiơ̆, mưh đe wă kiơ̆ na iĕm nŏng kơ pơgăn đe.

English: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. Therefore you will receive greater condemnation.
Bahnar: Ơ lu thây bơtho đe Juđê păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh yua kơ iĕm bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh. Iĕm chă pơgŏ iŏk tơmam lu drŏ-kăn adro păng pơm pơrŏ akâu krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đunh wă kơ đe jô̆ iĕm khan bơngai 'lơ̆ng. Iĕm pơm thoi noh, ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei phak iĕm hloh kơ lu bơngai nai.

English: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel land and sea to win one proselyte, and when he is won, you make him twice as much a son of hell as yourselves.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu thây bơtho đe Juđê păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh, yua kơ iĕm bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh. Iĕm kư̆ kơ năm bơtho jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak, tơ minh 'nu bơngai kư̆m năm bơtho, mă tơdrong bơtho, iĕm ưh kơ bơtho sư pơm 'lơ̆ng ôh, rai pơm kơnê̆ hloh kơ iĕm dơ̆ng.

English: “Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obliged to perform it.’
Bahnar: “Ơ lu iĕm, khan bơngai 'bôh hơdah wă tơ'bôh kơ đe trong, mă-lei iĕm dang bơngai măt tol. Ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh, yua kơ iĕm khan dah bu wă mơng tơmam kiơ kiơ wă kơ băt sư gô 'mong, athei bơngai noh tơhlâu hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Mă-lei dah sư pơm thoi noh tơpă, iĕm khan tŭk tơdrong 'mong dơ̆ng kư̆m bưh. Dah sư tơhlâu maih hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei noh iĕm khan trŏ kơ 'mong.

English: Fools and blind! For which is greater, the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai kơhlôh, thoi bơngai măt tol, lơliơ iĕm tơchĕng thoi noh? Hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei kăl hloh kơ maih. Maih yua kơ đe man tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch na lăng nhen kăl.

English: And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it, he is obliged to perform it.’
Bahnar: Păng iĕm khan dah bu wă mơng tơmam kiơ kiơ wă kơ băt sư gô 'mong tơpă, iĕm athei bơngai noh tơhlâu chơnang 'măn tơmam soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Mă-lei dah bơngai noh sư pơm thoi noh tơpă, iĕm khan bơngai noh tŭk tơdrong 'mong dơ̆ng kư̆m bưh. Dah sư tơhlâu tơmam soi 'măn kơpal chơnang soi noh iĕm khan trŏ kơ 'mong.

English: Fools and blind! For which is greater, the gift or the altar that sanctifies the gift?
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai dang kơ măt tol, iĕm hăm băt chơnang 'măn tơmam soi kăl hloh kơ tơmam soi? Tơmam soi yua kơ 'măn kơpal chơnang soi noh đĕch na lăng thoi lĕ kăl.

English: Therefore he who swears by the altar, swears by it and by all things on it.
Bahnar: “Yua kơ thoi noh na dah bu wă 'mong kơ đe tơmam tơpă na sư tơhlâu chơnang 'măn tơmam soi, dang sư tơhlâu đĭ-đăng chơnang soi păng tơmam soi noh mơ̆n.

English: He who swears by the temple, swears by it and by Him who dwells in it.
Bahnar: Na bơngai wă 'mong kơ đe tơmam, sư tơhlâu hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, noh kư̆m dang sư tơhlâu 'Bok Kei-Dei oei lăm hnam noh mơ̆n.

English: And he who swears by heaven, swears by the throne of God and by Him who sits on it.
Bahnar: Bơngai wă 'mong kơ đe tơmam, dah sư tơhlâu plĕnh, noh kư̆m dang tơhlâu anih 'Bok Kei-Dei, kư̆m dang tơhlâu akâu 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have neglected the weightier matters of the law: justice and mercy and faith. These you ought to have done, without leaving the others undone.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu thây bơtho đe Juđê păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh, yua kơ iĕm bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh. Iĕm pơm hăt hot tĕch lu tơmam hơi thoi lĕ kơ hla lŭng-hŭng, hla gơsơ̆m, hla ĕch, hla hla-kat, iŏk jên noh pơm pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei minh lăm mơjĭt. Mă-lei dôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei mă kăl hloh thoi lĕ kơ pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ đe, athei 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl, tơdrong lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, dôm tơdrong noh iĕm pơhơi ưh kơ wă pơm. Mă tơdrong iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam hơi noh kư̆m trŏ mơ̆n, mă-lei ưh kơ dang bơ̆n kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt noh hei.

English: Blind guides, who strain out a gnat and swallow a camel!
Bahnar: Iĕm khan bơngai tơ'bôh kơ đe trong, mă-lei dang bơngai măt tol. Tơdrong kăl iĕm pơhơi, tơdrong hơi iĕm hăt hot. 'Noh dang iĕm chơkơih tŭk 'bruih iĕ lăm kơchŏk đak, mă tŏ aseh iĕm ưh kơ 'bôh, nhă luăn jrok hloi.

English: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you cleanse the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of extortion and self-indulgence.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu thây bơtho đe Juđê păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh, yua kơ iĕm bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh. Iĕm hăt hot kơ ôp pơnhan hăm kơchŏk hơdrol kơ sŏng sa, khan trŏ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei tơmam sa iĕm lăm pơnhan hăm kơchŏk đak iĕm noh iĕm tơgar iŏk đơ̆ng đe.

English: Blind Pharisee, first cleanse the inside of the cup and dish, that the outside of them may be clean also.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Pharisi, dang kơ măt tol, iĕm 'nĕ pă tơgar iŏk dôm tơmam sa đe 'mơ̆i, na 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bôh tơdrong iĕm ôp bơ̆n pơnhan bơ̆n kơchŏk noh 'lơ̆ng.

English: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs which indeed appear beautiful outwardly, but inside are full of dead men’s bones and all uncleanness.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu thây bơtho đe Juđê păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh, yua kơ iĕm bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh. Lăng akâu iĕm rŏ thoi bơsat đe 'nao pơm, mă-lei lăm to đei atâu ôm.

English: Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
Bahnar: Đe lăng akâu akar iĕm gah 'ngoaih kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, rŏ kơ bơngai pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ đe, mă-lei lăm to iĕm ling-lang kơ hơlĕnh păng pơm kơnê̆ kơ đe.

English: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you build the tombs of the prophets and adorn the monuments of the righteous
Bahnar: “Ơ lu thây bơtho đe Juđê păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong Pharisi, ning-mônh iĕm pơmat-tat dêh, yua kơ iĕm bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh. Iĕm pơm chă pơrŏ hơmet ming lu bơsat bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei păng bơsat lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, wă kơ 'lơ̆ng rŏ.

English: and say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.’
Bahnar: Na iĕm khan: ‘Dah bơ̆n arih hơdai lu yă 'bok bơ̆n sơ̆, bơ̆n ưh kơ pơlôch lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi lu sư sơ̆ ôh.’

English: “Therefore you are witnesses against yourselves that you are sons of those who murdered the prophets.
Bahnar: Iĕm krao lu sư yă 'bok noh trŏ tơpă yua kơ iĕm oei wă pơm thoi lu sư.

English: Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers’ guilt.
Bahnar: Iĕm wă pơm thoi lu sư noh pơm bĕ.

English: Serpents, brood of vipers! How can you escape the condemnation of hell?
Bahnar: Iĕm pơm thoi lĕ kơ klăn tih 'bih tur makkang, ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei phak iĕm lăm dơnâu ŭnh tơpă.

English: Therefore, indeed, I send you prophets, wise men, and scribes: some of them you will kill and crucify, and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues and persecute from city to city
Bahnar: Inh gô wơh lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu bơngai hơgei, lu bơngai pơm 'bok bơtho năm bơtho iĕm, na 'blep kơ lu iĕm rôp pơlôch, mơ'nah iĕm pơ̆ng tơ 'long pơglang, mơ'nah iĕm teh tach lu sư păng sơnguĕt lăm hnam akŭm iĕm. Păng iĕm kư̆m pơpuh lu sư jăk đơ̆ng pơlei âu pơlei to.

English: that on you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah, son of Berechiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng lôch yua kơ lu bơngai thoi iĕm âu lơ boih tơpă, đơ̆ng Kain pơlôch Abel blŭng-a sơ̆ truh tơ iĕm pơlôch Sachari kon 'bok Barachi tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, all these things will come upon this generation.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, yua kơ dôm lu bơngai mă yă 'bok iĕm pơlôch noh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m wă phak iĕm hơgop hăm lu sư mơ̆n.

English: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the one who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing!
Bahnar: “Ơ lu bơngai Pơlei Jêrusalem, iĕm pơlôch kơ kiơ lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh pơtruh nơ̆r Sư kơ iĕm, iĕm iŏk tơmo klơ̆m pơlôch lu sư? Inh lung iĕm năm akŭm tơ Inh lơ wơ̆t boih ră, dang iĕr krao kon sư wă krôp ră, mă-lei iĕm kuă kơ năm.

English: See! Your house is left to you desolate
Bahnar: Na dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei wă achăng tŭk pơlei iĕm boih.

English: for I say to you, you shall see Me no more till you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!’ ”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, iĕm pă 'bôh muh măt Inh boih tơ̆p truh năr Inh jur dơ̆ng ning-mônh na iĕm khan: ‘Ư-ang kơ Yêsu đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh jur tơ bơ̆n dơ̆ng.’ ”

English: Then Jesus went out and departed from the temple, and His disciples came up to show Him the buildings of the temple.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu lĕch đơ̆ng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm wă năm tơ nai, na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tơ'bôh kơ Sư tơdrong hnam akŭm tơm noh 'lơ̆ng rŏ.

English: And Jesus said to them, “Do you not see all these things? Assuredly, I say to you, not one stone shall be left here upon another, that shall not be thrown down.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm 'bôh boih hnam akŭm âu 'lơ̆ng rŏ, Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, ning-mônh hnam âu gô pơchah reng 'beng ưh pă đei tơmo ayơ tơklep băl dơ̆ng. Đe gô teh pơchah đĭ.”

English: Now as He sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things be? And what will be the sign of Your coming, and of the end of the age?”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Yêsu năm ngôi tơ kông Ôliwơ, na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư jet Sư kơdrô̆ khan: “Apinh Ih roi kơ nhôn layơ đe wă pơrăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei to păng đei tơdra liơ wă kơ nhôn kơnăl kơ Ih wă jur tơ teh âu păng kơnăl kơ năr tôch wă truh.”

English: And Jesus answered and said to them: “Take heed that no one deceives you.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm athei kơchăng kơdih hli kơ đe wă pơhlŭ pơlung iĕm kiơ̆ sư.

English: For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will deceive many.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh gô đei lơ bơngai truh na lu sư anăn măt Inh khan sư kơdih 'Bok Krist. Đei lơ bơngai lui kơ sư pơhlŭ.

English: And you will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not troubled; for all these things must come to pass, but the end is not yet.
Bahnar: Păng iĕm kơtơ̆ng đe tơblah mă jê̆ mă ataih, iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli hŏ. Tơdrong noh ưh kơ jor ôh, gô đei 'mơ̆i, mă-lei năr tôch ưh tam mă truh ôh kơplah noh.

English: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be famines, pestilences, and earthquakes in various places.
Bahnar: Đei dêh âu iung blah dêh to, dêh to iung blah dêh nai. Đei teh adrŏ păng tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt lơ tơring âu tơring to.

English: All these are the beginning of sorrows.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kơplah noh tơdrong gleh truh 'nao wă pơtơm đĕch.

English: “Then they will deliver you up to tribulation and kill you, and you will be hated by all nations for My name’s sake.
Bahnar: “Kơplah noh kơnh đe gô rôp iĕm jao kơ đe tôn teh păng pơlôch iĕm. Đĭ-đăng bơngai areh arĕnh kơ iĕm yua kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh.

English: And then many will be offended, will betray one another, and will hate one another.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh mơ̆n đei lơ lu bơngai lui achăng lê̆ Inh, lu sư hil areh kơ lu bôl mă oei lui kơ Inh, lu sư rôp lu bôl mă oei lui kơ Inh noh, ăn kơ lu bôl sư mă ưh kơ lui tah tơ lăm hnam phak.

English: Then many false prophets will rise up and deceive many.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai wă pơhlŭ iĕm, khan sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, đei lơ bơngai lui kơ sư pơhlŭ.

English: And because lawlessness will abound, the love of many will grow cold.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh kon bơngai rai đunh rai kơnê̆ dêh. Lu sư chă pơtuah lu bơngai lui, na lu bơngai lui rai pă gan 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm bôl buăl boih.

English: But he who endures to the end shall be saved.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah bu adrin lui kơ Inh truh năr tôch, bơngai 'noh gô klaih.

English: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in all the world as a witness to all the nations, and then the end will come.
Bahnar: Gô lu bơngai lui kơ Inh bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak 'mơ̆i na truh năr tôch.

English: “Therefore when you see the ‘abomination of desolation,’ spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place” (whoever reads, let him understand)
Bahnar: “Ning-mônh iĕm gô 'bôh lu bơngai kơnê̆ wă pơrăm kon bơngai gô truh, lu sư oei tơ anih đe kơ̆m kơ oei. Đaniel bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ sư kư̆m roi tơdrong noh mơ̆n. Na bu đŏk lăng hla bơar âu đon sư athei pơwao kơdih.

English: “then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm bơngai mă oei tơ dêh Juđê 'bôh lu bơngai kơnê̆ wă chă pơlôch pơrăm đe truh, iĕm athei jăk tơ kông ataih đơ̆ng lu sư hloi.

English: Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take anything out of his house.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ngôi tơ 'ngoaih hnam 'nĕ pă mơ̆t iŏk tơmam sư tơ lăm hnam dơ̆ng.

English: And let him who is in the field not go back to get his clothes.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu oei jang tơ mir, 'nĕ pă brŏk iŏk ao tơnŏ sư tơ hnam.

English: But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babies in those days!
Bahnar: Kơplah ei kơnh lu bơngai drŏ-kăn akâu kơhioh păng lu bơngai drŏ-kăn tơmŏm kon lu sư pơmat-tat dêh.

English: And pray that your flight may not be in winter or on the Sabbath.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm athei krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei 'nĕ ăn tơdrong noh truh kơplah bơyan 'mi hngach păng kơplah năr pơdơh Sa'bat

English: For then there will be great tribulation, such as has not been since the beginning of the world until this time, no, nor ever shall be.
Bahnar: yua kơ năr noh kơnh đei tơdrong anat anot tih hloh kơ đơ̆ng năr 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei. Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh kư̆m huay kơ mah dang noh mơ̆n.

English: And unless those days were shortened, no flesh would be saved; but for the elect’s sake those days will be shortened.
Bahnar: Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ achơ̆t lê̆ tơdrong tơblah tih noh, ưh kơ đei bu arih ôh. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei achơ̆t lê̆, yua kơ Sư mơnat kơ lu bơngai mă Sư rơih boih.

English: “Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘There!’ do not believe it.
Bahnar: “Năr noh dah đe khan kơ iĕm 'Bok Krist tơ âu boih, 'Bok Krist tơ to boih, iĕm 'nĕ kơ lui hŏ

English: For false christs and false prophets will rise and show great signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
Bahnar: yua kơ năr noh kơnh đei lơ bơngai pơm Krist, đei lơ bơngai khan sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư kư̆m gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh wă kơ lu bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih boih lui kơ lu sư pơhlŭ.

English: See, I have told you beforehand.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei kơchăng kơdih, yua kơ Inh roi kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong hơdrol boih.

English: “Therefore if they say to you, ‘Look, He is in the desert!’ do not go out; or ‘Look, He is in the inner rooms!’ do not believe it.
Bahnar: Dah đe khan kơ iĕm 'Bok Krist jur boih sư oei tơ bri, iĕm 'nĕ kơ năm chă hŏ; păng dah đe khan 'Bok Krist jur boih sư oei ôn akâu sư tơ hnam đe iĕm 'nĕ kơ lui.

English: For as the lightning comes from the east and flashes to the west, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be.
Bahnar: Năr ei kơnh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô 'bôh Inh Kon Bơngai jur thoi kơmlat, chêr 'blêt 'bôh jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak mă đơ̆ng hơlĕch truh tơ bơmơ̆t.

English: For wherever the carcass is, there the eagles will be gathered together.
Bahnar: “Bơngai lôch tơ yơ, pă jor grơ̆ gô jur sa tơ ei.

English: “Immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
Bahnar: “Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơdrong anat noh boih măt 'năr gô măng mu, măt khei ưh kơ hơdah, sơnglŏng gô huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh.

English: Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai ala teh âu nhơ̆m hmoi yua kơ lu sư 'bôh Inh Kon Bơngai 'lơ̆ng rŏ mơsêh mơyang tih-tin jur hăm hơmơ̆l.

English: And He will send His angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they will gather together His elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.
Bahnar: Lu linh jang hlôm pơre keng, Inh wơh lu sư jur năm jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak wă krao anhăk đĭ-đăng lu khŭl bơngai mă Inh rơih iŏk đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch truh gah bơmơ̆t, đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m truh gah gơal akŭm đĭ tơ Inh.

English: “Now learn this parable from the fig tree: When its branch has already become tender and puts forth leaves, you know that summer is near.
Bahnar: “Na dang ei iĕm mơ̆ng pơtih gia kơ 'long hơra. Lăp iĕm 'bôh dơng sư hơđoh chăt hla, noh iĕm băt kơ wă jê̆ bơyan 'mi boih.

English: So you also, when you see all these things, know that it is near—at the doors!
Bahnar: Na dôm tơdrong Inh roi kơ iĕm noh hei kư̆m lei-lăi. Ning-mônh lăp iĕm 'bôh dôm tơdrong Inh roi kơ iĕm noh, iĕm băt Inh Kon Bơngai wă jê̆ jur boih. 'Noh dang lĕ kiơ̆ 'măng dur boih.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, this generation will by no means pass away till all these things take place.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, jơhnơr noh gô 'bôh tơpă tôm tơdrong Inh roi kơ iĕm noh hei.

English: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will by no means pass away.
Bahnar: Plĕnh teh gô hiong tôch đĭ, mă-lei dôm tơdrong Inh pơma ưh kơ đei layơ hiong tôch ôh, gô 'bôh tơpă.

English: “But of that day and hour no one knows, not even the angels of heaven, but My Father only.
Bahnar: “Năr păng jơ ei ưh kơ đei bu băt. Lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ti ưh kơ băt. Inh Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei ră, kư̆m hơdai ưh kơ băt mơ̆n. Pôm 'Bă Inh đĕch băt kơ năr ei kơnh.

English: But as the days of Noah were, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be.
Bahnar: Na Inh Kon Bơngai gô jur ning-mônh thoi đak lip kơplah jơhnơr Nôê sơ̆.

English: For as in the days before the flood, they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark
Bahnar: Hơdrol kơ đak lip sơ̆, kon bơngai oei sa et pơrŏ tơdrong iŏk klo kăn, tơdrong noh nai dang lĕ kơ năr oei hiôk-hian thoi krô hmă; truh tơ Nôê mơ̆t lăm duk, lu sư kư̆m ưh tam mă băt 'mơ̆i.

English: and did not know until the flood came and took them all away, so also will the coming of the Son of Man be.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ kơchăng tơdrong kiơ wă truh kơ lu sư, dĭng đak lơ̆p pơlôch đĭ-đăng lu sư hloi. Na Inh Kon Bơngai gô jur ning-mônh thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Then two men will be in the field: one will be taken and the other left.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei kơnh đei 'bar 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo jang tơ mir, linh jang 'lơ̆ng iŏk anhăk minh 'nu mă lui, minh 'nu ưh kơ lui lê̆ tơ noh.

English: Two women will be grinding at the mill: one will be taken and the other left.
Bahnar: Đei 'bar 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn oei peh 'ba, linh jang 'lơ̆ng iŏk anhăk minh 'nu mă lui, minh 'nu ưh kơ lui lê̆ tơ noh.

English: Watch therefore, for you do not know what hour your Lord is coming.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei kơchăng bĕ, yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ băt layơ Inh mă Kră Yang iĕm wă jur dơ̆ng.

English: But know this, that if the master of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched and not allowed his house to be broken into.
Bahnar: “Iĕm athei kơchăng hli kơ thoi bơngai âu: Bơngai âu sư ưh kơ kơchăng kơ đe wă tơtông tơmam sư. Lăp đe tơtông tơmam sư boih na sư khan: ‘Ô, ăn dah băt kơ đe wă tơtông tơmam inh măng hei, lei inh kral kơchăng kuă ăn lu sư bŏk tơnăr hnam inh ôh.’

English: Therefore you also be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei kơchăng 'nĕ kơ thoi bơngai noh, hli kơ Inh Kon Bơngai wă jur tơ iĕm dơ̆ng kơplah iĕm ưh kơ lêng ê.

English: “Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his master made ruler over his household, to give them food in due season?
Bahnar: “Bơngai đĭch, sư athei jang tơnăp kiơ̆ thoi yŏng sư pơkă, na yŏng sư lăp đon pơjao ăn kơ sư pơm kai wei-lăng lu buăl sư dơ̆ng na mưh trŏ kơ jơ sŏng sa sư chă asong kơ lu bôl sư tơmam sa.

English: Blessed is that servant whom his master, when he comes, will find so doing.
