Bahnar: Lăp yŏng lu sư wih 'bôh bơngai kai mă đêl sư pơjao athei wei-lăng lu đĭch đam sư noh jang kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r pơkă na sư bơnê, thoi noh na bơngai kai jơhngơ̆m sư hiôk tơpă.

English: Assuredly, I say to you that he will make him ruler over all his goods.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, yŏng sư gô ăn kơ sư wei-lăng đĭ-đăng mŭk tơmam yŏng sư hloi.

English: But if that evil servant says in his heart, ‘My master is delaying his coming,’
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah bơngai kai noh ưh kơ chu kơ yŏng sư, sư wă tơchĕng kiơ̆ kơ đon sư kơdih, na sư khan: ‘Yŏng inh wă wih mơ̆n oei đunh,’

English: and begins to beat his fellow servants, and to eat and drink with the drunkards
Bahnar: na sư ngôi hơdai sa et păng lu bơngai suai sik, tôn teh lu buăl sư tăm

English: the master of that servant will come on a day when he is not looking for him and at an hour that he is not aware of
Bahnar: na yŏng sư wih kơplah sư ưh kơ kơchăng, tabơla haih pă tam boih.

English: and will cut him in two and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites. There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
Bahnar: Yŏng sư gô phak pơlôch sư, ăn kơ sư oei hơdai hăm dôm lu bơngai pơm ưh kơ tơpăt, lê̆ sư nhơ̆m hmoi tơkăp sơnĕnh tơ noh.

English: “Then the kingdom of heaven shall be likened to ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
Bahnar: “Kơplah năr ei kơnh lu bơngai mă khan 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r lu sư ră, mă-lei lu sư thoi lĕ kơ mơjĭt 'nu adruh âu, rim 'nu kơ lu sư chĕp ŭnh kơđeng ngăl wă năm ngôi hơpong kơ bơngai 'nao iŏk akăn. Lu sư chang gô bơngai mă 'nao iŏk akăn ei wă truh.

English: Now five of them were wise, and five were foolish.
Bahnar: Lăm lu sư noh đei pơđăm 'nu adruh đĕch kơchăng, pơđăm 'nu adruh ưh.

English: Those who were foolish took their lamps and took no oil with them
Bahnar: Pơđăm 'nu adruh mă ưh kơ kơchăng noh, lu sư chĕp pôm kơđeng, ưh kơ chĕp hiă kơchai đak dâu trôl.

English: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
Bahnar: Pơđăm 'nu adruh mă kơchăng noh, lu sư chĕp kơđeng păng chĕp hiă kơchai đak dâu trôl hloi.

English: But while the bridegroom was delayed, they all slumbered and slept.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư chang gô bơngai mă 'nao iŏk akăn ei ưh kơ jah truh tơ lu sư, lu sư tep kơkôi jing tep hiơt hloi.

English: “And at midnight a cry was heard: ‘Behold, the bridegroom is coming; go out to meet him!’
Bahnar: “Truh tŏk-bŏk măng na đei nơ̆r krao 'bơ̆r re khan: ‘Bơngai mă 'nao iŏk akăn truh boih, năm jah kiơ̆ sư bĕ.’

English: Then all those virgins arose and trimmed their lamps.
Bahnar: Na mơjĭt 'nu adruh noh iung đơ̆ng tep hơmet ŭnh kơđeng lu sư.

English: And the foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.’
Bahnar: Pơđăm 'nu adruh mă ưh kơchăng noh apinh pơđăm 'nu adruh mă kơchăng khan: ‘Asong nhôn đak trôl iĕm bĕ, yua kơ kơđeng nhôn wă păt, đak trôl đĭ boih.’

English: But the wise answered, saying, ‘No, lest there should not be enough for us and you; but go rather to those who sell, and buy for yourselves.’
Bahnar: Na lu bôl sư mă kơchăng ei khan: ‘Ưh ôh, dah nhôn asong iĕm, hli kơ nhôn ưh kơ mah păng iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ mah mơ̆n. Iĕm athei năm răt kơdih tơ anih đe mơdro.’

English: And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the wedding; and the door was shut.
Bahnar: Na lu sư năm răt. Kơplah lu sư năm răt na bơngai mă 'nao iŏk akăn truh boih, lu pơđăm 'nu adruh mă kơchăng noh mơ̆t kiơ̆ hloi sư tơ hnam đe pơkong sŏng sa, na đe tang chơkăl hloi 'măng.

English: “Afterward the other virgins came also, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us!’
Bahnar: Lăp đơ̆ng rŏng 'biơ̆ kơ noh, lu pơđăm 'nu adruh mă ưh kơ kơchăng hei truh, lu sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, pơih kơ nhôn 'măng. Ơ 'bok, pơih kơ nhôn 'măng 'biơ̆ bĕ.’

English: But he answered and said, ‘Assuredly, I say to you, I do not know you.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bok mă 'nao iŏk akăn ei khan kơ lu sư: ‘Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, inh ưh kơ băt kơ lu iĕm ôh.’ ”

English: “Watch therefore, for you know neither the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơtih gia tơdrong noh đang boih na Sư khan: “Iĕm athei kơchăng mă tơpă, yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ băt năr ayơ, jơ ayơ Inh wă jur tơ iĕm.”

English: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a man traveling to a far country, who called his own servants and delivered his goods to them.
Bahnar: “Lu bơngai mă khan 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r sư năr ei kơnh, lu sư thoi bơngai jang kơ yŏng sư, yŏng sư wă năm tơ dêh tơmoi ataih, na sư pơjao ăn kơ lu bơngai jang kơ sư wei-lăng mŭk tơmam sư.

English: And to one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, to each according to his own ability; and immediately he went on a journey.
Bahnar: Sư ăn kơ lu bơngai jang kơ sư jên gô mơ̆ng kơ lu sư gơh mơdro sa kơdih. Bơngai hơgei kơ mơdro sư ăn lơ 'biơ̆, bơngai ưh kơ gan hơgei sư ăn tŏ sĕt 'biơ̆. Sư ăn kơ bơngai mă mônh pơđăm hlak jên maih, minh hlak jên maih noh lơ tơpă. Sư ăn kơ bơngai mă 'bar, 'bar hlak jên maih. Bơngai mă pêng lăp minh hlak jên maih. Klaih kơ noh yŏng sư năm tơ dêh tơmoi ataih.

English: Then he who had received the five talents went and traded with them, and made another five talents.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă iŏk pơđăm hlak jên maih yŏng sư noh, hơloh năm chă mơdro sa hloi, đei lơi kơ sư pơđăm hlak jên maih dơ̆ng.

English: And likewise he who had received two gained two more also.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă iŏk 'bar hlak jên maih yŏng sư noh, kư̆m pơm lei-lăi, đei lơi kơ sư 'bar hlak jên maih dơ̆ng.

English: But he who had received one went and dug in the ground, and hid his lord’s money.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă iŏk minh hlak jên maih yŏng sư noh, sư hơloh năm sir 'bŭ ôn tơ sơlŭng.

English: After a long time the lord of those servants came and settled accounts with them.
Bahnar: “Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh đunh tơpă, na yŏng lu sư brŏk lăng lu sư mơdro sa hăm đei lơi ưh.

English: “So he who had received five talents came and brought five other talents, saying, ‘Lord, you delivered to me five talents; look, I have gained five more talents besides them.’
Bahnar: Bơngai mă iŏk pơđăm hlak jên maih yŏng sư noh, năm pơdrĕo kơ yŏng sư khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, sơ̆ inh iŏk pơđăm hlak jên ih, inh năm mơdro sa đei lơi pơđăm hlak, dang ei jing mơjĭt hlak, inh ăn pơđĭ hloi kơ ih.’

English: His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant; you were faithful over a few things, I will make you ruler over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
Bahnar: Na yŏng sư khan: ‘Ơ dăm, ih jang kơ inh 'lơ̆ng tơpă, ih ưh kơ lê̆ ôh dôm tơdrong jang inh. Yua kơ ih jang 'lơ̆ng, na mă khan tơdrong jang ih iĕ, inh gô ăn kơ ih jang tơdrong tih hloh dơ̆ng. Na dang ei bĕ ba oei hơdai hiôk chơt hăm inh yŏng ih.’

English: He also who had received two talents came and said, ‘Lord, you delivered to me two talents; look, I have gained two more talents besides them.’
Bahnar: Bơngai mă iŏk 'bar hlak jên yŏng sư noh kư̆m pơma lei-lăi khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, sơ̆ inh iŏk 'bar hlak jên ih, inh năm mơdro sa đei lơi 'bar hlak dơ̆ng, inh ăn pơđĭ hloi kơ ih.’

English: His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant; you have been faithful over a few things, I will make you ruler over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
Bahnar: Na yŏng sư khan: ‘Ơ dăm, ih jang kơ inh 'lơ̆ng tơpă, ih ưh kơ lê̆ ôh dôm tơdrong jang inh. Yua kơ ih jang 'lơ̆ng, na mă khan tơdrong jang ih iĕ, inh gô ăn kơ ih jang tơdrong tih hloh dơ̆ng. Na dang ei bĕ ba oei hơdai hiôk chơt hăm inh yŏng ih.’

English: “Then he who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Lord, I knew you to be a hard man, reaping where you have not sown, and gathering where you have not scattered seed.
Bahnar: “Bơngai mă iŏk minh hlak jên yŏng sư noh, kư̆m hơdai năm khan mơ̆n, sư khan: ‘Ơ 'bok, inh băt kơ ih bơngai wă pơgŏ nhôn, na ih athei nhôn năm mơdro ăn kơ ih, wă kơ ih iŏk đĕch thoi đe pơtăm 'ba, ih gô wă kĕch iŏk kơdih.

English: And I was afraid, and went and hid your talent in the ground. Look, there you have what is yours.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na inh sir 'bŭ jên noh tơ sơlŭng, inh hli kơ hiong kơ inh mơdro sa. Na dang ei he âu iŏk pơdrĕo kơdih bĕ jên ih sơ̆.’

English: “But his lord answered and said to him, ‘You wicked and lazy servant, you knew that I reap where I have not sown, and gather where I have not scattered seed.
Bahnar: Na yŏng sư khan: ‘Ơ dăm, ih bơngai kơchu păng alah tăm, ih jô̆ kơ inh iŏk jên iĕm mơdro sa thoi bơngai kĕch iŏk 'ba đêl đe pơtăm hă?

English: So you ought to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I would have received back my own with interest.
Bahnar: Lei ih kuă kơ kiơ ăn kơ đe mơng, wă kơ ih đei lơi? Mưh inh năm iŏk na ih pơdrĕo jên mă inh ăn kơ ih păng jên mă ih đei lơi.’

English: Therefore take the talent from him, and give it to him who has ten talents.
Bahnar: ‘Thoi noh na yŏng lu sư athei lu bơngai jang kơ sư iŏk jên đơ̆ng bơngai kơchu noh, ăn kơ bơngai mă đei mơjĭt hlak. Sư khan

English: ‘For to everyone who has, more will be given, and he will have abundance; but from him who does not have, even what he has will be taken away.
Bahnar: ‘Kon bơngai bơ̆n mưh jang pơnam, sư đei tơmam lơ, Kră Yang mơnat ăn pơthim tơmam kơ sư rai lơ rơkah rơkai. Bơngai mă alah, tơmam ưh kơ đei lơ, rai hiong huach đơ̆ng sư tăm.

English: And cast the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm hiŏng hơtat bơngai mă ưh kơ yua âu tơ anih 'ngoaih măng mu, lê̆ sư nhơ̆m hmoi tơkăp sơnĕnh tơ noh.’

English: “When the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the holy angels with Him, then He will sit on the throne of His glory.
Bahnar: “Năr ei kơnh Inh Kon Bơngai mơsêh tih-tin 'lơ̆ng rŏ jur tơ teh âu hơdai păng lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng, Inh gô oei kơpal tang-dŏ pơtao 'lơ̆ng rŏ.

English: All the nations will be gathered before Him, and He will separate them one from another, as a shepherd divides his sheep from the goats.
Bahnar: Năr ei kơnh đĭ-đăng rim khŭl kon bơngai akŭm 'bơ̆t anăp Inh, na Inh gô klah asong lu sư jing 'bar khŭl, kư̆m thoi bơngai wei triu klah asong triu păng bơbe sư 'bar khŭl.

English: And He will set the sheep on His right hand, but the goats on the left.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă thoi triu noh, wă khan bơngai 'lơ̆ng, Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư oei gah 'ma kơ Inh; lu bơngai mă thoi bơbe, wă khan bơngai kơnê̆, Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư oei gah 'ngiĕo kơ Inh.

English: Then the King will say to those on His right hand, ‘Come, you blessed of My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world
Bahnar: Na Inh pơm Pơtao pơgơ̆r lu sư, Inh khan kơ lu bơngai mă oei gah 'ma kơ Inh thoi âu: ‘'Bă Inh ăn kơ iĕm hiôk tơpă, năm mơ̆t oei tơ dêh Sư bĕ, Sư hơmet kơ iĕm anih đơ̆ng Sư pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆ boih.

English: for I was hungry and you gave Me food; I was thirsty and you gave Me drink; I was a stranger and you took Me in
Bahnar: Sơ̆ Inh pơngot, iĕm 'me Inh; sơ̆ Inh ol kơ đak, iĕm asong nhă; Inh bơngai tơmoi, iĕm sơng iŏk oei tơ hnam iĕm.

English: I was naked and you clothed Me; I was sick and you visited Me; I was in prison and you came to Me.’
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ đei hơbĕn ao, iĕm tơgŭm; Inh jĭ jăn, iĕm ngôi hơpong; đe tah Inh tơ hnam phak, iĕm kư̆m năm ngôi.’

English: “Then the righteous will answer Him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry and feed You, or thirsty and give You drink?
Bahnar: “Na lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ei khan: ‘Ơ Kră Yang, layơ nhôn 'bôh Ih pơngot Ih khan nhôn 'me Ih? Layơ nhôn 'bôh Ih ol kơ đak, Ih khan nhôn asong Ih nhă?

English: When did we see You a stranger and take You in, or naked and clothe You?
Bahnar: Layơ nhôn 'bôh Ih bơngai tơmoi, na Ih khan nhôn sơng iŏk Ih oei tơ hnam nhôn? Layơ nhôn 'bôh Ih kơ'bah kơ hơbĕn ao, na Ih khan nhôn tơgŭm Ih?

English: Or when did we see You sick, or in prison, and come to You?’
Bahnar: Layơ nhôn 'bôh Ih jĭ jăn păng đe tah Ih tơ hnam phak, na Ih khan nhôn năm hơpong tơ Ih?’

English: And the King will answer and say to them, ‘Assuredly, I say to you, inasmuch as you did it to one of the least of these My brethren, you did it to Me.’
Bahnar: Na Inh bơngai mă pơm Pơtao iĕm gô khan kơ iĕm thoi âu: ‘Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, yua kơ iĕm băt tơgŭm mơnat kơ lu 'nhŏng oh Inh âu mă iĕ hloh kơ lu iĕm đe sơ̆, tơdrong iĕm pơm noh dang iĕm tơgŭm Inh mơ̆n.’

English: “Then He will also say to those on the left hand, ‘Depart from Me, you cursed, into the everlasting fire prepared for the devil and his angels
Bahnar: “Klaih kơ noh Inh pơma kơ lu bơngai mă oei gah 'ngiĕo kơ Inh dơ̆ng thoi âu: ‘Dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak iĕm boih, iĕm jah weh đơ̆ng âu kơdâu năm tơ dơnâu ŭnh to bĕ. Ŭnh noh ưh kơ layơ păt, ŭnh noh 'Bok Kei-Dei hơmet ăn kơ yang Satan păng đĭ-đăng kơ lu linh jang kơ sư năm oei tơ lăm dơnâu ŭnh noh.

English: for I was hungry and you gave Me no food; I was thirsty and you gave Me no drink
Bahnar: Sơ̆ Inh pơngot, iĕm ưh kơ 'me Inh; sơ̆ Inh ol kơ đak, iĕm kuă asong nhă.

English: I was a stranger and you did not take Me in, naked and you did not clothe Me, sick and in prison and you did not visit Me.’
Bahnar: Inh bơngai tơmoi, iĕm kuă kơ sơng iŏk; Inh kơ'bah kơ hơbĕn ao, iĕm kuă kơ tơgŭm; Inh jĭ jăn păng đe tah Inh tơ hnam phak, iĕm kư̆m kuă kơ năm ngôi.’

English: “Then they also will answer Him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and did not minister to You?’
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu sư kư̆m pơma dŏng kơdih khan: ‘Ơ Kră Yang, layơ nhôn 'bôh Ih pơngot, layơ nhôn 'bôh Ih ol kơ đak, dah bơngai tơmoi, dah kơ'bah kơ hơbĕn ao, dah jĭ jăn păng Ih khan đe tah Ih tơ hnam phak mă nhôn ưh kơ năm ngôi păng tơgŭm?’

English: Then He will answer them, saying, ‘Assuredly, I say to you, inasmuch as you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to Me.’
Bahnar: Na Inh gô khan kơ lu sư: ‘Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, yua kơ sơ̆ iĕm ưh kơ tơgŭm mơnat kơ lu 'nhŏng oh Inh âu, lu sư bơngai iĕ hloh kơ iĕm, noh dang iĕm ưh kơ tơgŭm Inh mơ̆n.’

English: And these will go away into everlasting punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'Bok Kei-Dei phak lu sư tơ dơnâu ŭnh ling-lang ưh kơ layơ păt. Gah lu bơngai lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, lu sư tŏk oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang kư̆m ưh kơ layơ tôch.”

English: Now it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, that He said to His disciples
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dôm tơdrong 'noh hei đang boih, na Sư khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư thoi âu

English: “You know that after two days is the Passover, and the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified.”
Bahnar: “Iĕm băt mơ̆n oei pă 'bar năr truh kơ năr đe pơm Giĕng Năm Brih. Na đe wă rôp jao Inh Kon Bơngai ăn kơ đe pơ̆ng pơlôch tơ 'long pơglang.”

English: Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people assembled at the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas
Bahnar: Năr noh lu 'bok soi tih păng lu kră sek tơlang đe Juđê năm akŭm tơ hnam 'bok soi tơm, anăn 'bok soi tơm noh Kaiphe.

English: and plotted to take Jesus by trickery and kill Him.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơđâu chă tơdrong gơh rôp tơtông Yêsu na pơlôch.

English: But they said, “Not during the feast, lest there be an uproar among the people.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “Kơplah năr giĕng âu bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ pơm tơdrong noh, yua kơ năr giĕng âu kon tơring tơrang truh lơ, hli kơ lu sư blah bơ̆n.”

English: And when Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper
Bahnar: Yêsu oei tơ hnam Simôn, bơngai mă đêl jĭ chin tơ Pơlei Bethani.

English: a woman came to Him having an alabaster flask of very costly fragrant oil, and she poured it on His head as He sat at the table.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei sŏng sa đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn chĕp minh pôm gŏl đak pơgang 'bâu phu đe gĭt tơpă, gŏl noh đe pơm păng tơmo. Na duch noh tuh tơ kơ̆l Yêsu.

English: But when His disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, “Why this waste?
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu mơ'nah 'bôh duch noh pơm thoi noh, na lu sư hil kơ duch noh na khan: “Lơliơ duch noh pơhuach kư̆ kă ưh kơ 'mêm kơ đak pơgang sư?

English: For this fragrant oil might have been sold for much and given to the poor.”
Bahnar: Pơgang 'bâu phu noh kăp jên dêh, lơliơ sư ưh kơ wă tĕch chă jên asong kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin?”

English: But when Jesus was aware of it, He said to them, “Why do you trouble the woman? For she has done a good work for Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm mơ'nah pơma thoi noh, na Sư khan: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm ơh kơ tơdrong sư pơm kơ Inh noh? Sư pơm thoi noh trŏ boih.

English: For you have the poor with you always, but Me you do not have always.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai dơnuh hin sư oei păng iĕm ling-lang, gah Inh ưh kơ oei păng iĕm ling-lang ôh.

English: For in pouring this fragrant oil on My body, she did it for My burial.
Bahnar: Sư tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu tơ akâu Inh hơdrol kơ đe wă 'bŭ Inh, thoi đe juăt kơ pơm hơdrol kơ 'bŭ bơngai lôch.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, wherever this gospel is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be told as a memorial to her.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak, lu bơngai bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng, lu sư gô roi tơdrong duch noh pơm kơ Inh, wă kơ đe ư-ang kơ tơdrong sư pơm.”

English: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Juđa Ikariôt, bơngai đơ̆ng mơjĭt-'bar 'nu pơhrăm păng Yêsu, sư năm tơ lu 'bok soi tih.

English: and said, “What are you willing to give me if I deliver Him to you?” And they counted out to him thirty pieces of silver.
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Dah inh đei rôp ăn kơ iĕm Yêsu, iĕm apah inh dôm yơ?” Na đe noh jô̆ ăn kơ sư jên, pêng-jĭt hlak jên hu so sơ̆.

English: So from that time he sought opportunity to betray Him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng kơplah noh hloi Juđa chă tơdrong plơ̆ plĕch Yêsu.

English: Now on the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”
Bahnar: Đe juăt kơ pơm giĕng sa 'Bĕng Mi Ưh Kơ Đei 'Buih Pông tơhngam năr. Na năr mă mônh lăm giĕng noh đe kư̆m juăt kơ sa Giĕng Năm Brih. Na trŏ kơ năr noh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu năm jet Sư: “Ih wă kơ nhôn hơmet kơ Ih tơmam sa Giĕng Năm Brih tơ yơ?”

English: And He said, “Go into the city to a certain man, and say to him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is at hand; I will keep the Passover at your house with My disciples.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu athei lu sư năm tơ minh 'nu bơngai ei tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem na khan kơ sư thoi âu: “'Bok Thây khan wă jê̆ truh năr Sư boih, na lu nhôn bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư wă hơmet tơmam sa Sư pơrŏ kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih tơ hnam ih.”

English: So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them; and they prepared the Passover.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư pơm kiơ̆ thoi Sư pơkă, rai hơmet lê̆ tơmam sŏng sa pơrŏ kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih tơ noh.

English: When evening had come, He sat down with the twelve.
Bahnar: Truh adrơ̆m kơsơ̆ 'năr mơ̆t boih, na Yêsu sŏng sa hơdai lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư.

English: Now as they were eating, He said, “Assuredly, I say to you, one of you will betray Me.”
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei sŏng sa Yêsu khan: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đei minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm dang ei wă plơ̆ plĕch Inh.”

English: And they were exceedingly sorrowful, and each of them began to say to Him, “Lord, is it I?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư thoi noh, na lu sư ơh sơ'ngon. Na rim 'nu lu sư kơdih kơdih jet Sư khan: “Hăm trŏ kơ inh?” Mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan: “Inh hă?”

English: He answered and said, “He who dipped his hand with Me in the dish will betray Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Bơngai mă chơ̆m sa 'bĕng mi tơ pơnhan đak 'nhot hơdai păng Inh, bơngai noh boih wă plơ̆ plĕch Inh.

English: The Son of Man indeed goes just as it is written of Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had not been born.”
Bahnar: Inh Kon Bơngai gô lôch 'blep trŏ thoi đe chih roi lê̆ hơdrol lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei. Mă-lei mơnat kơ bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch Inh noh đĕch pŭ tơdrong pơmat, 'lơ̆ng hloh đe dah lê̆ kơ tơpŭ kơ sư sơ̆.”

English: Then Judas, who was betraying Him, answered and said, “Rabbi, is it I?” He said to him, “You have said it.”
Bahnar: Na Juđa bơngai wă plơ̆ plĕch Sư ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, inh hă?” Yêsu khan: “Trŏ boih, ih wă plơ̆ plĕch Inh.”

English: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to the disciples and said, “Take, eat; this is My body.”
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư sŏng sa, Yêsu iŏk 'bĕng mi krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na phĕ hloi 'bĕng mi noh asong kơ lu sư păng khan: “Iŏk sa 'bĕng âu bĕ, 'bĕng âu boih akâu Inh.”

English: Then He took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk dơ̆ng minh pôm kơchŏk đak hơmu, krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na ăn kơ lu sư păng khan: “Huch bĕ đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm

English: For this is My blood of the new covenant, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.
Bahnar: đak hơmu âu boih pham Inh wă lĕch tang ăn lơ bơngai, na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih tơdrong yoch.

English: But I say to you, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it new with you in My Father’s kingdom.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Inh ưh pă huch boih đak hơmu âu tơ̆p mă truh tơ năr 'Bă Inh pơgơ̆r ning-mônh 'mơ̆i, na Inh gô huch đak hơmu 'nao hơdai iĕm.”

English: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Bahnar: Đang Sư pơma thoi noh boih lu sư hơri minh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, đơ̆ng noh lĕch năm hloi tơ kông Ôliwơ.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of Me this night, for it is written: ‘I will strike the Shepherd, And the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
Bahnar: Yêsu roi kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm măng kơnh kơdâu achăng lê̆ Inh, yua kơ đei nơ̆r chih roi lê̆ hơdrol boih thoi âu: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơlôch tơ'ngla wei triu, triu kơdâu tơklah đơ̆ng tơ'ngla Sư.’

English: But after I have been raised, I will go before you to Galilee.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Inh đơ̆ng lôch, Inh năm tơ dêh Galilê hơdrol kơ iĕm.”

English: Peter answered and said to Him, “Even if all are made to stumble because of You, I will never be made to stumble.”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan kơ Sư: “Mă lu đe âu achăng lê̆ Ih, gah Inh kuă kơ achăng Ih ôh.”

English: Jesus said to him, “Assuredly, I say to you that this night, before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ Pêtrôs: “Inh khan kơ ih tơpă, măng kơnh boih hơdrol kơ iĕr ŏ, ih gô sơngah kơ Inh pêng 'măng khan ih ưh kơ băt kơ Inh.”

English: Peter said to Him, “Even if I have to die with You, I will not deny You!” And so said all the disciples.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs khan: “Mă đe wă pơlôch inh hơdai păng Ih, inh kư̆m kuă kơ sơngah ôh.” Đĭ-đăng lu bôl sư kư̆m khan lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to the disciples, “Sit here while I go and pray over there.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu năm hơdai hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tơ anih mă đe anăn Gêtsêmanê. Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm oei 'bơ̆t âu, Inh wă năm krao khan tơ to.”

English: And He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and He began to be sorrowful and deeply distressed.
Bahnar: Yêsu anhăk ba lăp pêng 'nu đĕch truh tơ anih Sư krao khan. Pêtrôs păng 'bar 'nu bre 'nhŏng oh kon Sêbêđê. Yêsu sơ'ngon dêh yua kơ Sư băt kơdih wă đei tơdrong gleh truh.

English: Then He said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here and watch with Me.”
Bahnar: Na Sư khan kơ pêng 'nu noh: “Dang ei Inh sơ'ngon dêh dang lĕ kơ wă lôch, na iĕm ngôi 'bơ̆t âu kral kơchăng ngôi hơpong kơ Inh 'biơ̆ hŏ.”

English: He went a little farther and fell on His face, and prayed, saying, “O My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from Me; nevertheless, not as I will, but as You will.”
Bahnar: Yêsu năm ataih 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng lu pêng 'nu noh na Sư 'nap kŭp kơ̆l krao khan kơ 'Bă Sư thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bă, dah gơh, ăn kơ Inh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong gleh âu. Mă-lei Ih 'nĕ pơm kiơ̆ kơ Inh, pơm kiơ̆ kơ Ih đĕch.”

English: Then He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “What! Could you not watch with Me one hour?
Bahnar: Đang boih na Sư wih tơ pêng 'nu noh 'bôh lu sư tep, na Sư khan kơ Pêtrôs: “Lơliơ iĕm ưh kơ gơh kral ngôi hơpong kơ Inh hơya minh jơ?

English: Watch and pray, lest you enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ iĕm kral ngôi hơpong kơ Inh păng wă kơ iĕm krao khan kơdih wă kơ iĕm huay kơ lui kơ yang Satan pơhlŭ. Inh băt kơ jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm wă ră, mă-lei akâu iĕm ưh kơ kĕ.”

English: Again, a second time, He went away and prayed, saying, “O My Father, if this cup cannot pass away from Me unless I drink it, Your will be done.”
Bahnar: Yêsu năm krao khan mă 'bar Sư khan thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bă, dah Ih wă kơ Inh chu iŏk tơdrong gleh âu tơpă, kư̆m bưh, gô mơ̆ng kơ Ih wă.”

English: And He came and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy.
Bahnar: Đang boih Sư wih tơ lu đe noh 'bôh oei tep lei-lăi yua kơ măt lu sư trăp ưh kơ kĕ kral.

English: So He left them, went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.
Bahnar: Sư achăng lê̆ lu đe noh năm krao khan mă pêng, Sư krao khan lei-lăi thoi hei.

English: Then He came to His disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.
Bahnar: Krao khan đang boih Sư wih dơ̆ng tơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư na khan: “Iĕm tep pơdơh 'biơ̆ hă? Dang ei truh jơ đe wă rôp Inh Kon Bơngai jao kơ lu bơngai yoch boih.

English: Rise, let us be going. See, My betrayer is at hand.”
Bahnar: Iung bĕ, bơ̆n jah năm tơ lu sư; iĕm lăng to bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch Inh wă jê̆ truh boih.”

English: And while He was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, with a great multitude with swords and clubs, came from the chief priests and elders of the people.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei pơma 'bôh blư kơ Juđa truh, bơngai mă đơ̆ng lăm mơjĭt-'bar 'nu pơhrăm păng Yêsu. Đei lơ bơngai kiơ̆ sư chĕp tak đao mơ'nah chĕp 'long tơnôn, yua kơ lu 'bok soi tih, lu đe kră sek tơlang đe Juđê wơh lu sư năm rôp Yêsu.

English: Now His betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the One; seize Him.”
Bahnar: Juđa bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch Yêsu sư tơbăt ăn kơ lu bơngai mă năm rôp Yêsu thoi âu: “Bơngai mă inh chŭm, bơngai noh boih Yêsu, iĕm rôp hŏ.”

English: Immediately he went up to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
Bahnar: Juđa năm hloi tơ Yêsu păng khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, liĕm kâu hiôk-hian kơ bơ̆n.” Na sư chŭm hloi Yêsu kiơ̆ thoi đe Juđê juăt kơ kơkuh băl.

English: But Jesus said to him, “Friend, why have you come?” Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and took Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Ơ buăl, pơm bĕ tơdrong ih wă pơm.” Na lu sư tơkan rôp kơjăp Yêsu hloi.

English: And suddenly, one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand and drew his sword, struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t ei đei minh 'nu bơngai dơ̆ng hơdai Yêsu hloch đao koh kơtĕch hloi hla đon đĭch 'bok soi tơm.

English: But Jesus said to him, “Put your sword in its place, for all who take the sword will perish by the sword.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Tah lê̆ đao ih tơ anglop bĕ. Bu yua đao, sư gô lôch yua kơ đao mơ̆n.

English: Or do you think that I cannot now pray to My Father, and He will provide Me with more than twelve legions of angels?
Bahnar: Dah Inh wă dang ei Inh gơh apinh 'Bă Inh tơjur tơpơh-jĭt rơbâu 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng Sư blah dŏng bơ̆n.

English: How then could the Scriptures be fulfilled, that it must happen thus?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan Inh gô lôch tang kon bơngai, na thoi yơ Inh gơh apinh 'Bă Inh dŏng bơ̆n thoi noh?”

English: In that hour Jesus said to the multitudes, “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to take Me? I sat daily with you, teaching in the temple, and you did not seize Me.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh mơ̆n, Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai mă năm rôp Sư: “Lơliơ iĕm năm tơ âu chĕp tak đao 'long tơnôn dang lĕ đe rôp bơngai tơtông klĕ? Bĭ rim năr Inh bơtho iĕm tơ lăm hnam akŭm tơm iĕm kuă kơ kiơ kơ rôp Inh tơ noh lĕ?

English: But all this was done that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples forsook Him and fled.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dôm tơdrong noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă kơ 'blep kơ tơdrong lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư chih roi lê̆ hơdrol tơ sơ̆p hla bơar Sư sơ̆.” Đang Sư pơma thoi noh bru đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư achăng lê̆ Sư kơdâu jăk tơ nai.

English: And those who had laid hold of Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.
Bahnar: Lu đe mă rôp Yêsu ei anhăk Sư tơ 'bok soi tơm, anăn sư Kaiphe. Lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê hăm lu đe kră sek tơlang akŭm tơ hnam sư noh.

English: But Peter followed Him at a distance to the high priest’s courtyard. And he went in and sat with the servants to see the end.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs kiơ̆ lăng Yêsu đơ̆ng rŏng ataih ataih, truh tơ cham hnam 'bok soi tơm, sư oei ngôi hơdai lu bơngai gak. Sư kiơ̆ mơ̆ng wă kơ băt tơdrong đe pơm kơ Yêsu thoi yơ.

English: Now the chief priests, the elders, and all the council sought false testimony against Jesus to put Him to death
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih păng đĭ-đăng lu kră sek tơlang, lu sư chă bơngai mă gơh hơlĕnh, khan sư 'bôh Yêsu pơm yoch, wă kơ lu sư gơh pơlôch Yêsu.

English: but found none. Even though many false witnesses came forward, they found none. But at last two false witnesses came forward
Bahnar: Đei lơ mơ̆n lu bơngai hơlĕnh jâu tă kơ Sư, mă-lei ưh kơ đei tơdrong gơh pơlôch Sư ôh. Tôch đơ̆ng rŏng đei 'bar 'nu bơngai

English: and said, “This fellow said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to build it in three days.’ ”
Bahnar: iung pơma jâu Sư khan: “Bơngai âu Sư khan Sư gơh yuih hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, na pơm ming plơ̆ng dơ̆ng kơtĕch pêng năr keh hloi.”

English: And the high priest arose and said to Him, “Do You answer nothing? What is it these men testify against You?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na 'bok soi tơm iung jet Yêsu: “Đe jâu Ih, Ih kuă kơ kiơ kơ pơma?”

English: But Jesus kept silent. And the high priest answered and said to Him, “I put You under oath by the living God: Tell us if You are the Christ, the Son of God!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu oei thĕng ưh kơ đei tơl sư thoi yơ ôh. 'Bok soi tơm jet Sư dơ̆ng: “Đei 'Bok Kei-Dei arih tơpă păng Sư 'bôh tôm tơdrong Ih pơm, na Ih athei roi kơ nhôn mă tơpăt, hăm trŏ kơ Ih 'Bok Krist, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă dah ưh?”

English: Jesus said to him, “It is as you said. Nevertheless, I say to you, hereafter you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Power, and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
Bahnar: Yêsu tơl: “Trŏ boih. Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, ning-mônh iĕm gô 'bôh Inh Kon Bơngai oei gah 'ma kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơsêh tih-tin na đơ̆ng noh jur đơ̆ng plĕnh hăm hơmơ̆l.”

English: Then the high priest tore his clothes, saying, “He has spoken blasphemy! What further need do we have of witnesses? Look, now you have heard His blasphemy!
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơm kơtơ̆ng Yêsu pơma thoi noh boih, na sư hek hloi ao sư kơdih yua kơ sư ơh tơpă. Na sư khan: “Bơ̆n mah kăl kơ kiơ chă bơngai nai wă jâu Sư dơ̆ng? Iĕm kơtơ̆ng boih Sư pơma thoi noh hei, Sư pơma blông kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei dêh.

English: What do you think?” They answered and said, “He is deserving of death.”
Bahnar: Na iĕm tơchĕng lăng bơ̆n wă pơm kiơ kơ bơngai âu?” Lu bôl sư khan: “Bơngai âu trŏ kơ pơlôch.”

English: Then they spat in His face and beat Him; and others struck Him with the palms of their hands
Bahnar: Lu đe ei chă kơsoh pơ'brơh đak hai tơ muh măt Sư, tŭr Sư, mơ'nah tap Sư

English: saying, “Prophesy to us, Christ! Who is the one who struck You?”
Bahnar: pơma che bơle khan: “Ơ 'Bok Krist, Ih mơsêh, Ih mơyang na dang ei roi lăng kơ nhôn bu tŭr Ih.”

English: Now Peter sat outside in the courtyard. And a servant girl came to him, saying, “You also were with Jesus of Galilee.”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs oei ngôi 'bơ̆t cham hnam, đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn đĭch đam 'bok soi tơm năm tơ sư păng khan: “Ih kư̆m bơngai oei hơdai Yêsu đơ̆ng dêh Galilê mơ̆n.”

English: But he denied it before them all, saying, “I do not know what you are saying.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs sơngah 'bơ̆t anăp lu đe ei khan: “Inh ưh kơ băt ih wă khan kiơ.”

English: And when he had gone out to the gateway, another girl saw him and said to those who were there, “This fellow also was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs lĕch đơ̆ng noh ngôi kiơ̆ trong 'măng tơm, đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn nai 'bôh sư na khan kơ lu bôl sư kiơ̆ ei: “Bơngai âu oei hơdai Yêsu đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret mơ̆n.”

English: But again he denied with an oath, “I do not know the Man!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs oei sơngah khan: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, inh ưh kơ băt kơ Sư ôh.”

English: And a little later those who stood by came up and said to Peter, “Surely you also are one of them, for your speech betrays you.”
Bahnar: Lăp đunh 'biơ̆ kơ noh lu bơngai oei kiơ̆ ei năm tơ Pêtrôs păng khan: “Ih khŭl lu sư tơpă na ih pơma lei-lăi thoi lu sư.”

English: Then he began to curse and swear, saying, “I do not know the Man!” Immediately a rooster crowed.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs sơngah hiap akâu sư kơdih khan: “Inh ưh kơ băt tơpă bơngai mă iĕm khan noh.” Đang sư pơma thoi noh lêk kơ iĕr ŏ hloi.

English: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus who had said to him, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.” So he went out and wept bitterly.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs 'blŏk hơdơ̆r hloi kơ tơdrong Yêsu khan kơ sư khan: “Hơdrol kơ iĕr ŏ, ih gô sơngah kơ Inh pêng 'măng.” Thoi noh na sư lĕch hmoi ơh kơdih sư.

English: When morning came, all the chief priests and elders of the people plotted against Jesus to put Him to death.
Bahnar: Lăp 'brưch hơdah til pơgê đĭ-đăng lu 'bok soi tih păng lu đe kră sek tơlang chă đon wă pơlôch Yêsu.

English: And when they had bound Him, they led Him away and delivered Him to Pontius Pilate the governor.
Bahnar: Lu sư chô̆ Yêsu năm jao ăn kơ Pilat, bơngai Rôm mă pơgơ̆r dêh Juđê.

English: Then Judas, His betrayer, seeing that He had been condemned, was remorseful and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders
Bahnar: Lăp Juđa bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch Yêsu, sư băt kơ đe wă pơlôch Yêsu tơpă, na sư mah hmach kơ plơ̆ plĕch Yêsu, na sư năm tơwih ră kơ lu 'bok soi, lu đe kră, pêng-jĭt hlak jên đơ̆ng đe apah noh.

English: saying, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood.” And they said, “What is that to us? You see to it!”
Bahnar: Sư roi kơ lu đe noh khan: “Inh yoch tơpă, inh jao ăn kơ iĕm wă pơlôch bơngai mă ưh kơ đei pơm yoch kiơ.” Lu đe noh khan: “Măk ai ih, nhôn jao ăn kơ ih jên đang boih.”

English: Then he threw down the pieces of silver in the temple and departed, and went and hanged himself.
Bahnar: Na Juđa năm klơ̆m lê̆ jên noh tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, brŏk hrek hơlŏng pơlôch akâu sư kơdih.

English: But the chief priests took the silver pieces and said, “It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, because they are the price of blood.”
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi dônh jên noh păng khan: “Jên âu jên pơda, dah kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n đơ̆ng sơ̆ ưh kơ gơh pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh.”

English: And they consulted together and bought with them the potter’s field, to bury strangers in.
Bahnar: Na lu sư pơđâu băl iŏk jên noh wă răt minh hlak mir, mir 'noh đe anăn mir bơngai man ge. Lu sư răt mir noh wă pơm bơsat 'bŭ lu bơngai mă ưh kơ khŭl lu sư lôch tơ dêh lu sư.

English: Therefore that field has been called the Field of Blood to this day.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na đe anăn mir 'noh mir pơda oei khơ̆ dang ei.

English: Then was fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the value of Him who was priced, whom they of the children of Israel priced
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'blep trŏ thoi Jêrêmi khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu: “Đe iŏk pêng-jĭt hlak jên đêl lu bơngai Isơrael khan wă răt minh 'nu bơngai.

English: and gave them for the potter’s field, as the LORD directed me.”
Bahnar: Na đe iŏk jên noh năm răt mir bơngai man ge, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei athei pơm thoi noh.”

English: Now Jesus stood before the governor. And the governor asked Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?” Jesus said to him, “It is as you say.”
Bahnar: Yêsu dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Pilat, na Pilat jet Sư khan: “Hăm trŏ kơ Ih pơm pơtao đe Juđê?” Yêsu khan: “Trŏ kơ Inh boih.”

English: And while He was being accused by the chief priests and elders, He answered nothing.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih, lu đe kră sek tơlang jâu Yêsu lơ tơdrong, mă-lei Yêsu ưh kơ tơl.

English: Then Pilate said to Him, “Do You not hear how many things they testify against You?”
Bahnar: Na Pilat khan kơ Sư: “Ih hăm kơtơ̆ng dôm tơdrong đe jâu Ih noh?”

English: But He answered him not one word, so that the governor marveled greatly.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu 'nhŏ kơ tơl, na 'bok tih Pilat sơleng kơ đon.

English: Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to releasing to the multitude one prisoner whom they wished.
Bahnar: Rim đe pơm Giĕng Năm Brih, 'bok tih tơlĕch minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng hnam phak, bơngai bu mă kon pơlei wă kơ tơlĕch.

English: And at that time they had a notorious prisoner called Barabbas.
Bahnar: Na năr noh trŏ kơ năr đe pơm Giĕng Năm Brih. Đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư 'Barra'ba, đe ang jơ̆p tơring, đe tah sư lăm hnam phak.

English: Therefore, when they had gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?”
Bahnar: Lăp lu kon pơlei năm akŭm tơ Pilat, na Pilat jet lu sư thoi âu: “Iĕm wă kơ inh tơlĕch bu, 'Barra'ba dah Yêsu mă đe anăn 'Bok Krist?”

English: For he knew that they had handed Him over because of envy.
Bahnar: Pilat băt hơđăl kơ lu 'bok soi tih ơh klai jao wă pơlôch Yêsu noh.

English: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, “Have nothing to do with that just Man, for I have suffered many things today in a dream because of Him.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Pilat oei tơ hnam sek tơlang, na akăn sư athei đe khan kơ klo sư thoi âu: “E 'nĕ pơm kơnê̆ kơ Yêsu hŏ, Sư ưh kơ đei yoch ôh. Inh sơ'ngon dêh yua kơ inh apo 'bôh tơdrong Sư măng hei hlĭch tơpă.”

English: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitudes that they should ask for Barabbas and destroy Jesus.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu đe 'bok soi tih păng lu đe kră sek tơlang pơtrŭt lu kon pơlei pơla athei Pilat tơlĕch kơ lu sư pôm 'Barra'ba na pơlôch Yêsu.

English: The governor answered and said to them, “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?” They said, “Barabbas!”
Bahnar: Pilat jet lu kon pơlei pơla dơ̆ng: “'Bar 'nu bre âu, iĕm wă kơ inh tơlĕch ăn kơ iĕm bu?” Na lu sư khan: “Nhôn wă kơ 'Barra'ba.”

English: Pilate said to them, “What then shall I do with Jesus who is called Christ?” They all said to him, “Let Him be crucified!”
Bahnar: Na Pilat khan: “Tơ̆ng lei, inh wă pơm kiơ kơ Yêsu mă đe anăn 'Bok Krist âu?” Na lu kon pơlei pơla khan: “Pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang.”

English: Then the governor said, “Why, what evil has He done?” But they cried out all the more, saying, “Let Him be crucified!”
Bahnar: Pilat khan kơ lu sư: “Kơlih kơ kiơ iĕm wă pơlôch Sư? Sư pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ?” Lu sư rai pơma re khan: “Pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang.”

English: When Pilate saw that he could not prevail at all, but rather that a tumult was rising, he took water and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, “I am innocent of the blood of this just Person. You see to it.”
Bahnar: Pilat pă kĕ pơjah pơjăng thoi yơ boih, yua kơ 'bơ̆r kon pơlei pơla re rai dêh, na Pilat sŏ đak ôp ti sư kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl păng khan: “Inh ưh kơ wă pơlôch ôh bơngai âu, iĕm đĕch wă pơlôch.”

English: And all the people answered and said, “His blood be on us and on our children.”
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kơ lu kon pơlei pơla ei khan: “Lê̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei phak nhôn păng lu kon nhôn kư̆m bưh yua kơ nhôn pơlôch Sư.”

English: Then he released Barabbas to them; and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered Him to be crucified.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na Pilat tơlĕch ăn kơ lu sư 'Barra'ba; sư athei lu linh sư teh tach Yêsu păng sơnguĕt păng pơjao kơ lu linh sư pơ̆ng pơlôch Yêsu tơ 'long pơglang.

English: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole garrison around Him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na lu linh Pilat anhăk Yêsu mơ̆t tơ hnam Pilat, akŭm băl đĭ kơ minh grŭp sư tơ noh.

English: And they stripped Him and put a scarlet robe on Him.
Bahnar: Lu linh ei plôh ao Yêsu, na pơhrŭk ăn kơ Sư ao tai 'brê pơm thoi pơtao.

English: When they had twisted a crown of thorns, they put it on His head, and a reed in His right hand. And they bowed the knee before Him and mocked Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
Bahnar: Păng lu sư iŏk tơlei jơla chuă pơm agăl na pơyơ̆l tơ kơ̆l Yêsu. Lu sư iŏk 'long jra ăn kơ Sư chĕp gah 'ma, na lu linh ei pơm sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh pơngiĕl kơ Sư, lu sư khan: “Kơkuh kơ Ih 'Bok Pơtao bơngai Juđê.”

English: Then they spat on Him, and took the reed and struck Him on the head.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơsoh pơ'brơh đak hai tơ akâu akar păng iŏk 'long đơ̆ng Sư chĕp noh tôn kơ̆l Sư.

English: And when they had mocked Him, they took the robe off Him, put His own clothes on Him, and led Him away to be crucified.
Bahnar: Lu sư che bơle đang boih na plôh ao tai 'brê noh, pơhrŭk ăn ao Sư kơdih dơ̆ng. Đơ̆ng noh lu sư anhăk Yêsu năm pơ̆ng pơlôch tơ 'long pơglang.

English: Now as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name. Him they compelled to bear His cross.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Simôn đơ̆ng Pơlei Siren. Sư năm brih trong ei na lu linh pơgŏ sư tôi kơ Yêsu 'long pơglang.

English: And when they had come to a place called Golgotha, that is to say, Place of a Skull
Bahnar: Lu linh anhăk Yêsu tơ anih đe anăn Gôlgôtha, wă khan anih kơting kơ̆l bơngai lôch.

English: they gave Him sour wine mingled with gall to drink. But when He had tasted it, He would not drink.
Bahnar: Lu sư ăn kơ Yêsu et sik bơlŭ hăm pơgang sơmren. Mă-lei Yêsu chŭm đĕch ưh kơ et ôh.

English: Then they crucified Him, and divided His garments, casting lots, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet: “They divided My garments among them, And for My clothing they cast lots.”
Bahnar: 'Blă kơ noh lu linh pơ̆ng Sư tơ 'long pơglang. Lu linh ei lu sư pơpơn dih băl wă kơ băt bu gơh iŏk ao Yêsu, bu iŏk ao ayơ, bu iŏk ao ayơ. Lu sư asong băl ao Yêsu thoi noh.

English: Sitting down, they kept watch over Him there.
Bahnar: Tôm tơdrong lu sư pơm đang boih, na lu sư tơoei ngôi lăng Yêsu.

English: And they put up over His head the accusation written against Him: THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Bahnar: Lu sư chih roi tơ gơ'bang iĕ pơ̆ng tơ kơpal kơ Yêsu khan tơdrong kơnê̆ đe jô̆ kơ Sư pơm thoi âu: “'Bok 'nâu, anăn sư Yêsu, 'Bok Pơtao đe Juđê.”

English: Then two robbers were crucified with Him, one on the right and another on the left.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m pơ̆ng pơlôch 'bar 'nu bơngai tơtông jê̆ hơdai Yêsu, minh 'nu gah 'ma, minh 'nu gah 'ngiĕo kơ Sư.

English: And those who passed by blasphemed Him, wagging their heads
Bahnar: Lu đe mă brŏk năm trong ei tơtreh kơ̆l păng tơhmăi Yêsu khan

English: and saying, “You who destroy the temple and build it in three days, save Yourself! If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross.”
Bahnar: “Hmăi Ih khan wă teng pơrăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm wă pơm plơ̆ng kơtĕch pêng năr. Tơdŏng akâu Ih kơdih wăi. Păng Ih khan Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, jur kơdih đơ̆ng 'long pơglang wăi.”

English: Likewise the chief priests also, mocking with the scribes and elders, said
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih, lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng đĭ lu đe kră sek tơlang kư̆m wang che bơle kơ Sư mơ̆n. Lu sư khan thoi âu

English: “He saved others; Himself He cannot save. If He is the King of Israel, let Him now come down from the cross, and we will believe Him.
Bahnar: “Sư gơh dŏng pơklaih đe, mă-lei Sư ưh kơ gơh dŏng pơklaih akâu Sư kơdih. Thoi Sư khan Sư Pơtao đe Isơrael, Sư athei jur kơdih đơ̆ng 'long pơglang dang ei hloi, na lu bơ̆n lui kơ Sư.

English: He trusted in God; let Him deliver Him now if He will have Him; for He said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”
Bahnar: Sư khan lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơgŭm Sư ling-lang păng Sư khan Sư Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, na bơ̆n gô lăng hăm 'bôh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơgŭm Sư tơpă dah ưh.”

English: Even the robbers who were crucified with Him reviled Him with the same thing.
Bahnar: 'Bar 'nu bơngai tơtông mă đe pơ̆ng hơdai Yêsu kư̆m hơdai pơjăm Sư thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Now from the sixth hour until the ninth hour there was darkness over all the land.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr dơ̆ng, glĭp măng mu jơ̆p kơ teh đak truh tơ pêng jơ kơsơ̆.

English: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” that is, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”
Bahnar: Lăp pêng jơ kơsơ̆ Yêsu pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Êli, Êli, lamma sabatthani,” wă khan: “Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ kiơ Ih achăng lê̆ Inh?”

English: Some of those who stood there, when they heard that, said, “This Man is calling for Elijah!”
Bahnar: Đei lu bơngai oei kiơ̆ ei lu sư kơtơ̆ng Yêsu pơma thoi noh, lu sư ngêh kơ Yêsu krao Êli. Lu sư khan: “Ei Sư krao Êli.”

English: Immediately one of them ran and took a sponge, filled it with sour wine and put it on a reed, and offered it to Him to drink.
Bahnar: Na đei minh 'nu bơngai kơdâu iŏk tơmam thoi tơpu dơyĕn, sư tong tơ đak sik 'nhŭ, kiĕn tơ 'long na tơ'mơn ăn kơ Yêsu hrip.

English: The rest said, “Let Him alone; let us see if Elijah will come to save Him.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai 'bơ̆t ei khan: “Bơ̆n gô lăng 'mơ̆i, hăm 'bôh Êli năm tơjur Sư đơ̆ng 'long pơglang tơpă dah ưh.”

English: And Jesus cried out again with a loud voice, and yielded up His spirit.
Bahnar: Yêsu ôr pơret dơ̆ng, na pơjao bơhngol Sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m hloi.

English: Then, behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom; and the earth quaked, and the rocks were split
Bahnar: Na che đe chô̆ pơgăn tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm tơhek chuơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk đơ̆ng kơpal tơ ala hloi. Teh adrŏ mơ'nưt mơ'nat păng tơmo kŭk mah pơchah.

English: and the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised
Bahnar: Lơ 'măng bơsat tơpơih kơdih, 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai mă lui kơ Sư lôch boih iung arih.

English: and coming out of the graves after His resurrection, they went into the holy city and appeared to many.
Bahnar: Lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng bơsat; đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Yêsu iung arih đơ̆ng lôch na lu sư mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, đei lơ bơngai tơ'bơ̆p 'bôh lu sư tơ noh.

English: So when the centurion and those with him, who were guarding Jesus, saw the earthquake and the things that had happened, they feared greatly, saying, “Truly this was the Son of God!”
Bahnar: 'Bok tih linh păng lu linh sư wei Yêsu, lu sư 'bôh teh adrŏ păng dôm tơdrong hlĭch noh, lu sư hli dêh, na lu sư khan: “Sư âu Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.”

English: And many women who followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering to Him, were there looking on from afar
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei lơ lu drŏ-kăn oei tơ anih đe pơlôch Yêsu noh, lu sư lăng đơ̆ng ataih. Lu drŏ-kăn noh đêl kiơ̆ awih awăn kơ Yêsu đơ̆ng dêh Galilê.

English: among whom were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.
Bahnar: Anăn lu sư mơ'nah: Mari đơ̆ng Pơlei Mađơla, Mari mĕ bre Yakơ hăm Yôsep păng minh 'nu mĕ bre Yakơ hăm Yôhan, 'bă bre sư Sêbêđê.

English: Now when evening had come, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who himself had also become a disciple of Jesus.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai mơdrŏng đơ̆ng Pơlei Armơthê, anăn sư Yôsep, sư kư̆m lui kơ Yêsu mơ̆n.

English: This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given to him.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr kơsơ̆ boih sư năm apinh Pilat wă iŏk 'bŭ atâu Yêsu na Pilat athei lu linh sư ăn kơ Yôsep iŏk 'bŭ atâu Yêsu.

English: When Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth
Bahnar: Yôsep iŏk atâu Yêsu ei, lôm păng che 'nao răt.

English: and laid it in his new tomb which he had hewn out of the rock; and he rolled a large stone against the door of the tomb, and departed.
Bahnar: Na sư năm 'măn atâu Yêsu tơ lăm bơsat tơmo mă sư 'nao pơm hiă kơdih. Sư tơgrŏl minh pôm tơnglơ̆p tơmo tih klơ̆p 'măng bơsat, đang boih na sư brŏk.

English: And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.
Bahnar: Mari đơ̆ng Pơlei Mađơla hăm Mari nai, bre sư oei ngôi jê̆ bơsat.

English: On the next day, which followed the Day of Preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees gathered together to Pilate
Bahnar: Năr Yêsu lôch noh, năr đe hơmet tôm tơdrong tơmam wă yua lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat. Na truh dơning, wă khan năr pơdơh Sa'bat, na lu 'bok soi tih hăm lu bơngai Pharisi năm akŭm păng Pilat.

English: saying, “Sir, we remember, while He was still alive, how that deceiver said, ‘After three days I will rise.’
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ Pilat: “Ơ 'bok, nhôn 'blŏk kơ bơngai hơlĕnh noh hơtai Sư oei arih Sư khan thoi âu: ‘Pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Inh lôch, Inh gô iung arih dơ̆ng.’

English: Therefore command that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest His disciples come by night and steal Him away, and say to the people, ‘He has risen from the dead.’ So the last deception will be worse than the first.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh na dang ei apinh ih asong ăn kơ nhôn linh ih năm gak bơsat Sư mă kơjăp kơtĕch pêng năr noh, hli kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư pơih tơtông iŏk akâu Yêsu na chă roi kơ đe khan Sư iung arih boih; păng hli kơ lu kon pơlei pơla lui kơ tơdrong lu sư chă roi kơ đe khan Yêsu iung arih noh kơjăp hloh kơ lu sư lui kơ Yêsu oei arih sơ̆.”

English: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard; go your way, make it as secure as you know how.”
Bahnar: Na Pilat khan: “Kư̆m bưh mơ̆n, iĕm khan kơ linh gak 'măng bơsat Sư mă brĕ hŏ.”

English: So they went and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone and setting the guard.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na lu sư anhăk lu linh ei tơ bơsat. Lu sư pik đak 'blit tơ minh dăng hla bơar pơklep kơ 'măng tơmo, kuă ăn đe mơ̆t; păng dah đe mơ̆t lu sư kư̆m băt hloi. Păng pơkă kơ lu linh gak 'măng bơsat noh mă brĕ. Đang boih na lu sư brŏk.

English: Now after the Sabbath, as the first day of the week began to dawn, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ năr pơdơh Sa'bat boih, lăp 'brưch hơdah til pơgê hrôih năr mônh, na Mari đơ̆ng Pơlei Mađơla hăm Mari nai bre sư năm lăng bơsat Yêsu.

English: And behold, there was a great earthquake; for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat on it.
Bahnar: Na teh adrŏ mơ'nưt mơ'nat hloi, yua kơ linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang jur đơ̆ng plĕnh pơih ăn 'măng bơsat Yêsu. Linh jang ei tơoei kơpal tơnglơ̆p tơmo noh.

English: His countenance was like lightning, and his clothing as white as snow.
Bahnar: Lăng sư nhen lĕ kơmlat, ao sư rang kok dêh.

English: And the guards shook for fear of him, and became like dead men.
Bahnar: Lu linh gak bơsat hli tơrơ mah lôch hơngơ̆t.

English: But the angel answered and said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus who was crucified.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng khan kơ bre drŏ-kăn noh khan: “Biĕm 'nĕ kơ hli, inh băt kơ biĕm năm tơ âu chă Yêsu mă đe pơ̆ng pơlôch tơ 'long pơglang.

English: He is not here; for He is risen, as He said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.
Bahnar: Dang ei Sư ưh pă oei tơ âu boih yua kơ Sư iung arih thoi Sư khan hmă. Tơ̆ng biĕm ưh kơ lui apinh biĕm năm lăng anih đêl đe tơ'bĭch Sư âu.

English: And go quickly and tell His disciples that He is risen from the dead, and indeed He is going before you into Galilee; there you will see Him. Behold, I have told you.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei biĕm năm hloi tơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Sư đơ̆ng lôch boih, Sư wă năm tơ dêh Galilê hơdrol kơ iĕm, iĕm gô tơ'bơ̆p Sư tơ noh.’ Biĕm 'nĕ hiơt tơdrong Inh khan kơ biĕm âu hŏ.”

English: So they went out quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring His disciples word.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh bre sư kơdâu năm roi kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu tơdrong mă bre sư 'bôh noh hei. Kơplah bre sư kơdâu rok trong, jơhngơ̆m bre sư hiôk dêh na minh pah đon bre sư tơchĕng hli rah dai.

English: And as they went to tell His disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Rejoice!” So they came and held Him by the feet and worshiped Him.
Bahnar: Kơplah bre sư kơdâu rok trong Yêsu tơ'bơ̆p bre sư păng khan: “Liĕm akâu hiôk-hian kơ bơ̆n.” Bre sư năm jê̆ Yêsu rôp jơ̆ng Sư na kơkuh kơ Sư.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell My brethren to go to Galilee, and there they will see Me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Biĕm 'nĕ pă hli, biĕm jah năm khan kơ lu 'nhŏng oh Inh athei lu sư năm tơ dêh Galilê, lu sư gô tơ'bơ̆p Inh tơ noh hloi.”

English: Now while they were going, behold, some of the guard came into the city and reported to the chief priests all the things that had happened.
Bahnar: Kơplah bre drŏ-kăn noh kơdâu năm roi kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu, lu linh gak 'măng bơsat, lu sư mơ'nah wih tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem roi kơ lu 'bok soi tih dôm tơdrong lu sư 'bôh.

English: When they had assembled with the elders and consulted together, they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok soi tih pơđâu băl păng lu đe kră sek tơlang wă apah lu linh gak jên lơ

English: saying, “Tell them, ‘His disciples came at night and stole Him away while we slept.’
Bahnar: wă kơ lu sư chă roi kơ đe khan lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu tơtông iŏk akâu Yêsu boih kơplah lu linh oei tep kơmăng.

English: And if this comes to the governor’s ears, we will appease him and make you secure.”
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih khan kơ lu linh dơ̆ng: “Dah 'bok tih Pilat kơtơ̆ng tơdrong âu, hli kơ sư hil kơ iĕm, lê̆ nhôn pơlung sư wă kơ iĕm huay kơ hli.”

English: So they took the money and did as they were instructed; and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu linh ei iŏk jên noh pơm kiơ̆ thoi lu 'bok soi khan. Lu sư hơlĕnh kơ lu bơngai Juđê. Na lu bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei, lu sư khan lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu tơtông iŏk akâu Yêsu tơpă.

English: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had appointed for them.
Bahnar: Mơjĭt-mônh 'nu lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu, lu sư năm tơ dêh Galilê. Lu sư tŏk tơ kông mă đêl Yêsu pơkă kơ lu sư.

English: When they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some doubted.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư 'bôh Yêsu boih, lu sư kơkuh bơnê kơ Yêsu. Mă-lei đei lu mơ'nah ưh tam gan lui kơ to 'noh Yêsu.

English: And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm jê̆ lu sư păng khan: “'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh gơh pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng plĕnh hăm teh.

English: Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit
Bahnar: Thoi noh năm bĕ lu iĕm, bơtho kơ đĭ-đăng lu khŭl bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak, athei lu sư lui kiơ̆ kơ Inh, pơm 'batem kơ lu sư krao anăn Yang 'Bă, Yang Kon, hăm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng wă kơ đe nai băt kơ lu sư lui boih.

English: teaching them to observe all things that I have commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Amen.
Bahnar: Bơtho kơ lu sư pơm kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong Inh đei pơkă kơ lu iĕm. Inh oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm ling-lang truh năr tôch ning-mônh.”
